loans.name: Suluga

texts.en:
Suluga is 41 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Suluga has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, etc. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Suluga will plan to extend her old business and develop another great business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Fiapai

texts.en:
Fiapai is a 32 years old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Fiapai has requested a loan to vegetable seeds, weeds sprayer, fertilizer, rakes, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. With her profits, Fiapai hopes to extend her business to earn more income for living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rakes, wheel barrow, bush knives, plastic bags, weeds sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is a 39-year-old married woman with four children (all attend school). Denia works very hard to provide for them.

Denia has run a general store for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, and personal care products.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, and personal care products.

loans.name: Diomenda

texts.en:
Diomenda is a 51-year-old married woman with two children (one attends school).

Diomenda has raised pigs for 10 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 52-year-old married woman with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 2 years. She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods and personal care products.

Linda has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from electronic mobile loads.

She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 23 years old very active and hard working married with one child. He owns a salt pan which he inherited from the parents since 2010 and sells crude salt. He owns a general merchandise shop as an additional source of income. He has hopes of being a rich man in future.

However,he is affected by the government not putting up factories to process the salt which hinders his dream since he sells the salt cheaply in the local market. Stephen is requesting for a loan to buy more crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy more crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old and married with three children, one child still in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods, noodles, canned goods, spices, milk, coffee drinks, shampoo etc.

Wilma has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, noodles, canned goods, spices, milk, coffee drinks, shampoo etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to  buy additional manicuring set, nipper, nail polish and other materials for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional manicuring set, nipper, nail polish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is taking out another Kiva loan of Kshs 50,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Mbeyu plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.

She is giving thanks to Kiva lender and Yehu for the opportunity given as it has improved her family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming as her business.

loans.name: Jlg-005(A)-Pudhupalayam Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of 3, led by Ranjitha, living in Kulithalai in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But they do not have the means to build one. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. They are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and insect or animal bites.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build toilets in their homes

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mkambe has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mkambe dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 25 year old woman with a partner and 1 child.She has a small plantation and grows cabbages and tomatoes in her community for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Sofia has requested a loan to fertilizers, wheel barrow, rakes, vegetable seeds, weeds sprayer, plastic bags, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Sofia hopes to spend it to extend her business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wheel barrow, rakes, bush knives, fertilizers, weeds sprayer, vegetable seeds, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Ashurmo

texts.en:
Ashurmo was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into the family of workers. She is widow and has two children and for more than ten years she has worked at a hospital in her area. She well knows her duty and likes to be a nurse. She is hardworking, talented, responsible and bright person. She also does business at home. She keeps livestock and growth them for further selling. She gets enough income to ensure her family.

She heard about IMON’s opportunity for students. She applied to IMON to get a loan to pay higher education costs of her child. She is wants her child to be educated and get a higher education degree. She wishes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs of her child

loans.name: Savri

texts.en:
Savri has a genuine love for sewing. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. She is married and has one child. For about 15 years, she had been operating a business serving Tajik women with traditional dresses. She is living in a village. She has regular customers. She also sews traditional blankets. She sells her dresses at acceptable prices.

She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for financial support to be treated at a hospital and then relax. Her business activity tires her, and it would be better if she could recover. She would have an opportunity to make her business more effective while she gets treatment. She hopes to be understood and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a buy and sell fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of fertilized duck egg to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 2 years now.
In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of fertilized duck egg to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 45 years old and all four children are attend in school.

Jocelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 48 years old and has four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is the guardian of her family. He operates a mobile shop, which he has been doing for three years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories, such as chargers, batteries, hands free, blue tooth devices, etc. He has built very good relations with his customers. 

Shahida requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her son will use to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories, such as batteries, chargers, hands free, and  blue tooth devices, to increase his business. With the help of this loan, her son will be able to purchase relevant items for his business and earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

loans.use: to invest in her son's mobile shop

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with five children. Marlyn is 31 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Marlyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gear, fish nets, gasoline and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gear, fish nets, gasoline and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a woman with four children. Myrna is 40 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Myrna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Myrna requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pipiimaleeleele

texts.en:
Pipiimaleeleele is 22 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling donuts, pork buns, pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.
Pipiimaleeleele has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, spoons, etc. . She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pipiimaleeleele will use it to start a bakery and to support her family finacially.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, spoons, etc.

loans.name: La Palapa Group

texts.es:
A orillas de la carretera se encuentra  uno de los poblados donde se conserva en un 90% la cultura e idioma mazateco, los habitantes han entregado parte de su vida al campo en la siembra de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol y algunos más en la pesca, debido a las dificultades económicas y a la falta de escuelas la mayoría de los adultos no sabe escribir, aunque cabe hacer mención de quienes se han esforzado un poco más y han aprendido a leer y escribir ahora que son adultos.
En la comunidad antes mencionada se ha formado el grupo llamado la palapa, mismo que debe su nombre a la palapa que está en casa de doña Rosa, el grupo lo integran:
Rosa-Refresco Y Pan
Virginia, Sofía – Antojitos 
Hilarina – Pollo Rostizado, Refrescos Y Pan
Esther- Refresco Y Golosinas 
Eligio –Pollo 
Doña rosa es una de las personas adultas que no sabe leer no escribir más con el tiempo ha aprendido a realizar operaciones básicas y la denominación de las monedas y billetes, está casada con el señor  Rufino quien trabaja en el campo desde que era un adolescente, actualmente de ellos depende un nieto de 12 años, desde hace 8 años cuando su nieto llego a casa fue la inspiración para doña Rosa quien inicio con la venta de refrescos de diferentes sabores y tamaños, jugos, agua mineral, con las ganancias obtenidas logro comprar un refrigerador más grande, a los 6 meses de iniciar con la venta de refresco sus clientes le sugirieron vendiera pan e inicio con una segunda actividad desde entonces de san miguel soyaltepec le llevan diariamente un gran canasto de pan hasta la puerta de su casa.
Al ver que el pan y los refrescos hicieron buena combinación y sus ganancias asi lo demostraban decidió construir una palapa (área con techo de palma) para poder colocar el canasto del pan sea temporada de lluvia o de seca, recientemente con las ganancias logro cambiar la palma pues ya estaba deteriorada
“Los préstamos otorgados anteriormente me han ayudado para hoy en día tener  lo que tengo y continuar con mis actividades” son las palabras de doña Rosa quien comenta que en esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, jugos y agua mineral de diferentes tamaños, ella comento que lo que más le importa es el bienestar de su familia y  de su nieto al cual trata y ve como un hijo.” 
“no tenemos las palabras adecuadas para agradecer todo lo que hacen por nosotros al brindarnos un préstamo” son las palabras de algunos integrantes del grupo.
*en la fotografía se aprecia a los miembros de la palapa, doña Rosa es quien viste blusa a rayas blanco con gris.
texts.en:
Just off a highway is found one of the towns that preserves 90% of its culture and the Mazateco language.  The residents here work in the fields cultivating sugar, corn, and beans.  Others work as fishermen.  Due to financial difficulties and the lack of schools, most of the adults do not know how to write, although it is worth  mentioning that some have put in more effort and have learned to read and write now that they are adults.  In this community, a communal bank has formed named "La Palapa" (palm roof), just like the roof that is on Rosa's house.  This group includes Rosa, who formed the group, and sells beverages and bread.  Also included are:
Virginia and, Sofía – who sell snacks
Hilarina – who sells roasted chicken, drinks and bread
Esther- who sells drinks and snacks
Eligio – who sells chicken

Rosa is one of the adults who does not know how to read or write.  Over time she has learned to carry out basic operations and change money and bills.  She is married to Rufino, who has been a farmer ever since he was an adolescent. At this time they have a dependent grandson who is 12 years old.  Rosa was inspired to start her business 8 years ago when her grandson came to live with her.  She sells a variety of flavors and sizes of drinks, juices, and mineral water.  With her earnings, she managed to buy a larger refrigerator.  

Six months after starting her drink business her customers suggested that she sell bread as well, and so she started a second business activity at that time.  Ever since, she goes daily to San Miguel Soyaltepec to carry a large basket of bread back to her house.  Seeing that bread and drinks made a good combination, which improve her profits, she decided to build a palapa (a gazebo with a palm roof) where she could put her basket of bread no matter if it was the rainy or dry season.  Recently, with her earnings, she managed to replace the palm fronds that had deteriorated.

"The previous loans that I was granted helped me so that today I have what I have and can continue with my activities," are the words of Rosa, who comments that at this time she will invest the loan in the purchase of drinks, juices, and different sized bottles of mineral water.  She states that what is most important is the well-being of her family and her grandson, who she treats and sees as a son. "Words can't even convey how much we appreciate everything that you are doing for us by providing this loan," are the words of some members of the group.

Note:  in the photograph the members of the "La Palapa" communal bank are seen.  Rosa is the one wearing a white and grey striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell

location.town: Cosolapa Caracol, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona is a clever girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She lives in a big beautiful, scenic city with her parents. She has a dream of being a teacher, the same as her mother when she was a child. She has always wished to be useful and help with the social progress of her neighbours.

In 2014 she graduated from high school and entered university. She has chosen to be a teacher. Recently, her studies are going well and she gets only excellent grades and good marks. She studies by contract at the university. That is why she has to pay tuition fees at times. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to pay her higher education costs.

She hopes and wishes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 44 years old and has six children. Daylin is married and has five children are still in school.

Daylin is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Daylin requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daylin has been in this business for 1 year now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming oysters in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilou dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Analey

texts.en:
Analey is a married woman with four children. Analey is 41 years old and has four children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analey has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Analey requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 50 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, bread, milk, coffee, drinks and etc. Mercy has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, bread, milk, coffee, drinks and etc

loans.name: Zhanan

texts.ru: Жанан, 55 лет, замужем, есть 6 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2000 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Жанан есть 5 дойных коров, 2 бычка, 18 овец и лошадь. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Жанан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жанан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Zhanan is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has secondary education.

As a main source of income for her family, Zhanan works with livestock breeding. She started her own business in 2000 and has developed it since. Zhanan has five dairy cows, two bulls, 18 sheep and a horse on her farm. She sells milk on a daily basis.

Zhanan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase bull-calves to fatten and resell. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business. She also wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Jlg-004-Karupathur Group

texts.en:
Malarkodi lives in Kulithalai in the rural part of Karur, Tamil Nadu. She is 35 years old and a mother of 1 child. She works as a daily wage labourer in addition to managing the household chores. She does not have a toilet in her house. Malarkodi and her family are forced to defecate in the open.

Malarkodi has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai. All 3 group members work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and insect or animal bites.

They now seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to fund the installation of toilets in their homes

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 40-year-old housewife, lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of two children. Her husband, the only wage-earning person in the family, delivers luggage, grass, and water by using Rickshaw. He values the rickshaw more than any other possession, because it can make money for him to sustain their family life.

He needs capital for the maintenance of the rickshaw. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to pay for the maintenance. Therefore his wife Mussarat, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Mussarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Ruzimoh

texts.en:
Ruzimoh was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a master of reconstruction. Many years she has does business in agriculture. She keeps and sells livestock in her village. For the first time she started doing business with calves, then increased at amount. Recently she has 13 calves. She likes her business very much. She tries to be gentle and take care of her calves.

Her son is sick. She is concerned for him. By at the moment she has no money to treat him at a medical clinic. She decided to get a loan from IMON and pay medical service to treat her son. She hopes her son will be healed and continue his studies. She awaits Kiva support.

loans.use: to treat her son at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old, widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a general store business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana May is 25 years old and has one child still in school.

Ana May has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Ana May requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional more sacks of charcoal.

Ana May has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 63 years old, widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thottiyam Jlg-054 Group

texts.en:
Parimala is the leader of the Thottiyam JLG – 054 group and the group has 4 other members. Amutha, Kavitha, Saroja and Valarmathi are the other members of the group. Pramila is 34 and a mother of two. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family. To this end, she underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in embellishing sarees with semi-precious stones.

Now, she, along with the other members in the group are seeking a loan to start a business from home. Amutha will pursue the same business in stone-work on sarees, The other members will start home-based businesses in making mixed spice powders. The income from the business will help them boost their income, and save more in the long run, for their children's education, and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to buy semi-precious stones and sarees for embroidery work.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a selling fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Payas

texts.en:
Payas is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Payas is 27 years old and has one child still in school.

Payas has a fishing business in the Philippines. Payas requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fishing nets, hooks, rope, bamboo and other materials.

Payas has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing nets, hooks, rope, bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Rachelle Anne

texts.en:
Rachelle Anne works hard to support her family. Rachelle Anne is single and has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines.

Rachelle Anne requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Rachelle Anne has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Esther, a 33-year-old farmer from the remote village of Koibarak, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is no clean water nor electrical connections. Esther lives with her lovely family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Esther's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Esther made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan for expanding her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to Esther's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Esther’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is very thankful to Kivafor the loan granted to him in the amount of PhP 20,000 in which he bought other valued fish and other seafood items, including tilapia, salmon, and squid. With more fish to sell Danilo's income increase. He was able to pay his loan on time and the revenue of his income pays for the continues education of his child and everyday expenses.

Just recently Danilo was hospitalized because of the huge wart that bleeds in his ring finger. He has a minor operation and was able to pay through his savings from the income of his business.

Danilo is requesting a reloan in the amount of PhP 20,000 to buy more valued fish and other seafood products such as milkfish, tilapia, squid and shrimps which are now in-demand by his customers and abundant during rainy season.

With the new loan Danilo hopes to increase his income with more fish and seafood to sell to his customers. Danilo is continuously working hard to provide for his family especially for last his child education and increase his savings in case of unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy more valued fish and other seafood products such as milkfish, tilapia, squid and shrimps  which are now in-demand by his customers.

loans.name: Las Inocentes Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido a la comunidad se pueden apreciar diferentes paisajes y negocios establecidos a orillas de la carretera tales como; puestos de frutas, doraditas de coco; jugo de piña, gasolineras, y las talacheras, de igual manera se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña de azúcar lo que indica la gran producción de un endulzante natural en la región, en una comunidad  dividida en dos por la carretera se ha formalizado un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Las Inocentes puesto que son puras  mujeres .
Las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son.
Antonia-Refresco
Enriqueta- Comida
Maria-Despacho
Rosaivana- Refresco Y Chucherías 
Alejandra-Tortillas
Juana, Karina- Zapatos 
Margarita-Abarrotes 
A sus 47 años doña margarita es más fuerte que un roble en la colonia todos le conocen como Mago, hace 8 años decidió iniciar con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para no sentirse sola, para no depender de sus hijos pues acababa de enviudar, desde entonces ha solventado los gastos del hogar con ayuda de las ganancias, el apoyo económico de sus hijos, doña mago comenta que está muy a gusto con su tienda pues todo el día está activa atendiendo a sus clientes, sus amistades más cercanas cuando acuden a comprar  aprovechan para platicar.
para poder iniciar con la tienda realizo algunas adecuaciones, cambio una pequeña puerta por un portón de dos hojas que se abre hacia los lados, compro anaqueles de metal  donde exhibe la mercancía, cuando el portón está abierto es símbolo de que ya hay servicio aun así si uno de sus clientes necesita cerillo, sopa, agua, refrescó o recarga de tiempo aire  les despacha si es que aún no se duerme, en el primer ciclo invirtió el préstamo en la compra de azúcar, arroz, frijol, detergente, sabritas y galletas por lo tanto en esta ocasión invertirá en la compra de frijol, sopa, huevos, aceite, cerillos ,queso debido a que son los productos con mayor demanda.
“gracias por hacer que clientes como yo se sientan plenos con su actividad al hacer uso adecuado de los préstamos que nos brindar, por ayudarnos para continuar con nuestra actividad o para iniciar una” 
*la fotografía fue tomada fuera de la tienda de doña Mago quien viste blusa verde y short a cuadros.
texts.en:
During a trip through the community, one can appreciate the different scenes and established businesses along the sides of the highway, such as fruit stands, golden brown coconuts, pineapple juice, gas stations, and mechanics' shops. In the same way, one can appreciate plantings of sugar cane, which indicate the great production of a natural sweetener in the region. In a community that is divided in two by the highway, a group has formed that bears the name "Las Inocentes" (The Innocents) because they are pure women.

The members of the group and their businesses are: Antonia, soft drinks; Enriqueta, food; Maria, store; Rosalvana, soft drinks and snacks; Alejandra, tortillas; Juana and Karina, shoes; and Margarita, groceries.

At her age of 47, Doña Margarita is stronger than an oak. In the neighborhood, she is known as Mago. Eight years ago, she decided to set up a little grocery store so that she didn't feel alone and so that she didn't have to depend on her children, since she had just been widowed. Since then she has paid the household expenses with the help of the earnings and the economic support of her children. Doña Mago comments that she is very happy with her store, since all day she is busy serving her customers. When her closest friends come to buy, they take advantage of the opportunity to chat.

In order to set up the store, she made some modifications. She changed a little door to two panels that open toward the the sides. She bought metal shelves where she displays the merchandise. When the doors are open, it is a symbol that there is service. Even so, if one of her customers needs matches, soup, water, soft drinks, or an air time [cell phone] recharge, she serves them if she is not yet asleep. In the first loan cycle, she invested the loan in the purchase of sugar, rice, beans, detergents, Sabrita [brand] snacks, and crackers.  This time, she will invest in the purchase of beans, soup, eggs, oil, matches, and cheese, since these are the products with the greatest demand.

"Thank you for making the clients such as myself feel fulfilled in their businesses from making appropriate use of the loans that you offer us to help us continue with our businesses or to begin one."

The photograph was taken outside of Doña Mago's store. She is wearing the blue-green blouse and plaid shorts.

loans.use: to buy beans, soup, eggs, oil, matches, and cheese

location.town: La Reforma, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan  is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Susan  has a buy and sell native mats business in the Philippines. Susan  requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of native mats to sell.

Susan  has been in this business for 11 years. Susan  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native mats to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. Esperanza is widowed and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Esperanza requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Esperanza has been in this business for 1 year now.

Esperanza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Gerlinda

texts.en:
Gerlinda has a live-in partner with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gerlinda is 30 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Gerlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gerlinda requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Gerlinda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Gerlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky works hard to support her family. Jinky is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jinky requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Jinky has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thusur Jlg - 006 Group

texts.en:
Devika is a 37 year old entrepreneur who leads the group Thusur JLG - 006. She lives with her family in Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu. Devika had been involved in daily wage earning to support her family financially. The income that the family brings in isn't enough to bear the household expenses. Devika wishes to start her own business to generate more income.

She has been trained in making foot mats and wishes to start her own business. At the moment Devika lacks the funds required to initiate the business and seeks an enterprise loan.

She is joined by the rest of the members of the group in seeking a loan. Your loan would help these women kick start their respective businesses.

loans.use: to start a business of foot mat making.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Meet Isabella, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Kitale area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment of Kenya. Isabella, 27, has been farming for the past 5 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Isabella is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and once the crops are ready for harvest she can sell them. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds for planting. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for crop produce. This means that Isabella could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Isabella, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Isabella believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for crops. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Isabella to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.ru: Жанна, 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жанны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова. На 0,7 ГА выращивает клевер, картофель, помидоры и прочие овощи для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на полеводство и выращивание органических овощей, часть средств потратит на постройку сарая для скота, чтобы содержать в нем животных в зимний период. Доходы от кредита Жанна планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также Жанна мечтает построить большой и красивый дом для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Zhanna is 40 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 4,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has one cow on her farm as well as 0.7 hectares of land where she grows clover, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables both for sale and for her own use. Her monthly income is 6,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhanna has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables. A portion of the money will go toward building a livestock barn, and she also dreams of building a big, beautiful house for her family.

loans.use: to cultivate her land to grow organic vegetables, and to build a livestock barn

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. Saturnina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Saturnina requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, sticky rice, coconut, etc. for her food production business.

Saturnina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Saturnina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, sticky rice, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Letecia has been in pig fattening  for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy crappie fish and three buckets.

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es:
Las sirenas llevan por nombre el grupo integrado por 8 clientes todos ellos originarios de la misma ciudad, perteneciente a una zona cañera y ganadera donde la mayoría de los habitantes entregan parte de su vida al campo, cabe hacer mención que la ganadería juega parte importante de la economía, la producción de leche  hace posible haya productores de queso, jarocho, Cotija, de hebra y seco el cual distribuyen en comunidades diferentes.
El nombre del grupo lo eligieron por el misticismo de las sirenas, los integrantes son:
Josefina -Refresco
María T– cosméticos, Plata y Oro Laminado 
Candelaria –Antojitos 
Elia – Fruta De Temporada 
María C-  Comida 
Andrea – Postres Y Zapatos 
Itzel –Artículos Domésticos
Norma – Cosméticos 
 Doña María T tiene 45 años de edad, todos le conocen como Mari, desde hace 25 años formo una familia con el señor Esteban, con quien procreó 2 hijos mayores de edad hoy en día, doña Mari siempre se ha dedicado a la venta ambulante para apoyar a su padres con los gastos de la casa, hace 6 años retomo la venta de ropa interior por catálogo gracias a su primer préstamo otorgado poco después decidió cambiar de actividad puesto que las ganancias disminuyeron e inicio con la venta de cosméticos por catálogo , las ganancias obtenidas y uno de los prestamos le permitieron a su vez iniciar con la venta de bisutería de oro laminado y plata, recorriendo las calles de la comunidad para mostrar los catálogos, entregar el pedido y ofrecer pulseras, anillos, cadenas, dijes, aretes .
“me gusta visitar a mis clientes, caminar me hace bien y sobre todo si obtengo ganancias” son las palabras de doña mari quien ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar  pulseras, aretes, anillos, labiales, sombras y cremas que le han solicitado sus clientas.
El bienestar de sus hijos y el estudio que les brindaron fueron solventados con el sueldo de su esposo y las ganancias obtenidas, actualmente con las ganancias  apoya a su esposo con los gastos, cubre el pago de las cuotas del préstamo, solventa sus gastos personales.
“Gracias por creer en nosotros al otorgarnos nuevos préstamos para nuestras actividades logrando con ellas mejorar la calidad de vida de nuestra familia” son las palabras del grupo las sirenas.
*la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de doña Josefina la madre de doña Mari trae falda negra.
texts.en:
Las Sirenas (The Mermaids) is the name of the group made up of 8 clients, all of them originating from the same city, belonging to a sugar cane region that also has a lot of cattle raising, where the majority of the people give part of their life to the field. It is important to mention that cattle raising plays an important part in the economy as the production of milk allows there to be cheese producers of various types (Jarocho, Cotija, Hebra and dry). The cheeses are distributed to different communities.

The name of the group was chosen due to the mysticism of mermaids. The members are:
Josefina – Refreshments
Maria T– Cosmetics, Silver and Gold Leaf Costume Jewelery
Candelaria – Snacks
Elia – In-season Fruit
Maria C – Food
Andrea – Desserts and shoes
Itzel – Domestic items
Norma – Cosmetics

Mrs. Maria T is 45 years old, everyone knows her as Mari. 25 years ago she established a family with Mr. Esteban, who she had 2 children with, both now of age. Mrs. Mari has always made a living as a street vendor to support her parents and the expenses at home.
6 years ago she resumed her sale of underwear via catalog thanks to the first loan she was granted. A short time later she decided to change her activity because the income decreased and she began selling cosmetics via catalog. The earnings obtained and one of the loans allowed her to eventually begin selling gold and silver leaf costume jewelery. She travels the streets of the community showing the catalogs, delivering orders and offering bracelets, rings, chains, charms and earrings.

"I like visiting my clients, walking is good for me and especially if I obtain a profit" says Mrs. Mari who is requesting a new loan to purchase bracelets, earrings, rings, lipsticks, eye shadows and creams that her clients have requested.

Her children's well-being and the studies they were able to provide for them were funded by her husbands salary and the profits she acquired. Currently she uses these profits to help her husband with the expenses, cover loan payments and pay for her personal expenses.

"Thank you for believing in us and granting us new loans for our activities through which we are able to improve our quality of life and our family's as well" are the words of the group "The Mermaids."

*the photograph is taken in the patio of Mrs. Josefina's house. Mrs. Josefina is Mrs. Mari's mother and wears the black skirt.

loans.use: purchase: bracelets, earrings, rings, lipsticks, eye shadows and creams

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 19 novembre  2004. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même quartier. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et  l'embouche.
MAREME debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3  garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire du commerce de savon, d'omo. Elle fait parallèlement de la restauration  dans les marchés hebdomadaires et aussi de l'embouche. Elle achète 3 sacs d'omo à 15 000 FCFA, 4 cartons de savons à 4 000 FCFA l'unité. Le carton fait 20 savons.Elle revend l'omo et les savons en détail. Pour la restauration, elle achète 3 sac de riz parfumé le sac à 17500 FCFA. Elle achète 4 bidons d'huile de 20 litre chacun  à 15 000 FCFA l'un. Elle achète aussi des légumes pour la restauration. Pour l'embouche, elle va acheter 1 veau à 125 000 FCFA et le revend après élevage à 200 000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin 1 mouton  à 70 000 FCFA et le revend à 100 000 FCFA. 
Les bénéfices serviront à répondre aux charges familiales et aussi satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 5 members belongs to the Banc Villageois created on November 19, 2004. It consists of women who live in the same district. They all get along and share a bond of solidarity. Their main activities are commerce and animal fattening.

Mareme, age 29, is the member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is married with three sons. This loan will help her to sell soap and Omo detergent, but she also sells prepared food at the weekly markets, and she practices animal fattening. She plans to purchase three bags of Omo detergent for 15,000 FCFA and four 20-unit boxes of soap for 4,000 FCFA each to sell at retail; for the food sales, she will buy three bags of scented rice at 17,500 FCFA each, four 20-liter jugs of oil at 15,000 FCFA each, and some vegetables; finally, she will buy one calf for 125,000 FCFA to raise and sell for 200,000 FCFA, and one sheep for 70 000 FCFA to sell for 100,000 FCFA.

Her profits will help her to support herself and to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap, Omo detergent, rice, oil, vegetables, one calf and one sheep.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Juvelyn has been in this business for 2 years. Juvelyn earns more income from general store.

Juvelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, sanitary pads, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.
Josephine has been in this business for 2 years.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, sanitary pads, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 21 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her young husband, her parents and her sister. Her family owns 2 hectares of cassava fields, 2 hectares of rice fields and 8 pigs.

In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyleak makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, fertilizer for the field and food for the pigs. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosana is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Nagaiyanallur Jlg-001 Group

texts.en:
Sathya is a 32 years old woman and represents the group Nagaiyanallur JLG – 001. She lives in the Tiruchirappalli district of Tamil Nadu with her family. Sathya is a hard working lady and has been engaged in daily wage earning but the income generated is not enough to make ends meet. It is difficult for her to fund her children's education besides bearing the household expenses.

Sathya wishes to start her own business of saree stone work for which she had taken training. She believes that the income generated from the business will help her family to lead a happier life. Similarly, the rest of the group members also want to start businesses of their own. Your loan will help them increase their income earning capacities and contribute to their family income.

loans.use: to start a business of saree stone work.

loans.name: Genia

texts.en:
Genia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genia is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Genia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Genia requested a 4,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Genia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Genia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is living at Solana with her family. She is selling vegetables for income. She had been in her business for about 10 years now. Monica wanted to keep improving her sales and in need for additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell. She is now asking for a loan of P22,000 to buy more vegetables to sell. She will buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions and squash. She will also invest some fund in the farming business. She hopes to improve her earnings someday.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He has a child currently who is in Elementary level and he operates a food stall just in front of Bagong Milenyo Mall in Pasay City. He sells ready to eat foods in styrofoam, coffee and hamburgers. Employees from Bagong Milenyo Mall are typically his patrons.

Julio is hardworking, he aims to have the business expanded and add products to sell. Each month his total earnings is about P20,000 enough to support his child’s educational expenses and day-to-day expenditures. It’s just him working for the family that is why he is dedicated to make a living and earn profit.

Julio applied for a loan of Php 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, sachets of coffee, styrofoam, ingredients for making hamburger, cooking oil and other condiments. He believes that CCT will help him by granting the loan amount since he needs supporting capital in running the business.

Julio believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. He is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share his own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy sachets of coffee, Styrofoam, canned goods, ingredients for making hamburger, cooking oil and other condiments.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenalyn is 31 years old and has one child in school.

Jenalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorry Jane

texts.en:
Lorry Jane is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorry Jane is 19 years old now.

Lorry Jane has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines. Lorry Jane requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Lorry Jane has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lorry Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 33 years old, with three children. With two children in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, candies, personal product care, and other groceries.

Marichu has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, candies, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Almarie

texts.en:
Almarie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Almarie is 37 years old and has one child who is in school.

Almarie has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Almarie requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish making.

Almarie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Almarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish making.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is the age of 35; she is mother of two daughters and two sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.

Therefore,Perveen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Perveen is much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florenda is 51 years old now.

Florenda has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Florenda requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Florenda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Florenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Ninita

texts.en:
Ninita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc.

Ninita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc

loans.name: Junbai Group

texts.en:
Sangita, the group leader of Junbai Group, lives with her family of 3 in Assam in the North - Eastern part of India. She runs a small clothing business at home. She realised the need to increase her savings to secure her children’s future. She feels that their existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is seeking a loan for purchasing sarees, nighties, blouses, salwar pieces, etc. The other members of the group are also involved in various income generating activities and want to expand their businesses. Hence they decided to form a group and applied for a loan. They are well aware of the group rules and agreed to abide by them. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her clothing business and sell sarees, blouses, salwar pieces, etc.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is 30 years old and she is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region.

She is a dairy farmer. She is an intelligent and steady woman. Gunay has experience but she wants to develop herself in this job. She started this work three years ago. When she was young she started this business with an amount of small capital.

Gunay grew up in her village and is attached to this place and her family, so she does this work with great love and passion. Now Gunay wants to grow her business and buy a few more cows to improve both her business and family conditions. For that reason, Kiva lenders should support Gunay.

loans.use: to grow her business and buy a few more cows to improve both her business and family conditions

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old, married and had two children. She is raising hogs to sell as source of income and her spouse is a farmer. She uses her profits for education purposes. She would like to increase her earnings to cover school fees.

She is now asking for a loan of P18,000 to buy feed and medicines for hogs sustenance. This will help improve growth and nutrition to hogs. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs sustenance

loans.name: Mary Jo

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Mary Jo works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell gasoline.  Mary Jo is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to  buy variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mary Jo has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 51 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Florencia works very hard to provide for them.

Florencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Florencia has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
Rosielyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosielyn is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosielyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosielyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Rosielyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rosielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to  buy more charcoal to sell for her buy and sell (charcoal) business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jane is 43 years old and has one child in school.

Jane has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Jane requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Jane has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 37 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Agnes has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married, 34-year-old woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a buy and sell herbal products business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase herbal products, like medicines, etc.  

Vilma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase herbal products, like medicines, etc.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Jacquelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jacquelyn has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sokorm

texts.en:
Sokorm is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the north-west of Cambodia. She is 20 years old. She lives in a wooden one floor house with her parents and her younger sister. . Her family owns two hectares of rice fields.

In May 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Sokorm makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for the fertilizer for the field.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for dyeing and the preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Radha Group 01

texts.en:
Jyotshna is the group leader in the picture. She is married and runs her own small business of readymade garments. The income from her business has been enough to cover the household expenses of family of 3. However with no savings in hand for the future needs, she feels insecure and unsafe. So to earn enough to be able to save some earnings, she wants to expand her business. The other members of group also need money for similar enterprising purposes.

This is why she has applied for a loan of Rs. 60000 (Rs.10000 each member). The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of varieties of ladies garments. Adding in fashion tops, blouses, leggings, saree, kurtis will increase her sales. Also the lump sum amount will allow her to buy these pieces in bulk. The borrowers are hopeful of a better future post the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bulk stock of varities of ladies clothing.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is 55 years old and he lives with his wife in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Azat has no higher education but he managed to learn the secrets and skills of professional photography and he already has 30 years of work experience in this filed. Thanks to his devotion to this work he already has his own photo studio and also great number of regular customers. In his own space he opened his studio, where he takes photos for documents and he also does a photo session in his own pavilion in the studio. Azat also takes orders of taking wedding and birthday party photos.

Azat likes his work and as he mentions he is so pleased to prolong the happiest moments of the life of different people through his photos, which he manages to do skillfully, always looking for a right time to take a good shot. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of materials of high quality for his photography in order to have better results and more orders as well.

loans.use: to buy materials of high quality for photography, in order to have better results and more orders as well.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en: Vafa is 36 years old and married. She is the mother of three kids. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. Vafa is a farmer. She is an intelligent and diligent woman. She has experience but she wants to develop herself in this job. She started this work six years ago. Vafa wants to buy new fertilizers and seeds. Now she needs some funds to increase the level of her living. For that Kiva lenders can support Vafa.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a married 46 year old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children who are still studying. He is the main income source of the family. He started his own business in 2005, when he opened a car blacksmith shop in his town and has gained a fair number of customers so far.

Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees and with the remaining money he will develop his business. Mahmoud is very ambitious and he intends to work harder, so as to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their requirements.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees and with the remaining money he will develop his business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 48 years old and married. Ibrahim is a farmer, is experienced at that, as he started this job 10 years ago. He is a hard-working and responsible man. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region.

Ibrahim needs some money because he wants to expand his land and buy more fertilizers. For this Ibrahim needs Kiva lenders support. He thanks Kiva as otherwise his living conditions would not become better.

loans.use: to expand his land and  buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Annabelle has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 47 years old and married, with five children, three of whom are in school. Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee.

Rosie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Sulaikan

texts.ru: Сулайкан, 67 лет, вдова, есть сын, он, сноха и внуки - ее главные помощники по дому и хозяйству. У Сулайкан высшее образование, она на пенсии. Занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Сулайкан есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, лошади. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое молоко. Сулайкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком для увеличения объемов реализации молока и молочной продукции. Свои доходы Сулайкан и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Sulaikan is 67 years old and a widow. She has a son. He, her daughter-in-law and the grandchildren are her main helpers at home and with the farm. Sulaikan has higher education and is on a pension. She is also working with livestock breeding.

Sulaikan has four cows, 20 sheep and one horse on her farm. She sells ecological milk on a daily basis. Sulaikan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow with calf to increase the volume of milk and dairy product for selling. Sulaikan plans to also use her future income to develop her business, and she would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow with calf to increase the volume of ecological milk products for selling

loans.name: Neddie

texts.en:
Neddie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy new fishing net.

Neddie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 58 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 46 years old, married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emilia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bunnary's Group

texts.en: Bunnary, 45, is a farmer living in a rural village of Battambang Province and a married mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school. To support the family’s living, she has been growing rice as the main source of income for five years. She sometimes works for a labor fee in order to earn additional income to be better support her family’s living condition. Due to not having enough working capital to support her current business, she is now leading a group, which consists of two members, to apply for a new Kiva loan. This is the first loan cycle for her via VisionFund and she is going to take 1,000,000 KHR while the other one in her group seeks 1,600,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for supporting her rice farming so that she can gain good yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for supporting her rice farming so that she can gain good yields.

loans.name: Gulmastura

texts.en:
In the photo you see a good and pleasant woman called Gulmastura. She is 49 years old. She is married with three children and her sons are 26 and 20 years old, and her daughter is a beauty at the age of 16. Her husband works with livestock breeding, as do many fellow villagers.

Gulmastura decided to work with sewing, making women's clothing. She has worked in this business for several years. Gulmastura has worked with sewing on the same sewing machine all these years. Her sewing machine has currently lost its power and will soon fail.

Gulmastura would like to continue her business and requests help to purchase a new sewing machine. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 63 years old, married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old, with six children.
