Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Emily has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emily aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 53 years old and widowed with six children. Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Shirley has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jessica has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jessica has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Emerlina

texts.en:
Emerlina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emerlina is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emerlina has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Emerlina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, nipa leaves, etc..

Emerlina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emerlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, nipa leaves, etc.

loans.name: Prerana Mahila Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Vimal, 49, standing to the extreme right, is the featured borrower of Prerana Mahila Shg-B. She is a humble lady who hails from a small village of Maharashtra,India.

Vimal is married with two daughters and both of them are married. Her husband works as a farmer and is engaged in sugarcane cultivation. Since he is the only bread winner in the family, they have to face a lot of difficulties in order to fulfill all their necessary requirements.

Due to lack of financial resources, Vimal was unable to build a toilet for her family. Therefore, she along with her other group members is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Vimal will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and install a commode in it. This will help her in maintaining the hygiene of her family and promoting cleanliness in the community.

Vimal dreams of building a new house after a while where she can enjoy a happy living with her husband.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a commode in it

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 50,000 in which she bought 10 boxes of laundry powder, 10 boxes of laundry bars, 10 boxes of shampoo, and 10 boxes of fabric conditioner she sell to her retail and also for distribution.

Up to date Pamela regular customers are growing because she was able continuously supply their demand, thanks to the loan. Her retail store is also doing good since there are more stock in display and more customers are buying. Pamela was able to increase her income thus paid her loan on time. Also from the revenue of her income she was also started to expand her business as she started to have a mobile money transfer in her store due also to the demand of her customers.

Pamela is requesting a reloan in the amount of PhP 50,000 to buy more boxes of shampoo, fabric conditioners, laundry powder, soap bars, and mobile money transfer as additional business.

Pamela is positive that with the new loan she was able to increase her income as she can supply more home products to her customers.

Pamela is hopes to expand her business and home products distribution to provide more for her family, for her children in school and to help more in their community.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of shampoo, fabric conditioners,   laundry powder, soap bars , and mobile money transfer as additional business.

loans.name: Nelgin

texts.en:
Nelgin is 38 years old and is married with three children. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Nelgin has run a business selling rice in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelgin is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with four children who are in school. For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, and other items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, canned goods and other items to sell

loans.name: Prerana Mahila Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Sangita is 41 years old and lives in a very small village of Maharashtra, India, two children. The lady standing to the right hand side in the photo is Sangita. She is a divorcee, and after her husband left her alone she had to struggle very hard in order to raise her two children and fulfill their needs.

She has managed a chicken-rearing activity for the past five years. The chickens when they breed are then sold for chickens and eggs.

Sangita, along with her group member, is requesting her first loan for 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy additional chicks, feed, and medicine ,and to construct a brooder so she can expand her business.

She will then be able to provide her children all the necessary resources, which in turn will help them build a secure future. She is very happy to have this loan and would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks, feed, and medicine, and to construct a brooder.

loans.name: Sokong

texts.en:
A local resident living in Banon district of Battambang province, Sokong is 27-year-old. These days, he is a student and he grows pepper for selling to support his living and his studying. He has never been with VisionFund before, and this is the first time for him to take this Kiva loan.

Through this loan, he is going to use it to pay for his school fees and buy some study materials for supporting his studying at university. He hopes that this loan will help him to get a higher education and pave the way to get a good job after his graduation. This will improve his future and enable him to escape from poverty..

loans.use: to pay for his school fees and buy some studies materials for supporting him at University.

loans.name: Dolphin Group

texts.en:
Rahel is in her early 30s and married with four children; three of them are at school and one is still small. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for six years now. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rahel's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the genge stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, repay the loan, reinvest in the business and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables in her genge (grocery store). She dreams of building her own house.

Rahel will share this loan with her loan group, Dolphin, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables in her genge (grocery store).

loans.name: Resort Group

texts.en:
Gladson is in his early 50s and is married with two children who are still at school. For the past 10 years, he has been a tailor who works daily from seven in the morning until seven at night. Gladson is able to make a fair monthly profit. He is a member of the loan group Resort, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan.

Gladson will use his portion of the group loan to buy materials to make up-to-date clothing to meet customer requests. This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Gladson used his previous loans to buy materials for making suits for men and good materials for making ladies dresses. He used the profit from his previous loans to pay school fees, repay his loan, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses.  In the future, Gladson dreams of becoming an international businessman.

loans.use: to buy materials to make up-to-date clothing to meet customer requests

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 48 years old, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Belinda is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Belinda has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosalie has a selling spare parts business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spare parts to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products. Rowena has been in this business for two years.

In the future Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and has five children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 28 years old and has four children. For the past seven years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. Jona works hard to provide for her family. 

Jona is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, biscuits, home care products, and other groceries. She has repaid one previous loan from NWTF. Jona aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy junk foods, canned goods, biscuits, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with one child.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from jeepney passengers.

Arlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 52 years old and married with six children. Ma. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, junk food, noodles, and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, junk food, condiments and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, junk food, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ranjuta

texts.en:
Ranjuta, 32, is a entrepreneurial, consistent, independent, active, responsible, and hardworking lady. She is differently abled and hails from a small village of Ganjam district, in Odisha, India. She has a nuclear family consisting of her husband who works as a labourer and two small children who are in primary school.

Ranjuta owns a grocery store and sells items like biscuits, cookies, potato chips, soaps, detergents, and other utility and consumable items. She has a good reputation in her community and her business runs very well as she is very sociable.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum, in order to renovate her grocery shop, as she will be able to stock a greater number of items in her store and will be able to increase her clientele base. Thus, this will ultimately result in her financial stability.

Ranjuta aspires to make her children well educated and see them prosper in their lives.

loans.use: to renovate her grocery shop

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in the frontier village of Aygehovit of Tavush region. Samvel is married and he lives with his wife and two school-aged sons. Samvel used to work as a driver, now he is a contractual military serviceman and simultaneously he is running farming and agriculture with the help of his nice wife.

On his farm Samvel has a cow, pigs and a lot of chickens. He also has a large fruit garden and it gives harvest of persimmon, fig, apple and nuts. With these fruits he also sells his farm’s meat and eggs. All his farm products Samvel sells on his own, driving his car into the city when he has free time from his work.

Samvel would like to make his farm larger and enlarging the number of his farm cattle he wants to sell also some assortment of dairy-products. So this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Samvel asks for the purchase of two more cows for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more cows for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married and has children. She has her own business.

Nina has been selling women's clothes for 18 years. She rents a place at the market. Also Nina uses a rental car for transportation. She is hardworking and responsible person. Nina sells popular clothes and has good prices.

Nina is asking for a loan of 45 000 UAH to purchase warm clothes for autumn and winter seasons and also clothes for students. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and get a bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase warm clothes for autumn and winter seasons and also clothes for students.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuwena who is in her mid 40s, is married with four children, three of them are in school and the other one is still small.She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years now.She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuwena’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loan to increase on the genge stock which is now serving more people. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees loan repayment and covered household expenses.She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the genge business.She dreams of being an international business woman.

Zuwena will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule

loans.use: to buy replacement products for her store

loans.name: Ernest's Group

texts.en:
Ernest who is in his early 50s is married with eight children, seven of them are grown up and one is still in school. He has been selling shoes for ten years now. He works from 08am to 05pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ernest's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.He used the previous loans to increase on the shoes stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

He used the profit to take care of her kid, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the up to date shoes and so meet his customer's requirement. He dreams of buying more shoes and to became an international business man.

He will share this loan with his loan group Mikocheni A which has Five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the up to date  shoes to meet his customers' requirement.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending .  Alicia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is 35 years old and a farmer, living in Battambang province. She is a married mother of four children, only one of whom is in school.

For seven years, she catches fish to sell, grows rice, and works for a labor fee to support her family's living conditions. The rice crops have not grown well, so she gained lower than expected yields. She can earn income of about KHR 24,000 per day and she is able to save only KHR 10,000 each day, after offsetting her family’s expenses.

This is Saroeun’s second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid the past loan, which helped her to have better living conditions.

Now, she is leading a group of three members to request a new loan. As a group leader, Saroeun will use her loan portion to buy fishing materials to catch more fish, which will allow her to increase the number of sales. She hopes to earn more income, so that she can expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to catch more fish, which will allow her to increase the number of sales.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah age 35, is a mother of three children,living with her family in Lahore,Pakistan.She is popular for her tailoring skills which is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and variety of tailoring materials, including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult.

Therefore,Misbah is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC .Pakistan with the goal of helping her family. She will purchase the needful things with the help of loan amount. Misbah is feeling happy that she will be able to complete her orders with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for her sewing business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 49 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has run a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines. Winnie works very hard to provide for her family.

Winnie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, and other supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nipa leaves, bamboo, and other supplies

loans.name: Hector Isacc

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven emprendedor y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio: venta de abarrotería en general, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Hector su negocio lo realiza hace 2 años, sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su colonia y barrios aledaños,  solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de abarrotaría en general como ser: azúcar, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, churros, manteca, lácteos, pollo, embutidos, helados, etc.
Hector  sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y poder vendar más variedad de producto a sus clientes y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras –Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Héctor is an enterprising young man and works in sales, his primary source of income comes from the business, the sale of general groceries. He runs this business personally and gets up very early to serve his customers.

Héctor began his business 2 years ago, his principle customers are his neighbors in his colony and the adjoining neighborhoods. He asks for the loan to purchase general groceries such as sugar, butter, condiments, soft drinks, churros, butter, dairy product, chicken, cold cuts, ice cream, etc.

Héctor dreams of being able to expand his business and being able to sell more variety of products to his customers and, to improve his source of income.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras –July 2015

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butter, seasonings, soft drinks, churros, butter, dairy products, chicken, cold cuts, ice cream, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 22 years old, single, and lives with his family at Ponhea Leu district , Kandal province, Cambodia.
Nowadays, Mab is a student at NTTI Institute in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In the field of Building Construction, year 2, semester 1.

He would likes to apply for a loan for pay his school fee. He will graduate in 2018.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees in Building Construction.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has two children. She has her own business.

Elena sells meat, fat and smoked products at the market near the train station. She owns a sales spot. Elena is hardworking and an open person. She always watches the freshness of products.

Elena is asking for a loan of 15 000 UAH to purchase more of the popular products. Because of unstable prices wholesale buyers don't give goods on consignment. The loan will help Elena to increase the assortment of products.

loans.use: for daily purchases of produce for sale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is widow and has three children. For five years she has worked at an energy station. She left her job because did not receive her salary on time. She entered to the private small company of plastic doors and windows. She works as a specialist seller and her monthly income is 1500 Somoni and it is not enough for unplanned expenses.

Her child is sick. She wishes to treat him at a medical clinic. She applied to IMON asking financial support to pay medical service at hospital for her child. She hopes her child will be healed and can go back to school. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay medical service at hospital for her child.

loans.name: Cuatro Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cuatro Estrellas es originario de una comunidad de raíces mazahuas, el nombre lo decidieron cuando eran sólo cuatro integrantes y, aunque el nombre se conserva, ahora son seis los miembros. La comunidad está muy alejada del centro de la ciudad por lo que es difícil el acceso si no se cuenta con un medio de transporte. 
   Yolanda es probablemente la más amigable de las integrantes, siempre está sonriendo y logra contagiar su alegría a las demás. Vive casada con el señor Juan y juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos quienes cursas distintos grados escolares. Desde hace 16 años Yolanda comenzó a criar ovejas con el objetivo de aportar con los ingresos familiares. Ella cuida de los animales durante 8 meses para asegurarse de que cumplan con el peso adecuado y así tener más ganancias. Los clientes más asiduos son las personas que se dedican a preparar "barbacoa": un platillo tradicional preparado con carne de oveja. “Para mí no es nada complicado cuidar de mis animales ya que puedo estar al pendiente de mis hijos sin tener que salir de casa para obtener ingresos extras” comenta Yolanda quien todos los días dedica cinco horas a los cuidados de su actividad. 
   Por otro lado, está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos porque le permiten mejorar su negocio. Con el nuevo préstamo planea comprar productos de abarrotes como pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, detergentes, etc. ya que desea abrir una tienda. Éste era uno de sus sueños y ahora que está por cumplirlo redoblará esfuerzos para mantenerlo. De igual forma desea apoyar a sus hijos para que alcancen sus metas académicas: "son niños muy aplicados en la escuela no me gustaría defraudarlos y decirles que no podrán seguir estudiando por la falta de dinero" comentó firmemente Yolanda.
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son  Clara, María Petra, Teresa y Felicitas quienes invertirán en ovejas mientras que María Isabel lo hará en pollos y bordados.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio, Yolanda es quien sostiene una carpeta en su mano.
texts.en:
The group “Cuatro Estrellas” [Four Stars] is from a community of Mazahua origin. They chose their name when there were only four members, and although they have kept the name, there are now six members. The community is a long way from the city center, which makes it difficult to get to without a means of transportation.

Yolanda is probably the friendliest member; she is always smiling, and she manages to spread her happiness to the other members. She is married to Señor Juan, and together they have formed a family, with three children who are studying in different grades in school.

Sixteen years ago, Yolanda started raising sheep in order to contribute to the family income. She takes care of the animals for eight months in order to make sure that they gain enough weight for her to have more earnings. Her most regular customers are the people who make “barbacoa”, which is a traditional dish prepared with mutton. Yolanda comments that, “For me, caring for my animals is not complicated at all, as I can be available for my children without having to leave the house to earn extra income”. Every day she devotes five hours to the duties of her occupation.

On the other hand, she is very happy and grateful for the loans, because they allow her to improve her business. With the new loan, she plans to purchase grocery products such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, detergents, etc., as she plans to open a store. This was one of her dreams, and now that she is about to achieve it, she will redouble her efforts to maintain it.

Equally, she wants to support her children so that they may accomplish their academic goals: “They are children who are very diligent in school, and I would not like to let them down, and tell them that they won’t be able to continue studying because of the lack of money”, Yolanda comments firmly.

The other members of the group are Clara, María Petra, Teresa, and Felicitas, who will invest in sheep, while María Isabel will invest in chickens and embroidery.

*The photograph was taken in the municipal park, Yolanda is holding a file folder in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, etc.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ma. Nenette

texts.en:
Ma. Nenette is 53 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Nenette has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Nenette requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Nenette has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Nenette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Pamela has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Pamela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot, from Kapan City in the Syunik region, sends his great regards and thanks to Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon for his first Kiva loan that he paid back successfully and on time.

Ashot is a gardener with many years of experience and perfect skills in it. He cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplant, zucchini, radishes, and greens. Ashot also has apple and peach trees and several plum and pear trees. He sells his garden’s harvest through the re-sellers or in the wholesale market. Ashot is married and has two sons and a daughter. His elder son and daughter are married and they live separately with their families. Their smallest son now is in the Russian Federation and he lives and works there temporally. Ashot would like to receive one more Kiva loan as he needs to buy grid for the fence around his garden and also repair some parts of it.

loans.use: to buy grid for the fence around his garden and also repair some parts of it.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 44 años y vive en el municipio de San Antonio de Prado, lugar donde tiene su negocio de venta de mercancía que comenzó el año pasado con el deseo de poder brindar a su familia un sustento que les permita vivir bien, razón por la cual trabaja arduamente.

Ella quiere mejorar la calidad de vida suya y de su familia, y sabe que su negocio podrá ayudar a lograr esto siempre y cuando sea productivo, por esto quiere invertir en él. Hoy pide un préstamo que le permita comprar mercancía como ropa, lencería, electrodomésticos y cosméticos, para así ampliar su oferta.

Ella espera lograr que su negocio sea sostenible en el tiempo, además de que cada día pueda aumentar su inventario para obtener más ganancias. Puedes ayudar a Gloria a lograr sus metas a través de un préstamo que le permitirá estar más cerca de sus sueños.
texts.en:
44 year old Gloria lives in the town of San Antonio de Prado, where she has a business selling merchandise that begun last year. She has the desire to be able to bring her family an income that will allow them to live well, that's why she works so hard.

She would like to improve her family's quality of life and knows that her business will help her achieve that so long as it is profitable; which is why she wants to invest in it. She is asking for a loan to purchase products such as clothes, lingerie, home appliances and cosmetics to expand her catalog.

She hopes to make her business sustainable over time, as well as to be able to increase her inventory on a daily basis and thus improve profits. You can help Gloria achieve her goals through a loan that will allow her to get closer to her dreams.

loans.use: purchase products such as clothes, lingerie, home appliances and cosmetics

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 40, is a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province and a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Nowadays, she is a hairdresser to earn income to support her family’s living condition for ten years. Meanwhile, her husband is working for others for a fee and she grows vegetables to get supplement income. Her daily business earns her about 40,000KHR per day. After her expenses, she is able to save around 20,000KHR each day.

Due lacking of working capital to expand her current business, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a new loan via VisionFund. This is Touch’s third cycle and she repaid her previous loans completely. With the past loans, she has household supplies to use more than before.

Touch is taking a new loan of 800,000KHR and her group is seeking of 600,000KHR. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to increase productivity of her vegetables. She hopes to get additional income so that she is able to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to increase production of her vegetables.

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres sonrientes (Maura Violeta, Aidaly y Runalina) de la ciudad de Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada, pulpería y mariscos; se organizaron hace 12 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Loma Linda, en honor al barrio donde habitan.

Maura Violeta: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer cordial, con cualidades de líder, es casada, tiene 27 años, con 3 hijos: El mayor de 8 años de edad, estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo, con apoyo económico de su esposo estableció una pequeña pulpería en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi. Esta solicitando financiamiento para surtir su pulpería con nuevos productos como jugos, embutidos, carne molida. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three smiling women (Maura Violeta, Aidaly and Runalina) from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who struggle daily to grow their small businesses of: selling used clothes, a grocery shop and a seafood shop.
They organized themselves 12 months ago to access joint liability loans through Pana Pana. They decided to name their solidarity group "Loma Linda" (Pretty Hill) after the neighborhood where they live.

Maura Violeta, the coordinator of the group, is a friendly woman with leadership qualities. She is married, 27 years old and has three children. The oldest of which, is 8 years old and attends 4th grade, the other two are of younger ages. Her husband works in an informal way as a bricklayer.

In order to have her own source of income to contribute to household expenses and her son's schooling and with financial support of her husband, she established a small grocery shop in a rented stretch of space in one of the markets in the city of Bilwi. She is requesting a loan to stock her store with new products such as juices, sausages and ground beef. She dreams of one day selling new and used clothing.

loans.use: stock her store with new products such as juices, sausages and ground beef

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.en:
Mehrikhon is a bright woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in small city with her family. She is married and has three children and her husband is a taxi driver. She is a business lady. She does business at domestic market selling and buying towels, tablecloths and fabrics. She has regular customers each week. She tries to be gentle and communicable with customers.

She had planned to increase the assortment of her goods. She came to IMON and asked a loan to buy a new assortment of goods. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of goods.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Nueva Vida¨, está integrado por 3 mujeres laboriosas y responsables. Están con ADIM con 21 ciclos, siendo fieles clientas al institución. 
María Auxiliadora, de 31 años es la coordinadora del grupo, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de gallinas, este negocio lo inicia  con la ayuda de su esposo, tiene   dos hijos de edades 11 y 7 años quienes tambien le ayudan en el negocio. Con el prestamo que solicita  comprara 100 unidades de gallinas para aumentar su comercio. Expresa que con el crédito  anterior  compro hojas de zinc para mejorar su hogar  y comida por mayor para alimentar a los animales. 
Las demás integrantes son Flor de María, de 45 años su negocio es compra venta de frutas desde hace 10 años. Y María Rebeca, quien a sus 33 años comercializa frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Vida" (New Life) is formed by three hard-working and responsible women. They have been with ADIM for 21 loan cycles, being loyal clients of the institution. Maria Auxiliadora, who is 31, is the coordinator of the group. For 10 years, she has been selling chickens. This business began with the help of her husband, and the driving force of her life are her two children, ages 11 and 7 who also help her with the business. 

With the loan, she will buy 100 chickens in order to increase her business. She states that with the previous loan, she bought two sheets of zinc to improve her home and food to feed the animals.

The other members are Flor de Maria, who is 45 and has been buying and selling fruit for 10 years, and Maria Rebeca, who at the age of 33 sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens to increase her business.

loans.name: La Lagunita Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad pintoresca del Estado de México se integró un grupo de mujeres muy trabajadoras y amables. Todas aman su localidad pues viven rodeadas de vegetación además de conservar distintas tradiciones que les dan identidad y unión.
   Doña Tomasa es una mujer es muy agradable dedicada a cumplir con su trabajo y obligaciones. Actualmente es viuda y tiene seis hijos los cuales son independientes, sin embargo desde que decidió formar una familia también quiso apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Desde entonces se ha dedicado a la cría de animales como pollos, pavos, ovejas, reces y caballos.  De igual modo los animales le sirven para uso personal, “mi burrito es de gran ayuda pues como aquí no tenemos agua potable y además cocino con leña, es necesario cargar el agua o la leña desde muy lejos” comentó contenta.
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo comprará alimento para los animales que tiene a su cuidado. Dichos animales los compra desde pequeños y cuando alcanzan el peso ideal los vende dentro de la misma comunidad. Por lo anterior dicho, Tomasa está muy contenta y agradecida con VF México ya que su actividad se ve considerablemente beneficiada y esto se refleja en las ganancias. 
 Las metas que tiene en mente hoy en día es poder construir un corral más grande y más seguro que pueda resistir las temporadas de lluvia e incrementar la producción de animales para generar mejores ingresos.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Francisca, Diana y Benita quienes invierten en abarrotes; María Guadalupe y Patricia, en borregos; María Cristina en un centro de cómputo y Reyna, en rebozos, pollos y alimento para los mismos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del jardín municipal, Doña Tomasa es quien viste falda negra y suéter rosa.
texts.en:
In a picturesque community in the State of México, some very hardworking and friendly women formed a group. They all love their town, as they live surrounded by vegetation, in addition to conserving the different traditions that give them an identity and unity.

Doña Tomasa is a very friendly woman who is dedicated to doing her job and meeting her obligations. Now she is a widow, with six children who are independent, but ever since she decided to form a family, she also wanted to help with the household expenses.

Since then, she has been raising animals such as chickens, turkeys, sheep, calves, and horses. In addition, the animals are for her personal use. "My little burro is a great help, as we have no drinkable water here and we also cook with firewood, so its necessary to carry the water and firewood from very far away", she commented happily.

With the opportunity of the loan, she will purchase feed for the animals that she has under her care. She purchases these animals when they are very young, and when they reach the ideal weight she sells them within the same community. For this reason, Tomasa is very happy and grateful for VF México, as her work benefits considerably, and this is reflected in the earnings.

Today, her goals are to be able to build a bigger and safer corral that can withstand the rainy seasons, and to increase the production of animals in order to generate better earnings.

The other members of the group are Francisca, Diana, and Benita, who will invest in groceries; María Guadalupe and Patricia, who will invest in yearling sheep; María Cristina, who will invest in a computer center and Reyna, who will invest in shawls, chickens and chicken feed.

* The photograph was taken in the center of the municipal garden, Doña Tomasa is wearing a black skirt and a pink sweater.

loans.use: to purchase food for her animals.

location.town: La Lagunita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and married with three children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, bread, and other groceries.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, bread, and other groceries

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline works hard to support her family. Angeline is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Angeline requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Angeline has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dormilina

texts.en:
Dormilina is 59 years old and a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dormilina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Dormilina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Mae is 41 years old, and her three children are in school.

Ana Mae has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ana Mae has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
In village Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region lives Maksim with his wife. Maksim already paid back his first Kiva loan of which he is thankful and would like to have one more deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. Maksim his has cows, calves, pigs and chickens on his farm. From the farm, Maksim’s wife sells milk macun (national-dairy product), as well as meat and eggs. Maksim also properly cares for his farm cattle and he even cultivates potatoes on his plot of land, which he sells to re-sellers.

Maksim is worried again because the lack of fodder for his cattle. Since this year summer is a very hot one, the grass in the fields burnt and now in this period when his cattle used to it fresh green grass has a lack of fodder. This loan of 200.000 Armenian drams Maksim asks for as he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Jane, a 40-year-old farmer from a remote village in Cheptongei in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She resides with her husband with whom she is blessed with a lovely family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 12 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.
Thanks to your support, Jane will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, 39, resides in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She has three dependent kids, only one of whom is in school and others are too young to attend school. Growing sesame is the main source of her family’s income. Moreover, her husband works as a paid worker and fishing to earn additional income for supporting her family. She has been in this business for 19 years. The crops have not been growing well, which is the main challenge for her. The unhealthy of her crop causes her to earn only 33,000KHR per day and she is able to save about 10,000KHR each day after her expenses.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle already and she has paid back her past loan successfully. Based on the previous loan, her family’s standard of living is improved. Now, she is going to request a new loan of 4,000,000KHR. For this new loan, Nan will use it to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and take the rest of money to buy a boat for supporting her fishing business. She hopes to earn more income and help her family to have a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and take the rest of money to buy a boat for supporting her fishing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea is 39 years old. She lives at Khsach Kandal district Kandal province, Cambodia .She got married in 2002 and has two sons and two daughters. 3 are studying at primary school.

Sokhea has been a seller of fish and vegetables for 06 years, while her husband has been a fisherman and farmer for 4 year. Now she wants to increase her profit more, she applied for a loan to purchase more vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell at the Deum Kor Market in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: 6 Palomas Group

texts.es:
La integrantes del grupo "6 Palomas" son personas muy alegres y amables. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua donde la celebración más grande ocurre los días 28 y 29 de septiembre: hay una gran carrera de caballos, por las calles pasean al Santo San Miguel, se escuchan cohetes muy fuertes y en la víspera se queman fuegos artificiales conocidos como toritos o castillos. 

 Doña Rosa una mujer muy trabajadora, amable y sonriente tiene 45 años de edad y está casada con el señor Macario; juntos han formado una familia con nueve hijos, cinco de ellos aún son dependientes de la pareja. Mientras Don Macario trabaja en el campo, Doña Rosa atiende un pequeño de negocio de mercería es por eso que está solicitando un crédito a VFMéxico y KIVA ya que necesita más mercancía como aretes, anillos, pulseras de fantasía, también vende hilos y telas cuadrille para tejer entre otros. El negocio lo comenzó hace 17 años ya que tenía grandes deseos de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar “Yo veía como mi esposo trabajaba por mucho tiempo pero el dinero no nos rendía y no alcanzaba para solventar todos los gastos del hogar y la educación de todos nuestros niños”. El negocio lo inició en la casa de su suegra, pero sus ventas no eran las esperadas  y decidió cambiar el negocio a la su casa. Actualmente las ventas han mejorado y también renta un molino de nixtamal lo que le ayuda a tener más ingresos. 

Doña Rosa está muy contenta con su negocio y dice que quiere seguir luchando para no abandonarlo, por el momento su gran dificultad es la competencia en la misma comunidad. Ella esta muy agradecida con el préstamo de VFMéxico porque ahora ya tiene un local donde ha establecido su negocio aunque aún quiere remodelarlo. “Mi sueño mas grande es poder mejorar el local porque ahora solo esta techado con láminas y ampliar mas para vender otros artículos". También tiene el anhelo de comprar una camioneta y salir a vender a otros lugares para poder aumentar sus ganancias.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Gloria quien invertirá en pollos; Miriam, en cerdos; Maria Rosalba, en fantasía, Beatriz, en papas y Yolanda, en borregos.
texts.en:
The members of the "6 Palomas (6 Pigeons)" group are happy and friendly. They live in a Mazahua community where the biggest celebration of the year happens on the 28th and 29th of September. There is a big horse race, Saint San Miguel passes through the streets, you can hear loud fireworks, and on the eve they set off fireworks known as bulls or castles.

Rosa is a very hard-working, friendly and smiling woman. She is 45 years old and is married to Macario. Together they have formed a family of nine children. Five of them are still dependent on the couple. While Macario works in the field, Rosa tends to a small haberdashery store. She is asking for a loan from VFMéxico and KIVA because she needs more merchandise such as earrings, rings, fancy bracelets, and also thread and fabric bunches to sew together.

She started the business 17 years ago because she had big wishes to help her husband with the household expenses. "I saw my husband working a lot but the money was not enough to pay all of the household expenses and the education of all of our children." She started the business in the house of her mother-in-law, but her sales were not what she hoped for and she decided to change the business to her own house. Now the sales have improved and she also rents out a corn mill which helps her to have more income.

Rosa is very happy with her business and says that she wants to keep fighting to not lose it. At the moment, her big difficulty is the competition in the same community. She is very thankful for the loan from VFMéxico because she now has a place where she has established her business, although she wants to remodel it. "My biggest dream is to be able to improve the place, because now it is only a roof with metal sheets, and to grow more to sell other articles." She also has the desire to buy a small truck and go out to sell in other places to increase her earnings.

The other members of the group are Gloria (chickens), Miriam (pigs), Maria Rosalba (imitation articles), Beatriz (potatoes) and Yolanda (lambs).

loans.use: to buy earrings, rings and bracelets.

location.town: San Miguel Agua Bendita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. In 2012, she opened a beauty salon in her house to help her family to meet the needs of life and to help her father who is the main income provider for the family. She has her loyal customers, and she is well known in her region for her brilliant talents. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase equipment for her business such as scissors, a hair brush, dryer, etc. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with a high quality of work.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her business such as scissors, a hair brush, dryer, etc.

loans.name: Maria Noemi

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa familiar junto a sus dos hijos de 19 años de edad y 14 años de edad a los que con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante en sus estudios, es una mujer muy dedicada  en su negocio ya que es el que le permite tener sus ingresos económicos, al igual el padre de sus hijos, le aporta para los gastos de estos. María se dedica desde hace siete años a la venta de antojitos típicos como yuca frita, empanadas, enchiladas, papas fritas, pastelitos de verduras con carne y frescos en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues es negocio único en su comunidad y además está ubicada en un lugar concurrida de personas. María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papas, yuca, aceite, azúcar, harinas etc. para mejorar sus ventas en mayor producción así como también aumentar sus ganancias y poder llevar una vida más digna.
texts.en: María is 45 years old, is a single mother and lives in the family home with her two children, ages 19 and 14, who, with a lot of effort she is getting ahead in their education. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her business since it allows her to have an income. The father of her children also contributes to the household expenses. María has worked for seven years selling traditional snacks such as fried yucca, empanadas, enchiladas, french fries, vegetable pies with meat and soft drinks in her home. She has many customers because it is the only business in her community and, in addition, it is located in a busy area. María asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in potatoes, yucca, oil, sugar, flour, etc. to improve her sales with a higher production and also to increase her earnings and be able to have a more dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in potatoes, yucca, oil, sugar, flour, etc. to improve her sales in her business.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a light-hearted woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in small city with her family. She is widow and has four children.

She has 41 years of experience working at a medical center in a city. She is a well known and responsible doctor. Her sons emigrated to Russia. She receives money transfers from her children to live. Despite her retirement age, she continues working and insuring her children.

She has problems with her leg. She wishes to be healed at hospital. She is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva to pay for her medical treatment at hospital. She awaits your compassion and hopes to be understood.

loans.use: to pay for her medical treatment at hospital.

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es:
En diciembre además de las posadas se lleva a cabo la feria ganadera  en la que se realizan carreras de caballo, jaripeo, corridas de toros, por citar las más importantes a ella se dan cita los habitantes de la novia del sol y de comunidades vecinas  aunque también hay quienes vienen desde lejos para hacer acto de presencia.
En la colonia donde se encuentra el recinto ferial se integró un grupo para solicitar a Visión F México un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en sus actividades económicas productivas, en nombre del grupo es Media Luna pues la mitad de los integrantes tienen en común  dicho apellido, los integrantes del grupo son:
América – Comida Y Zapatos 
Hada X -Dulces, Refresco, Ropa , Bisutería 
Itzel-Ropa 
Rocio- Cosméticos Y Hortalizas
José-Ropa Y Calzado
Clara- Zapatos 
Hada-Comida
Lluvia, Yadira-Cosméticos 

Roció está casada con Irán con quien ha procreado  dos hijos de 12 y 7 años quienes estudian en la primaria de la colonia, desde hace 4 años Chío se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo obteniendo el 50% de la venta total como ganancia, comenta que antes de ser vendedora directa ayudaba a su comadre quien la motivo para inscribirse, las ganancias obtenidas, el primer préstamo otorgado  y el gusto por el campo la motivaron para iniciar con la siembra y venta de hortalizas, además de obtener ganancias de su venta ambulante de los productos antes mencionados ya no gasta en la compra para su consumo.
Cada determinado tiempo cuando las hortalizas están listas, chío las corta y acomoda en una carretilla para poder trasportarlas de manera  más rápida por las calles de la colonia y ofrecer a sus clientes producto 100% orgánico y fresco, lamentablemente el mes pasado las lluvias echaron a perder su siembra, comenta que no ha replantado pues las inclemencias del tiempo le pueden afectar nuevamente, por ello este préstamo lo invertirá en cosméticos (pagara la caja de producto extra que solicito; rubor, labiales, rimel, delineador, sombras, cremas y lociones)

“la familia es el mejor de los equipos, mis hijos y esposo siempre me ayudan” con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, y está ahorrando para reiniciar con la siembra y venta de hortalizas puesto que no descarta la idea de poner un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa donde podrá exhibir su mercancía (jitomate, chile, cilantro, cebolla, maíz) la limpieza la realiza con la mano o azadón según sea el tipo de maleza “el que persevera alcanza por eso lo volveré a intentar”
El grupo agradece por cada uno de los préstamos otorgados y el servicio que han recibido.
*La fotografía se tomó frente a la casa de doña Hada X quien coloca en la gran mesa sus dulces listos para la venta, chío viste  blusa color anaranjado.
texts.en:
In December, in addition to the posadas (processions reenacting Mary and Joseph’s search for a place to stay in Bethlehem), the livestock fair also takes place, in which there are horse races, rodeo, and bullfights are held, to name the most important events, at which the inhabitants of La Novia del Sol (nickname for the city of Tierra Blanca) and neighboring communities gather, although there are also those who come from afar to make an appearance.

In the neighborhood where the fairground is located, a group formed to apply for a new loan from Vision F Mexico and invest it in their productive economic occupations. The name of the group is Media Luna. The members of the group are:
América –Food and Shoes
Hada X -Candy, Soft Drinks, Clothing, Costume Jewelry
Itzel-Clothing
Rocío- Cosmetics and Vegetables
José-Clothing and Footwear
Clara- Shoes
Hada-Food
Lluvia, Yadira-Cosmetics

Rocío is married to Iran, with whom she has had two children, ages 12 and 7, who study in the neighborhood’s elementary school. For 4 years Chío (Rocío’s nickname) has worked in catalog cosmetic sales, obtaining 50% of the sales total as profit. She relates that before doing direct sales she was helping her friend, who motivated her to enroll. The profits obtained, the first loan granted and a taste for the country motivated her to start with the planting and sales of vegetables. In addition to obtaining profits from her street sales of the aforementioned products, she no longer spends on purchases for her consumption.

Every so often when the vegetables are ready, Chío cuts them and arranges them in a wheelbarrow in order to be able to transport them in the quickest manner through the streets of the neighborhood and offer her customers a product 100% organic and fresh. Unfortunately last month the rain ruining her planting. She relates that she has not replanted because the inclement weather can affect her again. So she will invest this loan in cosmetics (it will pay for the extra box of products she ordered: blush, lipstick, mascara, eyeliner, eyeshadow, creams and lotions).

“The family is the best of teams, my children and husband always help me.” With the profits obtained she helps her husband with household expenses. And she is saving to restart the planting and sales of vegetables, since she does not rule out the idea of putting a small stall outside her house where she will be able to display her merchandise (tomatoes, chile, cilantro, onions, corn). The cleaning is done by hand or hoe depending on the type of weed; “he who perseveres succeds, so I will try again.”

The group is grateful for each of the loans awarded and the service they have received.

* The photograph was taken in front of the house of Hada X, who has placed on the big table her candies ready for sale; Chío is wearing an orange blouse.

loans.use: buy blush, lipstick, mascara, eyeliner, eyeshadows, creams and lotions.

loans.name: Pheun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province, Pheun is 31 years old and a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while another one is too young to attend school. To make a living, she grows rice, feeding pigs and works for a labor fee to support the family about ten years. She can earn income around 36,000KHR per day. The main challenge she has faced is drought, it causes her to get lower-than-expected crop yields.

Now she has not enough working capital to support her current business, so she decided to lead a group to take a Kiva loan. This is the first time for Pheun and her members with VisionFund. Through this loan, she will use it to buy more piglets and pig feeds so her pigs grow well and healthy, and she will be able to sell at a higher price. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed for her pigs to grow well and healthy, so she is able to sell them at a higher price.

loans.name: Lucyline

texts.en:
Lucyline is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her three children as a primary caregiver.

For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, tomatoes and also keeping dairy cows. Lucyline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Lucyline. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.

Lucyline is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Lucyline is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Lucyline believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.
You can help this woman with a loan to support her and her dreams.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 63 años es un tendero residenciado en un barrio de la ciudad de Cartagena, que contó con el apoyo de su cónyuge, quien fue su motor para la iniciativa de esta oportunidad de negocio;  ella deseaba ser negociante, así que sembró esta semilla en Miguel y unificaron este sueño, así pudieron cumplir en conjunto esta iniciativa.  Hoy en día cuentan con 20 años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada, que diariamente realiza sus compras de la canasta familiar, llevando  excelentes productos a buenos precios.   En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en surtido de víveres y abarrotes.  Miguel siempre está muy interesado en que los clientes encuentren todo lo necesario en su tienda, por ello esta inversión permitirá ofrecer el servicio deseado por él y sus clientes encontrarán diversidad de marcas y calidades.  Su meta es continuar trabajando muy comprometido y entusiasta, para continuar ofreciéndole a su familia bienestar.
texts.en: Miguel, 63, is a shopkeeper who lives in a neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, who had the support of his spouse, who was his drive to begin with this business opportunity. She wanted to be a businesswoman, so she planted this seed in Miguel and achieved this dream, so they could work together on this initiative. Today, he has been in business for 20 years and has a loyal customer base who do their daily shopping of basic pantry items, buying excellent products at good prices. Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan, through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in an assortment of groceries. Miguel is always very interested in his customers finding everything they need in his store, so this investment will allow him to offer the service he wants and his customers will find a variety of brands and quality. His goal is to continue working with a lot of dedication and enthusiasm, to continue offering his family well-being.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries.

loans.name: Los Trapiches Group

texts.es:
La economía del municipio se ve beneficiado por el cultivo de caña de azúcar, mango, limón, maíz, frijol y pesca, destacando la caña de azúcar, durante la zafra (molienda de la caña) es cuando más movimiento hay, durante reparación dan manteamiento a los ingenios  y los jornaleros se dedican a trabajar en los cultivos alternos.

En uno de los barrios de dicho municipio se formó un grupo el cual lleva por nombre “Los Trapiches” por ser el nombre del barrio, actualmente el grupo lo integran.
 
Hortencia, Gabina -Cosméticos
Petra, Roció, Diana – Calzado Por Catalogo
Alberto -Servicio De Transporte Y Albañil
Serapio - Trasporte
Orlando -Cría De Marranos

 Doña Hortencia es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 44 años continua trabajando como empleada doméstica además de conservar la venta de cosméticos por catálogo actividad que inicio hace 4 años recorriendo las calles de la comunidad para ofrecer a sus clientes los cosméticos, con las ganancias obtenidas y el sueldo que percibe solventa los gastos del hogar, los gastos de la educación de sus hijas, cada préstamo recibido lo ha empleado para el pago de la casa de los pedidos que realiza de más.

Para doña Hortencia el apoyo de sus hijas es fundamental pues le apoyan a poner precios y anotar en la libreta los productos y costos de lo que le encargaron, de igual manera las ganancias le han permitido integrar la venta de ropa para dama ocupándose de ambas actividades.

Doña Hortencia ha motivado a más de 10 mujeres que al igual que ella son madres solteras y quienes hoy en día venden cosméticos por catálogo para solventar su hogar y brindar una buena calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella acostumbra siempre a encarga producto de más pues sus clientes acuden cuando les falta delineador, sombras, rímel, desodorante, crema y perfumes, comenta que aprovecha a comprar cuando los productos están en ofertas, pues la temporada siguiente aumentan los precios y ella los vende a un precio menor que el del catálogo como en esta temporada eso ara con el préstamo.

“gracias por apoyar a clientes emprendedores como lo somos nosotros los integrantes del grupo, por brindarnos una nueva oportunidad y mostrar interés en nosotros y el bienestar de nuestras familias”  son las palabras de agradecimiento de doña Hortencia.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Alberto, doña Hortencia es quien viste traje  floreado
texts.en:
The economy of the town benefits from the cultivation of sugarcane, mango, lime, corn, and beans, as well as fishing. Priority is given to the sugarcane, because during sugar production (grinding the cane) is when there is more movement. During reparation the sugar factories are given maintenance and the day laborers work in alternate crops.

In one of the neighborhoods of this town and group called "Los Trapiches" ("The Mills") formed, named after the district where the group is formed.

Hortencia, Gabina-Cosmetics
Petra, Roció, Diana-Footwear from catalogs
Alberto-Transport service and construction worker
Serapio-Transport
Orlando-Pig breeding

Hortencia is a very hardworking woman. At 44 years old she continues to work as a housekeeper in addition to keeping up with the sales of cosmetics from a catalog, a job she started 4 years ago traveling the streets of her community to offer her customers the cosmetics. With her earnings and the salary that she receives she pays the expenses of her home and the cost of education for her daughters. Each loan she has received she has used for the home orders (of which she is receiving more.)

For Hortencia, the support of her daughters is fundamental, so the help her to mark prices and make notes in the notebook of the products and costs of what they ordered. The earnings have allowed her to integrate selling clothes for busy women through both jobs.

Hortencia has motivated more than 10 women who, similar to her, are single mothers. Today they sell cosmetics from catalogs to afford their home and provide a good quality of life to their family.

She is used to ordering more products, so her customers turn to her when they don't have eyeliner, eyeshadows, mascara, deodorant, cream, and perfumes. She says that she takes advantage of when the products are on sale, so in the following time when the prices are raised she sells at a lower price than the catalog. She will do this with the loan.

"Thank you for supporting entrepreneurs like the members of our group, for giving us a new opportunity, and for showing interest in us and the well-being of our families" are the words of appreciation from Hortencia.

*The photograph was taken at Alberto's house. Hortencia is wearing the floral dress.

loans.use: to buy eyeliner, eyeshadows, mascara, deodorant, cream and perfumes.

loans.name: Gultakin

texts.en: Gultakin is 28 years old. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. She is a dairy farmer. She is an intelligent and determined woman. Gultakin has experience but she wants to develop herself in this job. She started this work three years ago. She knows that dairy farming is not an easy job but Gultakin loves animals and natural life. She wants to buy cows and a little food for them. Now she needs some funds to increase the level of her living. For that Kiva lenders should support Gultakin.

loans.use: to buy cows and a little food for them.

loans.name: El Pintal Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad del Estado de México se ha caracterizado por ser un lugar demasiado agradable, tranquila, amistosa pero sobre todo se distingue por ser una comunidad de gente trabajadora  que siempre se  preocupado por formar a personas respetuosas, responsables. 
Los habitantes de esta comunidad lo dejan saber cada día que madrugan en los campos para cultivar los productos que más tarde les servirá como productos alimenticios, ellos se sienten muy orgullosos de ver como estas y mas actitudes contribuyen en la mejora de sus familias, amigos y vecinos.
 Don Navor es un hombre muy trabajador, amable y muy sonriente, tiene 53 años de edad está casado desde hace 10 años con la señora Concepción, hasta ahora no tienen hijos. 
Don Navor platica antes de formar una familia se dedicaba a trabajar en la ciudad de México en la construcción de casas, afortunadamente conoció a Doña Concepción con quien decidió casarse y fue así como ya no regreso a la trabajar. Don Navor cambio la ciudad por el campo, desde hace 10 años Don Navor se dedica  a la cría y engorda de animales como borregos, becerros, pollos, guajolotes, etc. 
 Cuenta que la idea nació porque sus padres también se dedicaban  a la cría de animales “Desde muy pequeño mi padre me enseño a cuidar a los animales, por eso quise iniciar mi propio negocio además de que es un buen negocio” comento Don Navor muy contento.
Platica que los compra desde muy pequeños por algún tiempo, cría engorda y para después venderlos, cuando la compra los hace en su misma comunidad o en otras comunidades y cuando llega el momento de ponerlos en venta trata de ofrecerlos a los carniceros o algunas personas llegan hasta su comunidad.
Afortunadamente Don Navor no tiene ningún tipo de problema con sus animales, recuerda que cuando inicio no tenía corrales, cuando inicio su negocio sus animales eran muy poquitos y los compro gracias a sus propios ahorros,  ahora gracias al préstamo tiene buenos corrales y el número de sus animales han aumentado.
Ahora con su préstamo esta pensando comprar becerros y alimento para sus otros animales, el único sueño de Don Navor es seguir con su negocio, y no dejarlo para que pueda seguir aumentando sus ganancias.
Los integrantes del grupo son  Margarita B, Margarita M.Jesus, Yolanda, Gloria, Rocio, Veronica ellos invierten en borregos, Ofelia en papeleria, Miguel en cerdos.
*La fotografia fue tomada a un costado de los arcos del municipio, Don Navor es quien porta la gorra azul.
texts.en:
A community in the state of Mexico is characterized for being a very pleasant area. Calm, friendly but above all, it is distinguished for being a community of hardworking people who are always committed to creating respectful, responsible people.

The residents of this community demonstrate this every day that they get up early in the fields to cultivate the products that they later will serve as food. They are very proud to see how these, and other attitudes, contribute to the betterment of their families, friends and neighbors.

Don Navor is a man who is hardworking, friendly and always smiling. He is 53 years old and has been married to Concepcion for ten years. As of now, they do not have any children. Don Navor talked about before having a family; he worked in Mexico City building houses. Fortunately he met Concepcion with whom he decided to get married and this is why he didn’t return to work. Don Navor left the city for the countryside and, for ten years, Don Navor has worked raising and fattening animals such as sheep, calves, chickens, hens, etc. He says that he got this idea because his parents also worked raising animals. “Since I was little, my dad taught me to care for animals, because of this, I wanted to start my own business and also, it is a good business,” commented Don Navor very happily.

He shares that he buys them very small, and, for some time, he cares for and fattens them in order to afterwards sell them. He buys them in his own community or in other communities and, when it is time to sell them, he tries to offer them to butcher shops or other people who come to his community. Fortunately, Don Navor does not have any problems with his animals. He remembers that when he stared he did not have pens, and when he started his business, his animals were very small and he bought them with his own savings. Now, thanks to the loan, he has good pens and his number of animals has increased. Now, with the loan he is asking for, he is thinking of buying calves and feed for his other animals. Don Navor’s only dream is to continue with his business and not leave it so that he can continue to increase his earnings.

The members of the group are Margarita B., Margarita M., Jesus, Yolanda, Gloria, Rocio, Veronica; they will invest in sheep, and Ofelia, who will invest in paper products, and Miguel, in pigs.

*The picture was taken on the side of the arches of the municipal building. Don Navor is the man wearing the blue cap.

loans.use: to buy calves and feed.

location.town: El Pintal, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
Abelina  muy amable pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, tiene 29 años, está casada con el señor Carlos y es mamá de cuatro niños los cuales asisten a la escuela. Ella y su familia viven en una comunidad muy tranquila, es una zona mazahua y sus habitantes son muy amables, siempre tratan de salir delante de alguna manera.
