Abe, como las personas de su comunidad la conocen, tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor: a sus 29 años tiene una papelería que lleva funcionando ya siete años. Abe platica que inició su tienda de abarrotes porque tenía necesidad de apoyar a a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos; en primera instancia pensó en poner una tienda de abarrotes pero ya tenía mucha competencia. Entonces pensó en aprovechar el hecho de que había una escuela esta  muy cerca de su casa y pensó que una papelería también sería un muy buen negocio. “Inicie vendiendo solo algunas libretas, colores, lápices, bolígrafos, sacapuntas, lo más indispensable, pero poco a poco vi muchas ganancias y cada vez los clientes me solicitaban más cosas de papelería”. Explica que con créditos pequeños que la institución le ha hecho ha podido levantar su negocio poco a poco. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar artículos de papelería como libretas, hojas, sacapuntas, colores, craoyolas, etc. Se esta preparando para este regreso a clases, dice que actualmente sus ganancias están muy bajas pero porque no hay clases. Abe esta muy contenta y agradecida con el prestamo porque dice que su negocio ha crecido gracias  a los créditos, ha podido comprar una fotocopiadora, regalos, memorias micros y USBs, cuentos para niños, balones entre otros artículos que le han ayudado a aumentar sus ingresos. Todos los días Abe abre desde muy temprano su papelería para atender a sus clientes, le gusta tener mucho contacto con sus clientes por eso siempre trata de darles los mejores precios. 
La meta de Abe es poder llenar un poco mas su papelería, ella considera que le hacen falta varias cosas y le gustaría seguir con su negocio porque es una muy buena manera de poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar; de lo contrario, si llega a cerrar su papelería tendría que salir a trabajar y descuidar a sus niños.
texts.en:
Abelina is very friendly but above all very hard-working, she is 29 years old, married to Carlos and the mother of four children who attend school. She and her family live in a very quiet community. It is a Mazahua area and it's inhabitants are very friendly and are constantly trying to get ahead in some way.

Abe, as the people in her community know her, has a great entrepreneurial spirit. At 29, she has a stationary store that she has operated for seven years now. Abe says that she started her stationary shop because of the need to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children. At first she thought of opening a grocery store but there was a lot of competition. Then she thought of taking advantage of having a school quite close to her house and thought that a stationary store would be a good idea. "I started out with only a few notebooks, paint, pens, ballpoint pens, erasers, the most indispensable items but little by little saw good profit and every time clients asked for more stationary products. She explains that with the small loans that the institution awarded her she was able to better her business little by little.

This time she is requesting a loan to buy stationary products like notebooks, loose leaf paper, erasers, paint, crayons, etc. She is getting ready for the return to classes. She says that right now her profits are low as there are no classes. Abe is content and grateful for the loan because she says because of the loans her business has grown. Thanks to the loans she has been able to buy a photocopier, gifts, micro memory cards, USB sticks, children's stories, balls amongst others that have helped to increase her revenues. Every day Abe opens her shop very early to take care of her clients. She likes to have a lot of contact with her clients so she tries to offer them the best prices.

Abe's goal is to stock her stationary shop a bit more. she thinks that it is missing a number of things. She wants to continue with her business as it is a very good way to help with the family's expenses. And if on the other hand she were to close her shop she would have to go out and work and wouldn't be able to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, loose leaf paper, pens, pencils, etc.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has six children who are in school.

Judith has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Judith has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Speaking with Judy, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful mum, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar along with her two children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now, so she makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants.

Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Judy is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in permanently changing the life of Judy and her family. Kindly help him out!
You can help Judy fulfill her dream and improve her business with a loan that could change her life.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 51 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Catalina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marrietta

texts.en:
Marrietta is a married woman, 50 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marrietta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marrietta has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Emarie

texts.en:
Emarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emarie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fruits and vegetables, and other ingredients for her business.

Emarie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en:
Vrezh is 39 years old and lives with his wife, three children, and retired parents in the frontier village of Tsaghkunk in Tavush region. Here Vrezh always has been engaged in farming and agriculture, helping his father. Now he manages all the work alone, since his father is too unhealthy to work about the farm with him.

Vrezh has cows, pigs, and chickens on his farm and also has a large fruit and vegetable garden. These demand great effort and everyday work in order to receive some income for his big family, where he is a breadwinner. From his farm, with the help of his wife, Vrezh sells meat, milk, and eggs and also potatoes, beans, tomatoes, persimmons, figs, and apples.

Vrezh mentions that his farm’s income covers only the first needs of his family, but it could bring more income if he managed to increase the number of his farm cattle, which will allow him to sell more meat from his farm. So, he will use this loan of 400,000 Armenian drams he requests to purchase a bull, a pig, and also some fodder for farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a bull, a pig, and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas, rice, and beans for selling.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is a 38-year-old, married rural woman with three children (one son and two daughters). She is a housewife, and in her childhood she could not get enough opportunity to study and ended her education at grade five. She lives in the small village of Jogendrapur in Falakata with her family.

The main income for the family comes from agriculture. Rekha's husband, 47-year-old Manindra, is engaged in agribusiness. He has been cultivating and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for many years. He grows seasonal vegetables and fruits, which he sells to his regular customers in the local market. He has good experience in agriculture, but his monthly income from this business is too limited to cover the household costs.

He now wants to cultivate cucumbers on his farmland, as these have a good market all over India. Due to lack of capital and in order to yield a good harvest, Rekha applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for cucumber cultivation. She wants to increase her income and provide her family with a decent life.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm resources for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph. He is seventy-three years old, married with twelve children, and works hard to support his family.

He does dairy, maize, and beans farming. Having gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on Enterprise management and development he has gained a good number of customers in his enterprise. He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and animal feeds for his dairy cow. This loan will help him improve his milk production, thus generating more income to support his family.

Joseph is grateful to Kiva and it lenders for the help and support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and animal feeds for his dairy cows. This will  improve production.

loans.name: Tauinaola

texts.en: Tauinaola is a 59-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a business sewing and selling elei (colorful dyed fabrics) in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Tauinaola has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, needles etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and her children's education as well. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, scissors, thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: 1Ero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El ferrocarril revolucionó el crecimiento de la región donde se conformó el grupo "1Ero de Mayo" que impulsó el crecimiento de la demanda laboral. La ganadería y la agricultura alcanzaron su mayor auge, hoy en día el lugar se conoce como "La novia del sol" por las altas temperaturas que se alcanzan la mayor parte del año.

Los integrantes del grupo de préstamo y sus actividades son:

Araceli - Dulces
Luis –Medicina Naturista 
Maria-Calzado, Ropa, Plata.
Adriana - Dulces, Chicharrones Y Zapatos
Adela- Zapatos Y Cosméticos 
Braulia – Ropa 
Estela - Zapatos Y Bolsas

Don Luis tiene  61 años, es padre de 5 hijos actualmente ninguno de ellos depende económicamente de él, durante 10 años don Guicho  como le conocen  trabajo en una farmacia donde aprendió las formulas del medicamento además de haber estudiado una carrera técnica como farmacéutico.

Hace 30 años decidió independizarse e inicio con la venta de medicina naturista de manera ambulante  de lunes a viernes colocaba una manta en el suelo donde acomodaba la medicina, con el paso de los meses construyo unos anaqueles de madera donde exhibía de igual manera su mercancía, las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar, el apoyo económico a la madre de sus hijos para los gastos de los mismos.

Hoy en dia ha pasado de vender en la banqueta a vender en un pequeño local donde se encuentran otros comerciantes y solo el vende medicina naturista, ahora exhibe la medicina en unas redes, anaqueles y una mesa,  “la motivación principal siempre ha sido mi familia, brindarle lo mejor a mis hijos y ver crecer mi actividad”

Comenta que lo más difícil ha sido soportar los insultos de personas ignorantes que lo tratan de charlatán, si bien al principio era molesto hoy en día no le preocupa en lo más mínimo pues está seguro de lo que es  y contento por ganarse la vida de manera honrada.

Don Luis ha invertido  cada uno de los préstamos en la compra de gotas, pastillas, jabón, aceite y cascaras dependiendo del producto que más le haga falta, eso le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, quienes le buscan por el surtido, precio y trato que él les brinda por eso este préstamo lo invertirá en  cremas, pomadas, gotas y vinos.
“Gracias a quienes hacen posible los prestamos nos sean otorgados y con ellos poder cumplir nuestros sueños” son las palabras de agradecimiento de don Luis.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a los cuartos de renta de doña Braulia, don Luis es el único hombre en la foto y en el grupo.
texts.en:
The railroad revolutionized the region where the '1Ero De Mayo' (1st of May) group was formed. The railroad created a demand for labor and brought the agricultural and livestock industries to their peak.Today, the area is known as "La Novia del Sol" because of the high temperatures that it experiences throughout the year.

The group's members and their businesses are:

Araceli - Sweets

Luis - Natural medicines

Maria - Footwear, clothing, and silver

Adriana - Sweets, pork cracklings, and shoes

Adela - Shoes and cosmetics

Braulia - Clothing

Estela - Shoes and bags

Don Luis is 61 years old and is the father of five children. Presently, none of them depend financially on him. For 10 years Don Guicho, as he is known, worked in a pharmacy where he learned the formulas of medicines. He also studied a technical career as a pharmacist.

30 years ago he decided to become independent and started selling natural medicines as a street vendor from Monday to Friday. He put a blanket on the ground where he placed the medicines. With the passing of months, he built some wooden shelves where he displayed his merchandise the same way. The profits he got allowed him to meet some of the household expenses. He financially helped the mother of his children with the same expenses.

Today, he has moved from selling on the sidewalk to selling from a small shop where there are other merchants and he is the only one selling natural medicines. Now he displays the medicines in racks, shelves, and a table. "The main motivation has always been my family, to provide the best for my children, and to see my work grow." He says that the most difficult thing has been tolerating the insults from ignorant people who treat him like a charlatan. Although it was annoying at first, today it does not bother him in the least because he is sure of what things are and he is happy to be earning a living in an honest way.

Don Luis has invested each of the loans in the purchase of eye drops, pills, soap, oil, and natural supplements, depending on which product he most needed. This has allowed him to cover the needs of his customers, who seek him out for his assortment, price, and the treatment that he gives them. This is why he will invest this loan in creams, ointments, eye drops, and wine.

"Thank you to whomever makes it possible to grant us the loans; with them we can complete our dreams," are the words of appreciation from don Luis.

*The photo was taken in front of Doña Braulia's rental house. Don Luis is the only man in the photo and in the group.

loans.use: to buy creams, ointments, eye drops, and wine.

loans.name: Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
Una gigantesca extensión del territorio municipal se encuentra cubierta de agua por la presa  Miguel Alemán, a su vez se han formado pequeñas islas a las cuales solo se tienen acceso en lancha particular, chalupa o  en las pasajeras como le llaman los habitantes quienes en su mayoría se dedican a la pesca y a trabajar en el campo (cultivo de caña de azúcar).
En uno de los barrios de dicho municipio se formó el grupo llamado “las lomas” debido a que donde se reúnen esta en loma y al extremo igual, los integrantes actuales del grupo son:

Gregorio- Abarrotes 
Ángel- Mojarra Y Perfumes 
Guadalupe- Costuras (Bordadas)
Eugenia- Mojarra
Epifanía- Tamales 
Magdalena, Irma - Cosméticos
Evelia, Victoria - Comida
Ana- Comida Y Cosméticos 
Juana- Refresco
Jeny- Refresco Y Hielitos 

Ángel  estudio hasta tercer año de secundaria, tiene 39 años de edad y ha dedicado 12 años de su vida a recorrer las calles de las comunidades más alejadas para vender mojarras  por kilo para poder solventar los gastos de hogar y apoyar a su mamá. Para Ángel, dedicarse a la actividad de sus antecesores es un honor pues desde pequeño aprendió los gajes del oficio, el cual le abrió las puertas después de quedar desempleado. Ángel acude de lunes a viernes por la tarde a orillas de la represa a esperar al pescador que le vende las mojarras y le ayuda a limpiarlas, después de ello en casa las acomoda en pequeños mazos de 3 a 7 mojarras dependiendo el tamaño y el peso, las sujeta con un hilo u hoja de izote para tener un mejor control.

Para poder regresar a casa temprano Ángel sale de casa a más tardar las 6 de la mañana  iniciando la venta a las 8 de la mañana, ofreciendo mojarra de buen tamaño. Trato amable y precios accesibles además de dar crédito a sus clientes de mayor confianza.

El préstamo que ha recibido lo empleará en la compra de mojarra al igual que los prestamos anteriores asegurando el crecimiento de su actividad pues si en promedio por día vende 50 kilos espera poder vender más y esta consiente de lo que debe hacer para logarlo “todo esfuerzo y sacrifico trae consigo una recompensa” son sus palabras.

“Dios bendiga a cada una de las personas que han hecho posible se hagan realidad los suelos de los demás clientes” citaron los integrantes del grupo.

*La fotografía fue tomada en una de las lomas que hay en el barrio, que se observan detrás de los clientes, Ángel es quien porta los zapatos rojos.
texts.en:
A massive expanse of city land is covered by water from the Miguel Alemán dam. At the same time, small islands have formed which can only be accessed by private boat, canoe or on the passenger boats. These residents work mostly in fishing and agriculture (growing sugarcane). In one of the neighborhoods of said city, a group was formed with the name “Las Lomas” (The Hills) due to the area where they meet being at the end of a high hilltop.

The current group members are:
Gregorio- groceries
Ángel- fish and perfume
Guadalupe- needlework (embroidery)
Eugenia- fish
Epifanía- tamales
Irma - cosmetics
Victoria - food
Ana- food and cosmetics
Juana- refreshments
Jeny- refreshments and ice

Ángel studied until the third grade. He is 39 years old and has spent 12 years of his life roaming the streets of the most distant communities, selling fish by the kilogram to cover his household costs and to support his mother. For Ángel, working in the same business as his ancestors is an honor since he learned the job nuances from a young age. This opened doors for him after becoming unemployed. In the afternoon, from Monday through Friday, Ángel goes to the shoreline of the dam to await the fisherman who sells him the fish and helps him to clean them (remove the entrails). After this, he groups them into small sets of a minimum of 3 to 7 fish depending on the size and weight. He fastens them with a string and an Izote plant leaf, for better control. In order to return home early, Ángel leaves home at 6 in the morning, at the latest, and begins selling by 8 in the morning. He offers good sized fish, friendliness and affordable prices, in addition to selling on credit to his most trusted customers.

He will use the loan he has received to buy as much fish as with the previous loans, thus securing his business’s growth. On average, he sells 50 kilograms per day, hopes to be able to sell more and is aware of the what he needs to do to achieve this. “All effort and sacrifice brings about a reward” are his words. “God bless each one of the people who have made possible the dreams of the other clients becoming a reality” state the group members.

*The photograph was taken on one of the hills in the neighborhood, which you can see behind the clients. Ángel is wearing red shoes.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is one of those women who are determined and who are not limited by their age. Susan decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Susan is married and blessed with four lovely children who she refers to as “my heartbeat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income.

Deciding to practice poultry farming for Susan was not difficult. For the past five years, she has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates a business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold.

If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Susan is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Susan is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

You can help Susan fulfill her dream and improve her poultry business with a loan that could change her life.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 46 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

Ma. Liza is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Liza has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a 54-year-old married woman. She is illiterate, and can only sign her name. She lives with her husband Hasaruddin at their own small house in a small village of Falakata. They are blessed with two daughters and two sons. Her daughters are married.

Hajara’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Hajara assists her husband in his agribusiness after managing her household work. Now they think of cultivating a crop that is profitable and an all-season crop. So, they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help to start paddy cultivation.

Hajara has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer and seeds for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize paddy cultivation work, and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business, as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. In the future, she dreams to build a concrete house for her family with the generated profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Lakhi

texts.en:
Lakhi, a 24-year-old woman, stays in a small village called Rabindranagar at Falakata, in Alipuduar district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and one toddler son. Lakhi takes care of her livestock, and her husband is engaged in a furniture business.

Lakhi has a cow in her herd and sells milk to the villagers. Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family, so Lakhi devotes full time to her small milk-selling business to support her family financially. Because of the growing expenses of daily essential commodities, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. She now wants to expand her business by purchasing a new dairy cow. So, Lakhi seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a dairy cow.

She is very hopeful that this investment will support her to earn more and help her to save money for strengthening her family’s economy.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Telesa

texts.en: Telesa is 33 years old and unmarried with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Telesa has requested a loan to buy shopping bags, cooking oil, a frying pan, sugar, and flour. She joined SPBD in July this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Telesa will use her profit to support her family financially and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, cooking pots, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Prospero

texts.es:
Próspero tiene 43 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicado en la región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Próspero se dedica a destilacion de aguardiente ( llonque) y adicionalmente a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Próspero espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Próspero is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in a rural area in the district of Callayuc, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly make a living from agriculture, ranching, and trade. 

Próspero makes a living from distilling aguardiente as well as raising and selling cattle. He works from home. He has five years of experience in the business and he has very good personal and professional references. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more cattle, as well as to buy feed for them. By doing this, Próspero hopes to offer a better product to his clients, which will enable him to generate more income and increase his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 38 years old and married with three children. All of them are in school.

Annalou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Annalou has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Annalou aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Frizz Ann

texts.en:
Frizz Ann is 22 years old and single with one child. Frizz Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Frizz Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, biscuits, noodles, spices, bread and other personal care products.

Frizz Ann has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, biscuits, noodles, spices, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 66 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Corazon has been in this business for 30 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 41 years old and has eight children. Florencia is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Florencia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Florencia has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and has four children. Maricel is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Clarita

texts.en:
Ma. Clarita is 45 years old and married. 

Ma. Clarita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Clarita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Clarita has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en:
Ritchell is 33 years old and has four children. Ritchell is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Ritchell is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ritchell requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ritchell has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ritchell would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 44 years old, married with six children.

Mylene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mylene has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mylene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra works hard to support her family. Isidra is married and has a basket making business in the Philippines.

Isidra requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Isidra has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Isidra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her basket weaving business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 46 years old, married with one child who is in school. 

Sylvia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sylvia has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 39 years old and has four children. Lorna is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorna has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Isaías De Jesús

texts.es: Isaías de 74 años es un empresario con un gran espíritu emprendedor que inició su comercialización de queso, suero y yogur en el año 2007; motivado por la propuesta de un amigo, quien le solicitó que le ayudara en la venta estos productos lácteos, Isaías pudo comercializar entre sus conocidos con gran acogida y le pareció una excelente oportunidad de negocio.  Su amigo le ofreció el contacto del proveedor y con su propio capital empezó a comprar y vender yogures de sabores exóticos; kiwi, mango, coco y manzana, así mismo variedades de queso y suero. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en productos lácteos al por mayor como queso, suero y yogures de diferentes sabores.  Con esta inversión podrá  responder a los encargos de los clientes y su margen de ganancia aumentará por haber comprado a un precio más bajo. Su meta familiar es continuar viviendo en compañía de su cónyuge y seguir en su negocio.
texts.en: Isaías, 74 years old, is a businessman with a great entrepreneurial spirit who began selling cheese, whey and yogurt in the year 2007. Motivated by the suggestion of a friend who asked him to help him selling these dairy products, Isaías could sell among his acquaintances with a great welcome and it seemed to him to be an excellent business opportunity. His friend offered him contact with the provider and with his own capital he began to buy and sell yogurts in exotic flavors: kiwi, mango, coconut, and apple, and also varieties of cheese and whey. Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan, through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in dairy products in bulk such as cheese, whey and different flavors of yogurt. With this investment, he will be able to respond to his customers' orders and his margin of profit will increase for having bought at a lower price. His family goal is to continue living with his spouse and continue in his business.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products in bulk such as cheese, whey and yogurt in different flavors.

loans.name: Zymratkan

texts.ru: Зымраткан, 30 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей женской, мужской и детской одеждой на рынке. Благодаря упорному труду Зымраткан, в обороте есть товар на сумму 160,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 23,000 сом (KGS). Зымраткан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для реализации. Доходы от кредита Зымраткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zymratkan is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family she works with selling women's, men's and children's clothing at the market.

Thanks to persistent work, Zymratkan has goods worth 160,000 som (KGS) in stock. The monthly income is on average 23,000 som (KGS).

Zymratkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase clothing for selling. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling in her shop.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is 29 years old and single with three children. She runs a small business selling soup and noodles in her community and has been doing this for two years. Ida has requested a loan to buy shopping bags, cooking oil, spoons, cooking pots, etc. She joined SPBD in July this year, 2015, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ida will use her profit to support her children's education and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a cooking pot, shopping bags, spoon, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory is 36 years old, lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province. Cambodia. She had been married since 2000 and has four sons and one daughter. There are four who have studied at primary school and the last one is still too young.

Sory has been a farmer and raises cows for 10 years, while her husband has been a construction constructor for 7 years. Presently, Sory wants to increase her income so she would like to apply for a loan to purchase materials for construction and purchase some vegetables to sell at her home store. She wants to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase constructions materials and vegetables to sell at her home store.

loans.name: Faia

texts.en: Faia is 52 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Faia has requested a loan to buy cornflour, cooking oil, shopping bags, sugar, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faia will use her profit to pay for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cornflour, cooking oil, shopping bags, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman, 52 years old with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonila has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her local market.

Leonila has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her local market

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Melencia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children in college and to build a house for her family

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Adalinda

texts.es:
Adalinda, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas para mantener a su familia, tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya están a acompañados y son independientes, 2 más trabajan y los últimos 2 estudian.

Adalinda, vive en una zona donde no existen muchas alternativas de trabajo, ella solo se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero debe estar pendiente de las actividades agrícolas, porque en la época lluviosa tienen que aprovechar para sembrar los grano básicos, en los trabajos agrícolas se involucra sus hijos.

Adalinda, actualmente no disponen del dinero suficiente para invertir en actividades agrícolas, junto a su esposo han decidido solicitar un préstamo para las labores agrícolas, ya que no disponen de todo el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas como herbicidas, semillas, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar: con la aprobación del crédito, podrá disponer del capital y así producir sus propios alimentos y una parte de la cosecha venderla. 

Los sueños de Adalinda, hacer una casa, que sus hijos estudien y se gradúen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Adalinda is 49 years old. She is a very humble and hardworking woman. She studied until the third grade. She is accompanied by her partner who works in agriculture in order to support their family. They have 6 children, of which 2 are already accompanied and independent and 2 more are working and the last 2 are students.

Adalinda lives in an area where there are not many alternative ways of working. She only dedicates herself to doing the household chores, but you should be aware of the agricultural activities because in the rainy season they have to take advantage of planting basic grains. Their children are involved in the agriculture work.

Adalinda currently does not have enough money to invest in agriculture activities and together with her husband has decided to ask for an agricultural loan as they do not have the money to buy agricultural supplies such as herbicides, seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for manual labor for seeding. With the loan approval they will have the capital in order to produce their own food and to sell a part of the harvest. Adelinda dreams of having a house and of her children studying and graduating from university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as herbicides, seeds, fertilizers and to pay for manual labor for seeding.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 6 años edad, todos están estudiando y dependen economicamente de ella.

María, tiene una tienda en su casa, en la cual sus hijas le ayudan a atenderla, los fines de semana hace comida tipica como tamales, tostadas de plátano, enredos, enchiladas y empanadas para vender; pero tambien le ayuda a una vecina a hacer tortillas y ella le paga por ese trabajo; decidio dedicarse a estos tipos de negocios, para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

El crédito que está solicitando es para ampliar su tienda con productos como arroz, frijoles, pan, café y para comprar insumos para hacer los típicos.

El sueño de María, es darle a sus hijos la oportunidad que estudien y tambien sueña con ampliar su vivienda, para que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su cuarto.
texts.en:
María, 35 years old, is a homemaker, went to school up to the second grade, is single, and has 4 children, ages 16, 14, 12 and 6, all of whom are students and depend on her economically.

María has a store in her house, and her daughters help her to run it. On the weekend she makes traditional foods such as tamales, plantain tostadas, enredos [a traditional snack of fried yucca] , enchiladas, and empanadas to sell, but also a neighbor helps her make tortillas and she pays her for this work. She decided to work in these types of businesses to help her children with their studies.

The loan that she is requesting is to expand her store with products such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee, and to purchase supplies to make traditional foods.

María's dream is to give her children an opportunity to have an education and she also dreams of expanding her house so that each of her children has their own room.

loans.use: to expand her store with products such as rice, beans, bread, coffee and to purchase supplies to make traditional foods.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.

Sandra has been in this business for 5 years. Sandra earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es: Ana Karen tiene 27 años, es soltera y vive en Guadalajara, un hermoso lugar en México que representa muy bien la cultura del país. Ana Karen es arquitecta por profesión y creadora por pasión. Ella trabaja en una oficina gubernamental en el departamento de arquitectura, sin embargo ella hace más de un año se dedicó a hacer remodelaciones con amigos y de ahí le surgió la idea de poner su propio despacho de arquitectura, ella quiere lograr ser el despacho más reconocido de la zona y dedicarse cien por ciento a su negocio, por ahora su negocio lo tiene en su casa. Una de sus principales dificultades actualmente es la falta de capital, ya que al tener pocos proyectos no genera tantas ganancias, por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 15,000 para poder tener un stock de materiales para todos los proyectos que tenga o que vaya a tener en un futuro. Se define como emprendedora por las ganas que tiene de ser autosuficiente y por no tener temor al fracaso. Se siente muy motivada y comprometida con este préstamo, ya que podrá tener un margen de ganancia más amplio.
texts.en:
27-year old Ana Karen is single and lives in Guadalajara, a beautiful part of Mexico that representative of the culture of the country. She is an architect by profession and a creator by passion. She works in a government office in the Department of Architecture.

A year ago she was doing some renovations with friends, and the idea of opening her own architect business was born. Ana Karen wishes to become the best known architect office in the area and devote herself 100% to her business. Currently she runs it out of her home.

One of the difficulties she faces is a lack of capital. While she has a few projects, they do not generate a lot of income. For this reason she is seeking a loan of MXN 15,000 to buy the materials necessary for her upcoming remodeling projects. Ana Karen characterizes herself as enterprising because of her great desire to be self-sufficient and lack of worry about failure. She is very motivated and committed to this loan as she will be able to have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to have her own stock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 60 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She practices farming, mainly cabbage, spinach and potatoes. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and manure so as to boost farming production. She hopes that this will enable generate more income hence pay school fees for her children.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure hence boost farming production for increased income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Young Stars S.hg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo holding a passbook is Grace. She is 27 years old, single and living with her two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She practices farming; grows maize, beans and potatoes. She also operates a butchery to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer so as to boost farming production. This will increase her income to enable her support her family by meeting the basic needs e.g. food and clothing.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer so as to boost farming production for increased income and provide better food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty Kyrey está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Las 23 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
Una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se destaca en este grupo es la Sra. Sandra, quien ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de empanadas, milanesas, y todo tipo de minutas, y también vende ropas para poder ganarse la vida de una manera honesta y digna. Ella se define a sí misma como una mujer muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide ese préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir esforzándose por salir adelante, y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Aty Kyrey is in its 6th loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is located in the city of Caacupé. The 23 members of the committee put a lot of effort into being able to get ahead with their families. 

One very hard-working and determined woman who stands out in this group is Sandra, who helps support her family with the sale of empanadas, breaded meat, and all sorts of snacks and also sells clothing to be able to earn her living in an honest and dignified way. She defines herself as a very hard-working woman who puts her all into being able to help her family. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to be able to make her foods such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, and more, and in this way be able to continue working hard to get ahead, and is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to improve.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Semeatu

texts.en:
Semeatu is a 23-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows beans and pumpkins to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Semeatu has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rakes, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, plastic bags, a weed sprayer, etc.

She has been a member of SPBD since July 2015. With her profits, Semeatu hopes to expand her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rakes, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, plastic bags, a weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a 35-year-old member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is from Caloocan and married to Jopy. She has been engaged in different businesses for 7 years. She has her own variety store, which is also known in the Philippines as “Sari-sari” store and where you can buy cheap items. Basically, most sari-sari stores can be found in every Barangays, Municipalities even in Cities. Products here are cheap, since for only P1.00 you can buy a piece of candy or any sweets, compared to supermarkets where most products are being sold in wholesale. While on a sari-sari store, you can buy a sachet of shampoo, powder drink and so much more.  She also sells viands for lunch and dinner and a burger stand as well. She is earning for approximately Php 20,000 each month for all of these businesses.

She has children to raise; one in the high school level and the other one in grade school. Anabelle wants to take advantage of the support CCT may offer as they conduct seminars and lectures for aspiring entrepreneurs. She decided to apply for a loan of P24,000 to add grocery items for her variety store, ingredients for her mini canteen and burger stand. Even though her application is on the review status, she wants to thank lenders for having a compassionate heart in helping other people in need.

Being a long time member of CCT, Anabelle has been consistently attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made she to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store, ingredients for her mini canteen and burger stand.

loans.name: Los Tigres Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS TIGRES, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Colquepata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Luis tiene 39 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a la agricultura, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  este negocio  el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, él socio a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Los Triges"communal bank which is located in the district of Colquepata, in the province of Paucartambo and Cusco department.

Luis is 39 years old, is married and has four children. He combines his daily activities with working in agriculture. He is a responsible and diligent person. He has been in his business for quite some time and it gives him personal satisfaction. At the same time he also works raising small animals, this being the way he gets his family ahead.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy seeds and manure amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful for the loan awarded and promise to comply with the payment of the established installments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure amongst others.

loans.name: Dieynabou

texts.fr:
Ce membre fait partie d'un groupe  crée depuis 2009.LE groupe est constitué de membres issues de la même commune.Ces dernières s'activent dans le petit commerce.Elles fréquentent les marches de la commune et aussi les marchés hebdomadaires situés dans la zone.
Dieynaba est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont quatre garçons.Elle s'active dans la vente des tissus teintés et des poissons.Elle s'approvisionne au mali ou en guinée pour les tissus et pour le poisson à mbour pour ensuite revendre au sein de sa localité.Elle compte acheter cinquante pièces de tissu teinté à 10000 et quatre caisses de poissons à 50000 la caisse.Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra d'assurer la scolarité de son enfant qui   poursuit ces études supérieures à dakar. Ce bénéfice lui permettra aussi de consolider son activé.
texts.en:
This member is a part of a group established in 2009. The group consists of members from the same community. They are involved in petty trade. They frequent the community markets along with the weekly markets that they have in the area.

Dieynaba is married and is the mother of eight children (four boys). Her business is selling coloured fabrics and fish. She obtains her stock of fabric from Mali or Guinea and the fish from Mbour so she can then resell it in her locality. She plans to buy 50 pieces of coloured fabric for 10000 and four cases of fish for 50000 each. The profits will guarantee her child the ability to pursue his university studies in Dakar. Furthermore, she will be able to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy fish and coloured fabric

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Bella Mae

texts.en:
Bella Mae works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now and earns additional income from food vending.

Bella Mae requested a 2,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Edelia

texts.en:
Edelia works hard to support her family. Edelia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing like net, rope, gasoline, etc.

Edelia has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fishing like net, rope, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a widowed woman, 65 years old with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food production/vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her business.

Antonieta has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Christine Mae

texts.en:
Christine Mae is 34 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Christine Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Christine Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Christine Mae has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Christine Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hermogena

texts.en:
Aldrie is 21 years old and is 4th of five children in the family. His mother Hermogena is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Aldrie is studying Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently on his 1st of this 4-year course.

Hermogena is borrowing PHP 19500 to pay tuition fees of her son Aldrie for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Aldrie plans to be gainfully employed so he could help to improve the quality of life of his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fees in IT

loans.name: Mercedes Pamela

texts.es:
Mercedes una joven ecuatoriana emprendedora tiene 23 años nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz, es soltera vive en casa propia con sus hermanas, está estudiando en la universidad y para solventar sus gastos tiene un pequeño negocio de que consiste en la elaboración de empanadas, yogurt, y leche de soya, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien por muchos años se dedicó a esta actividad. 
Hoy necesita que se le ayude con un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima y un horno industrial adicional, así su producción se incrementará y podrá aumentar su clientela. Mercedes se dedica de 4 a 5 horas diarias a la producción de las empanadas y además de cuidar a sus hermanas y familia, por lo que su aporte es un pilar más para los gastos de la casa.
Mercedes quiere agradecer y felicitar a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal, además de poder seguir estudiando y preparándose.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an entrepreneurial young woman from Ecuador. She is 22 years old and was born in the city of Latacunga in the La Matriz parish in the Republic of Ecuador. She is single and lives in her own house with her sisters. She is studying at the university, and in order to cover her expenses she has a small business making empanadas, yogurt, and soy milk. She learned this business from her mother, who did this work for many years. 

Her greatest obstacle in life has been overcoming her separation from her parents, since they left when she was a child and it was very hard for her and her siblings to go through that difficult process.

Today she needs help with a loan that she will use to buy a stove and an industrial oven. This will serve to minimize time and effort when making her product. Mercedes spends 4 to 5 hours daily making empanadas and other items. Mercedes wants to extend her sincere thanks and greetings to Kiva for making it possible to grow in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and industrial oven to reduce her service time and build loyalty from her customers.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is very thankful with the loan granted to her by Kiva in the amount of PhP 30,000 in which she bought toys, slippers, and frozen meat products for her store. Thanks to the loan Remy income increase as she was able to supply and sell toys and frozen meat products to her customers and the revenue of the income helps a lot with her family needs.

Up to date Remy continuously selling her frozen meat products and since its school days her frozen meat such as hotdogs, sausages, hamburger patty and ham are in-demand for packed lunch of students. Remy now also cooked breakfast food for additional income. She wake up early and cooked some of her frozen goods to sell for breakfast while she tends to her grocery store (sari-sari store).

Remy is now requesting for a reloan in the amount of PhP 30,000 to buy more frozen meat products and assorted groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and rice to restock her grocery store.

Remy is still working hard to sustain their family needs especially the education of her children. She still saving for her freezer but most of all her determination to increase her income and save is because she wanted to put her children in college.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meat products and assorted groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and rice to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: para comprar leche e insumos para la elaboracion de queso, crema, cuajadas.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María, de 71 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta quinto grado, no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, se casó y junto con su esposo procrearon 4 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y trabajan para sus propios hogares, luego su esposo falleció debido a una enfermedad y María quedo viuda y solo vive con 3 nietos.

María, tiene un cafetin pequeño desde hace 15 años, coloco este negocio debido a la necesidad de darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar jugos, gaseosas, galletas, golosinas, dulces, jabón, lejía, rinso, etc. de esa manera logrará ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.

El sueño de María, es tener una tienda más grande, para poder ofrecer más productos.
texts.en:
María, 71 years old, is a homemaker, went to school up to the fifth grade, and didn't continue her education due to the lack of economic resources. She got married and with her husband had 4 children, all of whom are adults and work for their own households, later her husband died due to an illness and María was left a widow and only lives with 3 grandchildren.

María has had a small snack stand for 15 years, she established this business due to the necessity to give her children everything necessary.

The loan that she is requesting it to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc., in this way she will manage to offer more product variety to her customers.

María's dream is to have a larger store, to be able to offer more products.

loans.use: to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Faasiu

texts.en:
Faasiu is a 35-year-old widow with nine children. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has three years of experience in this business.

Faasiu has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, material, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to develop another new business to earn more income. She joined SPBD in 2103 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, material, etc.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a village with her family. She is married. She is an agrarian.

For almost three years she has had a business with keeping livestock. Before her business with livestock she planted cucumbers and tomatoes in her garden. Year by year her practice became wider and she began using new ideas and plans in her agricultural business.

She is a business lady and a careful mother. Recently, she has been operating a business with her husband. They have rented land where they planted agricultural products such as tomatoes, cucumbers, rice, and other cereals. She likes this activity. She works on the land well and joyfully.

She is willing to widen her business and have a good harvest. She hopes IMON and KIVA will help her to organize her business to be more productive and efficient. She is planning to rent more land and plant agricultural products. Fotima wants to have a big harvest.

loans.use: to rent more land and plant agricultural products.

loans.name: Linda Vista Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido al municipio se pueden apreciar los cerros que rodean diferentes comunidades, se aprecian sembradíos de caña de azúcar y limones al igual que dos de los ingenios con mayor producción de azúcar durante la zafra.
En la colonia Linda vista se integró un grupo hace ya 5 años y sus integrantes decidieron ponerle el nombre de la colonia donde viven por ello “linda vista” actualmente el grupo lo integran 10 clientas, ellas son:
 
Susana, Irma, Rosalina, Magdalena -Abarrotes
Soledad –Tamales 
Lina – Calzado Por Catalogo 
Alejandra - Guardería
Angelina – Ropa 
Guillermina – Botanas (Semillas)
Ángeles – Hot Dog

Susana tiene 37 años de edad, dios le dio la gran dicha de ser madre de una niña de 9 años y un niño de 5 meses, vive en unión libre con Domingo, desde hace ya 8 años Susi como le llaman en la colonia recibió el traspaso de una tienda de abarrotes que era de su mama, lo que le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hija quien es ese entonces tenía 6 años, las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido continuar con la tienda puesto que invierte en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, sopa, aceite, huevos, atún, sardina, mayonesa, chiles enlatados, refresco, galletas y sabritas por mencionar algunos productos los cuales compra en mayor cantidad cuando recibe el préstamo.

Sus dos hijos son el motor principal para continuar y dar lo mejor de sí día a día, ofrecerles un mejor futuro  y un patrimonio es su más preciado anhelo, en esta ocasión el préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar; azúcar, café, aceite, leche, detergente, papel higiénico y refrescos.

Las ganancias además de emplearla en la tienda y los gastos de sus hijos le han sido de utilidad para cambiar la estufa, el refrigerador y dos ventiladores  “me gusta trabajar, atender bien a cada uno de mis clientes, ver sonreír a mis hijos me motiva”

En un futuro Susi espera poder iniciar con la cría y venta de puercos o bien poner una carnicería al lado de la tienda incrementando sus ingresos.

El grupo agradece a Visión F México y KIVA  por cada uno de los préstamos otorgados garantizando un crecimiento continuo en sus actividades.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Irma, Susi es quien viste blusa color melón y está cargando a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: When traveling to the municipality, one can see the hills which surround different communities and the sown fields of sugarcane and lemons, as well as two of the sugar mills with the largest sugar production during the sugar harvest. In the Linda Vista district, a group was formed 5 years ago, and its members decided to name it as the place where they live, thus "Linda Vista" (Beautiful view). Currently, the group has 10 members. They are:  Susana, Irma, Rosalina, Magdalena - Grocery Store Items, Soledad –Tamales, Lina – Footwear by catalog, Alejandra - Daycare Center, Angelina – Clothing,  Guillermina – Botanas (Seeds), Ángeles – Hot Dogs. Susana is 37 years old. God gave her the joy of a 9 year old daughter and a 5 month old boy. She lives in domestic partnership with Domingo for 8 years already. Susi, as she is called here, had her mother's grocery store transferred to her, which has allowed her to pay for her daughter's expenses, who was 6 years old at the time. The earned income has allowed her to continue with the store, because she has invested it to buy rice, beans, sugar, soup, oil, eggs, tuna fish, sardines, mayonnaise, canned chiles, beverages, cookies and chips, just to mention some of the products she buys in big quantity when she gets the loan. Her two children are her main motivation to continue and give the best of her day by day. To offer them a better future and assets is her most precious wish. This time, the loan will be useful to buy: sugar, coffee, oil, milk, detergent, toilet paper and beverages. Besides using the earnings for the store and for her children's expenses, they will be helpful to change the stove, refrigerator and two fans. "I like to work, to assist each and every one of my customers. My children's smiles motivate me." In the future, Susi hopes to be able to raise and sell pigs or to open a butcher shop next to her store, increasing her income. The group is grateful to Vision F Mexico and Kiva for all the given loans, which guarantee a constant growth in their activities. "The photograph was taken at Irma's house. Susi is dressed in melon color blouse and is carrying her small son.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, oil, milk, detergent, toilet paper and beverages.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a 6,750 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Rosalinda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 26 years old and married with two children, who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jane has been running her pig fattening business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Manuel Alexander

texts.es:
Manuel, vive en casa familiar junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos, todos sus hijos estudian primaria y dependen del trabajo que realiza don Manuel; se dedica a cultivar maíz por medio de regadillo y práctica la crianza de ganado, su negocio funciona desde hace 5 años, sus trabajos los realiza en terrenos arrendados y están ubicados en una zona húmeda lo que le permite tener cosechas abundantes.
Con el crédito comprara dos vaquillas para fortalecer la ganadería, espera que aparte de tener buenos cultivos la producción de ganado sea mayor, de esta manera sus ganancias serán mejores y responderá a positivamente a sus obligaciones.
Sus aspiraciones son comercializar a buen precio el ganado, continuar ampliando su negocio y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in the family house with his wife and four children, all of his children are in primary school and depend on the work that Manuel does. He works growing corn with irrigation and raises cattle. His business has been running for 5 years, he does his work on rented land and it is located in a humid zone that permits him to have abundant harvests.

With the loan, he will purchase two heifers to strengthen his herd, he hopes that apart from having good crops, the cattle production will be greater, in this way his earnings will be more and he will respond positively to his obligations.

His aspirations are to sell his cattle at a good price, to continue expanding his business, and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to strengthen his herd, he hopes that besides having good crops, the cattle production will be greater.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene grandes beneficios por haber invertido el crédito anterior en su venta de tortillas, tiene más afluencia de clientes, con sus nuevos ingresos ha tenido oportunidad de realizarse chequeos médicos y pueda pagar a una persona que le atienda el negocio unos días para ella poder descansar.
Como la temporada de cosechas no ha sido muy buena la materia prima para su negocio tendera a aumentar de precio, es por tal motivo que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz y leña al mayoreo, tendrá materiales para preparar la venta de tortillas ahorrara en la compra y tendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María has great benefits for having invested the previous loans in her tortilla sales, she has more customer flow, and with her new income she has had the opportunity to have medical checks and can pay a person who runs the business some days so she can rest.

As the harvest season has not been very good, raw material for her business will tend to increase in price, for this reason she has decided to ask for another loan to purchase corn and firewood in bulk, she will have the materials to prepare the tortillas for sale and will save in the purchase and will have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood in bulk, she will have materials to prepare tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Cumanda

texts.es:
La señora Patricia una mujer luchadora de 34 años vive y tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos  este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso, el clima es cálido húmedo , tradicionalmente realizan fiestas en honor al patrono San Bernabé , mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos que estudian en la escuela, el esposo trabaja como administrador en una finca del sector. 
Se dedica a la venta de productos por revista como yambal aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia al mismo le dedica unas 6 horas por día solo los fines de semana, porque de lunes a viernes ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos de la finca, ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios; solicita este crédito para adquirir más mercadería, con esta nueva inversión mejorar sus ingresos económicos y podrá ayudar a la preparación de sus hijos, la Señora Patricia  agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidad brindada
texts.en:
Patricia, a hardworking 34-year-old, lives and owns her business in a small precinct named San Bernabé. She has a solid common-law relationship, with two children from the relationship, both of whom are in school. Her partner works as a manager on a farm in the area. She comes from a family with few financial resources and she didn’t manage to continue her schooling.

San Bernabé is located in the northwestern part of Pichincha province in the San Miguel de los Barcos canton. This area is often visited by national and foreign tourists in order to enjoy the marvelous inns and restful spots. The climate is hot and humid. Traditionally, they have parties in honor of their patron saint San Bernabé.

Patricia works selling catalog products such as Yambal. She learned this line of work through her own initiative. She works on this some six hours per day, only on the weekends, because from Monday to Friday she helps her husband at his farm jobs. She is asking for this loan to get more merchandise. With this new investment she can improve her income and will be able to help prepare her children. Patricia is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and opportunities given to her.

loans.use: to get more merchandise and thus expand her business, which in the future will help to prepare her children.

loans.name: Salla's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de médina est crée depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de femmes issues de la meme localité et de villages environnants.Elle s'active dans le domaine de l'agriculture.
ALLASANE situé à l’extrême droite de la photo et levant la main est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mère de  deux enfants dont un garçon.Elle s'active dans la culture de l' arachide pendant l'hivernage.Elle est dans ce domaine depuis plusieurs années.
Le prêt octroyé permettra à ALLASSANE d'acheter des semences d'arachides.
Elle compte acheter cinq sacs d'arachides décortiqués à 25000f le sac et deux sacs d'engrais.
le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was established in July 2011. It consists of women from the same locality and from the surrounding villages. It does its business in the agriculture sector.

ALLASANE is on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and is the lead borrower. She is married and the mother of two children (one boy). Her business is growing peanuts during the rainy season. She has been doing this for many years.
The loan will allow her to buy peanut seeds.

She plans to buy five bags of peeled peanuts for 25000f per bag and two bags of fertiliser.

The profits will allow her to meet the family's needs.
