loans.use: to buy peanut seeds

loans.name: Corona De Cristo Group

texts.es:
El camino hacia la comunidad es terracería, a los lados  del camino se pueden observar los cañales, potreros y cerros que cubren la comunidad, donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo pues la zona es 100 % cañera, algunos de los habitantes hablan mazateco.

En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado “Corona de Cristo” pues una de las integrantes se dedica a la siembra y venta de plantas de diferentes especies y cuando e grupo se formó la corona de cristo florecía.
Las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Isabel –Plantas 
Luisa - Comida
Fidelina -Refresco
Margarita – Ropa 
Sarahi – Zapatos 

Doña Isabel es conocida por todos como “Chabe” está casada con  don Lucio, desde hace 10 años con ayuda de su esposo y por el gusto por las plantas inicio con un pequeño vivero en el patio de su casa donde siembra platas de diferentes especies y cuando cada una de ellas florece pintan de color el patio, las plantas las vende a los visitantes que acuden hasta la comunidad para adquirirlas, comenta que las más vendidas son; dalias, corona de cristo, izoras, palmas y pata de elefante, su iniciativa le han orientado a fabricar su propia composta con ayuda de las hijas de los árboles.

Su hijo les apoya con el cuidado de las platas cuando puede, doña Chabe cuida sus platas como si fueran sus hijos “estoy contenta con mis plantas, mi familia, el sentirme útil  y obtener ingresos me motivan” con el préstamo anterior compro abono, bolsas y variedad de platas cumpliendo su cometido de vender platas en la feria del pueblo.

El préstamo que le han otorgado lo empleara en la compra de bolsas plásticas, plantas, abono y cajas para siembra y trasplante.  “No cualquiera tiene mano para sembrar plantas y que peguen'”  son las palabras de doña Chabe quien realiza acodos para producir más plantas y ofrecer un amplio surtido a sus clientes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Chabe donde acomoda sus plantas, en la foto doña Chabe es quien viste blusa verde, falda floreada.
texts.en:
The road to this community is unpaved, and on both sides of the road you can see the sugar cane fields, pasture land, and hills that cover the area.  Here most people farm, as this is a 100% sugarcane area.  Some of the residents speak Mazateco.  In this community, the communal bank called "Corona de Cristo" was formed, as one of the members works cultivating and selling a variety of species of plants, and when the group got together the "corona de Cristo" (passionflower) plant was blooming.  The following lists the members and their activities:


Isabel –Plants
Luisa - food
Fidelina - drinks
Margarita – clothing 
Sarahi – shoes 

Isabel, known by all as "Chabe," is married to Lucio.  Ten years ago, with the help of her husband, and because she loved plants, she started a small nursery on the patio of her house where she cultivated a variety of species of plants.  When each of them bloomed, the patio was washed with color, and she would sell the plants to the visitors that would come to her from the community to buy plants.  She mentions that the best sellers are: Dahlias, Corona de Cristo, Ixoras, palms, and Beaucarnea plants.  On her own initiative she has made her own compost from the trees with the help of her daughters.  Her son helps her care for the plants when he can.

Chabe cares for her plants as if they were her children. "I am content with my plants and my family, and feeling useful and making money motivate me," she says.  With her previous loan, she bought organic fertilizer, plastic bags, and a variety of plants to fulfill her commitment to sell plants in the town fair. She will use this loan to buy plastic bags, plants, fertilizer, and boxes for planting and transplanting.  "Not everyone has the hands to plant plants and have them 'stick'," are the words of Chabe, who propagates plants by layering in order to produce more plants and offer a good selection to her customers.  

Note:  the photograph was taken in the patio where Chabe keeps her plants.  In the photo, Chabe is the one wearing a blue shirt and a flowered skirt.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, plants, fertilizers, and boxes for her crops

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Mayler Yamile

texts.es:
Mayler es una joven de 24 años de edad, residente del municipio de Puerto de Boyacá, ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía, su sueño es comprar una vivienda y regalársela a su madre (ver foto), una ilusión que están persiguiendo juntas.

Es un trabajo muy cooperativo, mientras una está caminando por las veredas vendiendo sus productos, la otra se queda en casa vendiendo en una vitrina, es un pequeño espacio que paso a paso van convirtiendo en un almacén.

Mayler proyecta su negocio como el mejor de la vereda, quiere superar honestamente a la competencia para ello necesita capital con el cual darle rotación a sus clientes y estar siempre actualizada en moda y tendencias en belleza.

Solicita un monto de dinero el cual quiere invertir en la compra principalmente: perfumes, zapatos y adicional hará un pedido adicional de productos de belleza que le generan buena utilidad y le solicitan bastante.
texts.en:
Mayler is a 24-year-old young woman, a resident of the municipality of Puerto de Boyacá. She works selling merchandise. Her dream is to purchase a house and give it to her mother (see photo), a dream they are pursuing together.
sidewalks
It is very cooperative work, while one is walking the streets selling their products, the other stays at home, selling from a display case, it is a small space that step by step they are making into a shop.

Mayler plans for her business to be the best on the street, she wants to overtake the competition honestly, so she needs capital with which she will give her customers a rotation and always be up-to-date in fashion and trends in beauty.

She asks for an amount of money which she wants to invest in the purchase of primarily perfumes, shoes and in addition will make an additional order of beauty products which generate good profit and are requested a lot.

loans.use: to purchase primarily perfumes, shoes, and in addition she will make an additional order of beauty products which generate good profit and are requested a lot.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha de 49 años de edad, es una campesina, trabajadora y pujante, la cual ha entregado cuerpo y alma al campo y a su familia, se dedica a la cría de ganado de levante, actividad que aprendió de su esposo y que ejerce de 6 a 7 días a la semana  4 horas diarias.

Martha es una toda una guerrera de la vida, a pesar de una incapacidad sale todos los días a trabajar demostrando que las mujeres no son el sexo débil.

Persiguiendo su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, Martha quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 o 4 terneras, será un impulso comercial muy importante para su empresa ya que dispondrá de animales para engordar y llegar a  buenos acuerdos económicos a la hora de la venta.
texts.en:
Martha, 49 years old, is a woman of the countryside, hardworking and strong, who has given her body and soul to the land and to her family. She works raising cattle, work that she learned from her husband and does 6 or 7 days per week, 4 hours each day.

Martha is totally a life warrior, despite a disability she goes out every day to work, showing that women are not the weaker sex.

Pursuing her dream of purchasing her own house, Martha wants to ask for a loan to purchase 3 or 4 calves, it will be a very important commercial boost for her business since she will have animals to fatten and come to good economic agreements at the time of sale.

loans.use: to purchase 3 or 4 calves, to expand her number of calves.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 32 года, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 3 детей. По хозяйству помогает супруг. У нее - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав около 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы и 43 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nazira is 32, married, and raising three children with her husband, who also helps her around the farm. She has a vocational education and earns the main source of income for her family through raising livestock, which she began doing 15 years ago. Thanks to Nazira’s hard work, she currently has 4 cows and 43 sheep. She earns 17,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Nazira applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock for breeding. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase her herd

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, de 29 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de 11, 5 y 3 de edad, que aún viven con ella, pero también vive con ella un sobrino del esposo.

Dinora, vende tortillas desde hace 1 año, aprendió cuando trabajaba de empleada en una tortilleria; ahora ella vende tortillas en su casa y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d. y por las tardes desde las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. 

Dinora, necesita el crédito para comprar maiz, cal, papel y bolsas para despachar las tortillas, de esa manera podrá tener todo lo que necesita para vender las tortillas.

El sueño de Dinora, es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Dinora is a 29 year old housewife, she went school until 5th grade. She is married and her husband earns a living in agriculture. She has three children ages 11, 5, and 3 who still live with her in addition to her husband's nephew. 

A year ago Dinora learned how to sell tortillas while working at a tortilla shop. She now sells tortillas at her house from 7:00 a.m. until noon and from 3:00 until 6:00 p.m. She needs the loan to purchase corn, lime powder, paper, and bags to package the tortillas. This way she'll have everything she needs to sell tortillas. Dinora's dreams is to improve her home and that her children are prepared professionally.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime powder, paper, and bags to package tortillas.

loans.name: Nuru Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Florence. She is 54 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in the farming of maize, beans and potatoes, which she sells to the locals in the market. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to boost her farm production so as to earn more income to provide her family's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to boost farm production for more income in order to provide her family with their basic needs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Jane. She is fifty-four years old and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and record keeping that has enabled her to manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase her production, and consequently to make more income. This will assist her in providing her family's needs such as food and paying school fees for her child. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase her production, and consequently to make more income to buy food and pay school fees.

loans.name: Women / Men Of Hope Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Serah, a 35-year-old married mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training offered in enterprise development.

Serah grows crops such as maize, beans and potatoes which she sells to the locals in the market. She also raises poultry. She will use her portion of this Kiva loan to buy animal feeds and fertilizers to boost production, which will enable her to meet the rising demand from her customers.

Serah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and fertilizer to boost farming production

loans.name: Faalaeo

texts.en: Faalaeo is a 59-year-old woman who is married with 8 children. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has 3 years experience in this business. Faalaeo has requested a loan to buy new sewing machine, needles, threads, materials, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needdles, threads, materials, etc.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de medina bissy est crée depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de femmes issues du même village et de villages environnants.Elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.
Salla malick située à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle s'active dans le domaine de l’élevage depuis plusieurs années.Elle achète des moutons pour ensuite les revendre durant les fêtes religieuses.
Elle compte acheter cinq moutons à 35000f l'un et de l'aliment pour une valeur de 15000f.Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra de consolider son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The Medina Bissy banc villageois was established in July 2011. It consists of women who come from the same village and others from the surrounding villages. Their business is mainly in the agricultural sector.

Salla Malick is on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and is the lead borrower. She has been in the breeding business for many years. She buys sheep and then resells them during religious festivals.

She plans to buy five sheep for 35000f each and food for them valuing 15000f. The profits will allow her to strengthen her business and meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen's variety store in Ulas, Davao City that sells canned goods, sachets of toiletries, packed condiments, biscuits, and many more items. She combines the store with vegetable vending and a mini-canteen. She cooks viands and snacks for her mini-canteen. Usually her customers take out the food and sometimes they just eat in front of her store while standing. You may notice that she lacks facilities such as tables and chairs, and the place has a small roof. She wants it renovated to make it conducive for eating so it can attract more customers. She will also buy grocery items as added supplies for her variety store plus additional vegetables. To meet this purpose, she applied for a PHP 25,000 loan. Her increased income will help meet her daily needs and her savings. She's a widow with children who are no longer dependent on her. They are starting their own families. That's why Carmen doesn't want to depend on them. As much as possible, she still intends to earn money by herself. This is a sign of her being a strong woman.  
 
She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share life stories and Bible reflections.  
 
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her canteen

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, 45 years old, loves fashion and hair trends. She makes it her hobby and source of income. Aside from being a variety store owner, she is also a sought-after hairdresser in Buhangin, Davao City. Usually she performs hairdressing services inside her store while watching over her items for sale. Sometimes she grants the home-service requests of her clients. Her business not only covers the cost of food and utilities, but it also soothes away her longing for a child. She’s been married to Dexter for years, and they are still praying for a child. In the meantime, she focuses her attention on improving her business. She wants to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more hairdressing supplies and equipment, as well as grocery items for her store. In due time, she plans to put up a permanent beauty parlor beside her store to boost her income and savings. She is praying that you can extend help to her.

Marina regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative every week. She finds encouragement from their inspiring stories and Bible reflections. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing supplies and equipment

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Entre cañales y caminos pedregosos se encuentra una comunidad cálida, donde los habitantes se han dedicado por generaciones a trabajar en el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar, siembra y pizca de maíz, frijol y corte de mango, el canto de las aves, el ladrido de los perros, cacaraquear de las gallinas y el canto de los gallos son música para la comunidad.

En la comunidad se formó un grupo el cual lleva por nombre “Vicente Guerrero” pues es el nombre de la calle principal.
Las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Rosalía, María A, Daniela - Refresco
Luciana –Abarrotes 
Inés – Cosméticos 
Yolanda, Mariel –Ropa 
Josefina - Pollo
Lidia - Tupperware Y Ropa De Cama
Teodora –Comida Y Refresco
Jessica –Comida
María -Bisutería
Yesenia -Cosméticos Y Zapatos

Doña Luciana tiene 60 años de edad, enviudo hace 6 años, tiene 7 hijo y 13 nietos quienes llenan de alegría su hogar los fines de semana durante las vacaciones, hace 7 años doña Lucí como le conocen inicio con la venta de pollo con el primer préstamo que recibió de Visión F México anteriormente fundación realidad, dos años después de haber adquirido su primer préstamo  inicio una nueva actividad con las ganancias obtenidas y un nuevo préstamo. 

Durante 5 años doña lucí se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para matar y aliñar los pollos pues como es la única persona que vende pollo, por semana en promedio vende de 15 a 20 pollos, la báscula y la cacerola con el pollo los colca en un espacio del anaquel donde exhibe su mercancía, para poder iniciar con su tiendita de abarrotes adecuo la que era la sala de su casa donde hoy en día coloca el arroz, azúcar, frijol, sopa, aceite, atún, mayonesa, harina, minsa, huevos, cerillos, detergente y papel higiénico.

“estoy contenta con mis actividades me mantienen activa” para ello le han sido útiles los préstamos otorgados  invirtiendo cada uno de ellos en la compra de pollo en pie, arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevo, galletas, leche, café , continuar con su actividad durante el tiempo que dios le permita es lo que espera doña Lucí.

“gracias por la confianza y los préstamos que han hecho posible nuestras actividades continúen de pie y por permitirnos iniciar nuevas actividades”

*la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de Lidia, doña Lucí es quien viste blusa color azul y short negro.
texts.en:
Among canals and rocky paths is a warm community where for generations the residents have worked in the fields planting, growing, and harvesting sugar and corn and cutting mango. The barking of dogs, the clucking of the chickens, and the song of the roosters are music to the community.

A group formed in the community, Vicente Guerrero, which is the name of the main street. The members of the group and their jobs are Rosalía, María A., and Daniela, soft drinks; Luciana, groceries; Inés, cosmetics; Yolanda and Mariel, clothing; Josefina, chicken; Lidia, Tupperware and bedclothes; Teodora, food and soft drinks; Jessica, food; María, costume jewelry; and Yesenia, cosmetics and shoes.

Luciana, 60, was widowed six years ago. She has seven children and thirteen grandchildren who fill her home with happiness on the weekend and during vacations. Lucí, as she is known, started selling chicken seven years ago with her first loan from VisionFund Mexico (previously Fundación Realidad). Two years after receiving her first loan she started a new job with her profits and another loan.

For five years Lucí has awakened at 5 in the morning to kill and season the chickens. She's the only one who sells chicken, so she sells an average of 15-20 per week. She puts them on a shelf with the scale and the pan where she displays her merchandise. To be able to set up her little store, she made a place in what was the living room of her house where now she puts the rice, sugar, beans, soup, oil, tuna, mayonnaise, flour, corn flour, eggs, matches, detergent, and toilet paper.

"I'm happy with my work that keeps me in assets." The loans have been useful to her for this. She invested each of them in buying live chickens, rice, sugar, oil, eggs, cookies, milk, and coffee. Lucí hopes to continue with her work during the time that God allows her. "Thank you for the trust and the loans that have made it possible to keep going with our work and for allowing us to undertake new jobs."

The photograph was taken on the patio at Lidia's house. Lucí is wearing a blue blouse and black shorts.

loans.use: to buy live chickens, rice, sugar, oil, eggs, cookies, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Vandy is 44 years old and lives in Khsach kandal, Kandal province, Cambodia. He is married and has two sons and 4 daughters. Three are construction workers, two have studied at secondary school and the last one is still young.

Vandy has been a fisherman for 20 years, and his wife is a housewife. He is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora’s sari-sari (variety) store is struggling so she has applied for a PHP 25,000 loan to buy grocery items and beverages. This additional stock will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Davao City. A thriving sari-sari would boost her income to sufficiently meet her family's basic needs and add some savings for emergency purposes.  Teodora and her husband are already at retirement age and their children are no longer dependent on them. Teodora always prays that all her children will succeed in their work and family life. She constantly meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma.Fe is a 54-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business selling coconut wine in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more coconut wine to sell.

Ma.Fe has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, utilizo el financiamiento anterior para adquirir de manera inmediata materia prima para elaborar tortillas para vender, su negocio se ha mantenido funcionando, la familia tiene condiciones más dignas para vivir y sus ingresos son mejores.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz para preparar la venta de tortillas, asimismo invertirá en agua envasada para vender, espera ofrecer otro tipo de producto a sus clientes para mantener su fidelidad e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María used the previous loan to purchase ingredients to make tortillas to sell. She has kept her business running. Her family’s living conditions have improved and her income increased.

She is requesting a new loan to buy corn to make tortillas to sell. She will also buy bottled water to sell, thinking of having something different to keep her loyal customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas, and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Andres Gilberto

texts.es:
Andrés, en un joven que dejo la casa de sus padres hace cinco años para ir a vivir junto a su abuela, una tía y dos primos, él cubre sus gastos personales, desde la edad de 14 años aprendió a elaborar pan para luego comercializarlo, lo hizo con el apoyo de sus vecinos, ya que tienen una panadería.
Su negocio funciona con equipo prestado, por lo que Andrés solicita un financiamiento para comprar latas, estantes, harina, rodillos, azúcar, levadura, etc., poco a poco equipara su negocio y tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pan, espera realizar sus actividades con mayor agilidad y así tendrá un negocio más competente.
Sus aspiraciones son tener equipo propio, mejorar su situación financiera y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Andrés is a young man that left his parents’ home five years ago to live with his grandmother, an aunt and two cousins. He covers his expenses. He learned to bake bread and sell it when he was fourteen. His neighbors, who own a bakery, supported him.

He bakes with borrowed equipment, which is why Andrés is requesting a loan to buy trays, shelves, flour, rolling pins, sugar, yeast, etc. Little by little, he will have the equipment and the raw materials he needs to sell bread. He hopes to become more efficient at what he does, which will result in a more competitive business.

In the future, he wants to have his own equipment, improve his financial situation and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy trays, shelves, flour, rolling pins, yeast, etc. for his bakery.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana es una valiente ama de casa de 37 años de edad, ella es madre cabeza de familia, tiene dos pequeños el mayor de 15 y la princesa de 1 año de edad.

Trabaja atendiendo un negocio mixto, vende productos de papelería, cosméticos y productos de uso personal, una actividad que comenzó por necesidad económica y ante la falta de oportunidades de emplearse.

Liliana sueña con comprar una vivienda propia, pagar la educación de sus hijos, pero para ello tiene que trabajar mucho en su negocio, necesita, lograr expandirlo, ofrecer productos nuevos, aumentar su inventario, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, formalizar su negocio, optimizar la operación del negocio, proyectos para los que necesita capital con el cual no cuenta.

Liliana para ir logrando sus objetivos quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de uso personal, surtido de papelería.
texts.en:
Liliana is a courageous homemaker, 37 years old. She is a female head of household, she has two young ones, the older is 15 and the princess is 1 year old.

She works tending a mixed business. She sells paper goods, cosmetics and personal care products, work that she began due to economic necessity and faced with the lack of opportunities to get a job.

Liliana dreams of purchasing her own house, to pay for her children's education, but for this she needs to work a lot in her business, she needs to manage to expand it, offer new products, increase her inventory, improve her sales, increase her customers, register her business, optimize the business operations; projects for which she needs capital which she doesn't have.

Liliana, to achieve her objectives, wants to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment of personal care products and an assortment of paper goods.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of personal care products and an assortment of paper goods.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
María es una dulce, tierna y entusiasta empresaria de 55 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de su matrimonio nacieron 7 hijos, 5 hombres y 2 mujeres.

Trabaja atendiendo una chaza, vende antojos, como dulces, papas en bolsa, chocolates, galletas, vende minutos a celular, cigarrillos, refrescos entre otros.

Esta actividad la realiza con toda humildad, cordialidad y disposición, con su negocio genera los ingresos complementarios para pagar las cuentas del hogar, como lo son servicios públicos, alimentación, transporte y demás gastos que aparecen en la cotidianidad.

María quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con snacks, cigarrillos y refrescos, préstamo que le dará la posibilidad de tener surtido para afrontar los próximos meses.
texts.en:
María is a sweet, tender, and enthusiastic business woman, 55 years old. She is married and from this marriage were born 7 children, 5 men and 2 women.

She works running a small stall, she sells snacks such as sweets, bags of potatoes, chocolates, and cookies, she sells cell phone minutes, cigarettes, soft drinks and more.

She does this work with all her humbleness, friendliness and disposition, with her business she generates the complementary income to pay the household bills, such as public utilities, food, transportation, and the other expenses that come up daily.

María wants to ask for a loan to stock her business with snacks, cigarettes, and soft drinks, a loan that will give her the possibility of having an assortment to face the coming months.

loans.use: to stock her business with snacks, cigarettes, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dildor

texts.en:
Dildor is a light-hearted woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. She is a business lady. She started doing business by planting tomatoes, cucumbers and paprika on her land. She, with her husband, sold the harvest in the domestic market. From the gained income from the harvest they bought a calf. Then, after two years, they had three of them because they tried to keep them carefully and gently. And now they have four livestock and two calves. Dildor is happy to be coping with such activity. She likes her duty.

This year her daughter is going to enter the university. Dildor is willing to pay for her studies. She applied to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to pay her daughter’s higher education costs.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s higher education costs.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 45-year-old entrepreneur from Buhangin, Davao City. She is married to Renato, a welder and her business partner. They have children who are studying in college.

The couple uses their yard to assemble and repair tricycles and motorcycles. Their business is just five years old and it needs a lot of improvements. Divina aspires to buy more materials like metals and paint with the aid of a PHP 29,000 loan. With additional materials, they can assemble more tricycles, and it will eventually increase their income. It will ease up their financial burden for their children’s college expenses. Divina’s dream is to have a competitive shop with complete supplies for vehicle assembly and repair someday. Your heartfelt support will help them attain this dream. May God return more blessings to you.

Divina gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials like metals and paint.

loans.name: Wella Joy

texts.en:
This is Wella Joy’s tailoring shop located in Buhangin, Davao City. In just five years of operation, she has gained the trust of her clients due to her quality products. She can sew creative designs on shirts and blouses. Because of her young age (35 years old), she can easily grasp the contemporary designs that can be appealing to customers. She takes volume orders from schools and offices and sometimes she lacks sufficient capital for material. She applied for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy more cloth and fabric, thread, and accessories. She also plans to employ someone who has the skills to cut and sew clothes; and together they can increase their production. Increased sales and earnings will follow. 

Wella Joy is doing all this work for the sake of her two small children. She is a single parent who shoulders all responsibilities for them. She dreams of building a house for them and hopes they pursue their college education until completion. She also draws strength and inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share their experiences and reflect on the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and fabric, thread, and accessories

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and has two children. Analyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and has seven children. Antonia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonia has been farming corn for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary. She is twenty-eight years old, married, and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. 

She has been doing maize farming as her main business. 

She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and record keeping, and this has enabled her to manage her business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer and seeds so that she can increase her production and income. This will assist her in providing the family's needs and to pay school fees. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: To buy quality fertilizer and seeds so that she can increase her production and income to meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Eunice. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in farming maize, beans and potatoes which she sells to the locals in the market. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure to boost farm production. This will add stock to enable her to satisfy customer demands and be able to meet her basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure in order to boost farming production to satisfy customer demands.

loans.name: Women / Men Of Hope Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Hannah. She is 71 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in dairy, poultry and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure and seedlings in order to boost farm production. By increasing production, she will be able to meet her customers' demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and seedlings in order to boost farm production to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es:
Ella es Katerine, una joven emprendedora, una joven de admirar a sus 22 años de edad es madre de un pequeño de 8 años, tiene un hijo muy grande para su edad, pero lo increíble es que ella lo crío y lo levanto solo, es cabeza de familia, vive en montería una zona muy afectada por la pobreza, pero ella decidió emprender un negocio y monto un billar.
La principal dificultad que ha tenido Katerine es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio ya que para montar el billar tuvo que endeudarse para pagar el local, la estantería, el billar y ahora que ha salido de deudas quiere invertir en surtido y adecuaciones locativas.

Ella trabaja por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, de vivir cómodamente, tener electrodomésticos, carro, viajar, sueños que desea hacer realidad y salir adelante junto con su hijo y familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerveza que es el producto más consumido en su negocio, al igual que comprara snacks y realizara mejoras locativas para el hogar.
texts.en:
This is Katerine, a young entrepreneur, a young woman to admire at 22 years of age, she is the mother of a little one, 8 years old, she has a very big son for her age, but what is incredible is that she raised him and lifted him up alone, she is the head of the household, she lives in Montería, a zone very affected by poverty, but she decided to establish a business and set up a pool hall.

The primary difficulty that Katerine has had is the lack of capital to invest in her business since to establish a pool hall, she had to go into debt to pay for the space, the shelves, the pool table, and now that she has gotten out of debt, she wants to invest in an assortment of supplies and modifications to the space.

She works to improve her family's living conditions; to live comfortably, have household appliances, a car, and to travel are dreams that she wants to make reality and to get ahead with her son and family.

She asks for a loan to purchase beer, which is the product consumed the most in her business, and also she will purchase snacks and do improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of beer and make modifications to her business.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle 1 du banc villageois .IL est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Awa est le responsable ; elle est marié âgée de 50 et mère de cinq enfants dont deux garçons et trois filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente d'habits pré confectionnés de sexes différents. Avec son nouveau crédit de deux centcinquante mille francs CFA elle va se payer des habits et chaussures tout genres pour les revendre au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l 'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was established during the banc villageois' first cycle. It consists of women who come from the same village who have been brought together through good professional and social relationships.

Awa is the one responsible for this loan; she is 50 years old and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). Her business is selling (already manufactured) clothes to both genders. With her new loan of 250 000f CFA she is going to buy clothing and shoes to resell in the markets in her neighbourhood. She is successful in this line of work since she has been doing it for a long time.

The profits gained from her business will allow her to take control of her children's nutrition, schooling and healthcare. Furthermore, she will be able to increase her savings at the banc villageois level.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for men and women in order to carry out petty trade

loans.name: Erkinoi

texts.en:
Erkinoi is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. 

She is a business lady. Previously, she had a business of sewing curtains. After participating in a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients, she decided to do a business offering seats to the groom and bride at restaurants as a place of providing wedding ceremonies such as restaurant services. 

She came to this idea because there is no place to provide a wedding ceremony and have wedding celebrations at her village. She wants to design and make decorations for such ceremonies by herself. She thinks her business at her location will attract a lot of customers. 

She requested a loan from IMON and KIVA to buy different textiles and stylish decorations to use for wedding ceremonies. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy different textiles and stylish decorations to provide wedding ceremonies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Arlene has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Arlene has been in this business for 4 years. Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 31 years old and married with four children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 3 y un año de edad, toda la familia es dependiente de don Roberto, su negocio consiste en destazar reses y  cerdos, actividad que aprendió a desarrollar con la ayuda de su padre, ya que él también la practicaba, su horario de trabajo es de dos de la mañana a ocho de la mañana, los derivados de los animales que destaza los comercializa en el mercado municipal de su comunidad.
Para facilitar las actividades de su negocio,  necesita de capital para comprar una bicicleta y recipientes grandes para trasladar la carne, el hueso, etc., al mercado, su objetivo es tener equipo adecuado para ahorrar tiempo y atender a más clientes.
Sus sueños son pagar con puntualidad su crédito y ayudar siempre al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto, lives in his own house with his life partner and two children, ages 3 and 1. The whole family depends on Roberto, his business consists of butchering cows and pigs, work that he learned to do with the help of his father, since he also did it. His work schedule is from two in the morning to eight in the morning. The animal products that he butchers, he sells in the municipal market in his community.

To ease his tasks in his business, he needs capital to purchase a bicycle and large containers to carry the meat, the bones, etc. to the market. His objective is to have adequate equipment to save time and serve more customers.

His dreams are to pay off his loan punctually and always help support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle and large containers to transport the meat, bones, etc. to the market.

loans.name: Daizy

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Daizy. She is twenty-five years old, married, and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015.

She has a maize and potatoes farming business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her with budgeting and record keeping. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer so that she can increase her output and provide her family with basic needs. This will assist her in caring for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer so that she can increase her output and earn more income to provide her family with basic needs.

loans.name: Girleza Leonor

texts.es:
Girleza eufórica, loca, entretenida, sonriente, una persona que te saca una sonrisa, una tendera muy trabajadora que abre 12 horas diarias, el empeño y la actitud que pone Girleza en su trabajo la hace ganar clientes, en pocas palabras una exitosa estrategia de mercadeo que ha implementado sin siquiera darse cuenta.

Ella trabaja porque aspira comprar una vivienda, es su anhelo y no renunciara a su sueño.

Con la meta de mejorar continuamente, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo, tener un surtido que compita con las mejores tiendas del barrio, ya que esto le dará la oportunidad de atraer un mayor número de clientes ya que podrían encontrar todo lo de la lista del mercado en su negocio.

Girleza quiere solicitar un préstamo con el que desea comprar productos de la canasta familiar, principalmente granos y productos de aseo personal.
texts.en:
Girleza is a very energetic, wild, entertaining, and smiling woman, who can make anyone smile. She is a hardworking saleswoman who opens her store for twelve hours every day. Her hard work and her positive attitude help Girleza to attract customers. In other words, she has adopted a successful marketing strategy without even noticing it.

She works because she would like to buy a house. This is her desire, and she will not give up her dream.

Her goals are to continuously improve, have a sustainable business, and have a wide assortment in order to be able to compete against the best stores in the neighborhood. This would give her the opportunity of attracting more customers, since they would be able to find in her store everything they wrote down in their shopping list.

Girleza wants to request a loan to buy essential products, mainly grains and personal hygiene products.

loans.use: to buy essential products, mainly grains and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Cypriana

texts.en:
Cypriana works hard to support her family. Cypriana is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cypriana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Cypriana has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future Cypriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 48 years old and married, with six children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Emelia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Emelia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Salani

texts.en:
Salani is a 45-year-old woman who is married with 10 children. She runs a business of designing materials in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Salani has requested a loan to buy materials, a new sewing machine, colour paints, brooms, rubber for designing. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, colour paints, materials, brooms, and rubber for designing, etc.

loans.name: Brayan Esteban

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 20 años de edad que viajado por diferentes parte de Colombia, como mochilero, una experiencia que cuenta con gran agrado y vino con un sueño, una ilusión, montar un restaurante, quedó tan impresionado con la diferente gastronomía que probo que quiere ejercer su vida realizando ricos alimentos para el deleite de todos.

Brayan tiene todo su espíritu y ganas para poner en marche su sueño, pero tiene un gran inconveniente, no posee el conocimiento ni la certificación para preparar alimentos, por ello acudió a Interactuar para formarse como técnico de cocina.

Para ello Brayan necesita de tu apoyo para pagar sus estudios.

El gran sueño de Brayan es tener un restaurante que se salga de lo tradicional, que sea con temática musical y tradicional, espera que lo apoyen y en unos años puedan visitar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Brayan, 20, is a young man who has traveled all around Colombia as a backpacker, an experience that he shares with joy. He came back with a dream, with the hope of being able to open a restaurant. He was so impressed with the different food he tried, that he wants to work making delicious food for everyone to enjoy.

Brayan has a strong will and decided to give his dream a push, but he faces an obstacle: he does not have the knowledge nor the certification required to prepare food. This is why he came to Interactuar to become a Cooking Technician.

For this, Brayan needs your help to pay for his studies.

His biggest dream is to have an innovative restaurant, with a traditional-music theme. He hopes to receive your support and that in a few years, you can come and visit his restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for a Cooking Technician course.

loans.name: Meljorie

texts.en:
Meljorie is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Meljorie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Meljorie has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Meljorie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 63 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, salt, sugar, noodles, etc.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 29 años de edad, ella junto con su madre trata de salir adelante, vive en la zona de Copacabana, su sueño siempre ha sido trabajar en un restaurante o tener uno propio, la cocina es su pasión pero le han cerrado las puertas por la falta de un título que la avale como cocinera.

Es por ello que Catalina solita un apoyo para pagar un curso técnico en cocina y así seguir con su firme propósito de trabajar en una cocina o junto con su madre montar un restaurante.

Apoya a esta mujer en su sueño, no quiere persistir, quiere trabajar en lo que le apasiona.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 29-year-old woman. Together with her mother, she is trying to get ahead. She lives in the Copacabana area. It has always been her dream to work in a restaurant or open one of her own. Cooking is her passion, but doors have been closed to her because she does not have a culinary arts degree.

For this reason, Catalina is seeking support to pay for a culinary arts course so that she can move forward with her firm goal to work in a kitchen or start a restaurant with her mother. 

Please support this woman's dream. She does not want to just keep going, she wants to have the job she is passionate about.

loans.use: to pay for a culinary arts course

loans.name: Jeeny Rose

texts.en:
Jeeny Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She earns more income from fruit vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jeeny Rose has been in this business for three years and has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and married with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosa has been in this business for 10 years now.

Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, necesita de un nuevo crédito para desarrollar sus laborares agrícolas, comprara insumos agrícolas y cubrirá los gastos de preparación de tierra para poder sembrar granos básicos, espera que sus cosechas sean abundantes.
El crédito anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para mantenerse cultivando granos básicos, la producción obtenida le permitió abastecer a sus clientes y tener así buenas ganancias con las que ha cancelado su deuda y puede salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor needs a new loan to continue with his farming tasks. He's going to buy agricultural inputs and cover the expenses of preparing the land to grow basic grains. He hopes to have an abundant harvest.

The previous loan was a big help to him in supporting himself by growing basic grains. His production allowed him to supply his customers and earn a good profit. He has paid back his debt and can get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to cover the expenses to prepare the land for growing basic grains

loans.name: Selección Group

texts.es:
En la actualidad, aún sobrevive una porción de lo que fue el San Miguel antiguo; en la isla de San Miguel Soyaltepec existe un pequeña comunidad mazateca que conserva sus tradiciones y costumbres, manteniendo el sitio de acuerdo a su estilo de vida tradicional, por lo que es un destino turístico en la denominada Laguna de las Mil Islas, que es la presa Miguel Alemán.

El grupo lleva por nombre “selección” pues  forman parte del grupo personas seleccionadas por las mismas integrantes de acuerdo a sus referencias, el grupo está integrado actualmente por:

María - Estética 
Efigenia - Agua Purificada 
Natalia - Frutas Y Agua De Frutas 
Julia, Rosalía, Mónica - Abarrotes 
Domitila - Comida 
Obdulia - Sastrería 
María Isabel - Taquería 
Ofelia - Pollo  
Adriana - Ropa 
Dulce - Taquería

Doña María tiene 66 años de edad, en el pueblo todos le conocen como Mari, ella ha dedicado 34 años de su vida al servicio como estilista en un pequeño local ubicado en el mercado donde se dan cita sus clientes debido al trato amable, el cumplimiento de sus requerimientos y los precios que ofrece, “aprendo a cortar cabello viendo a mi madre quien nos cortaba el cabello”  al alcanzar la mayoría de edad comenzó asistir a cursos de belleza ofrecidos por el DIF y fue así como aprendió lo principal, comenta que con el paso del tiempo la práctica le permite estar en constante actualización. 

Cuando ella inicio cortaba el cabello en su casa así estuvo durante 6 años mientras acumulaba el capital para colocarse en el local donde está ahora, para doña mari su estética es lo máximo pues con las ganancias que ha obtenido sus hijos continuaron estudiando, solvento y solventa los gastos del hogar, ha realizado adecuaciones en el local y da estudio a dos de sus nietos que viven con ella.

El primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en 2 maquinitas para rasurar, 1 secadora, tintes, peines , capas y una banca de madera, buscando ofrecer calidad y comodidad a sus clientes, lo cual le ha funcionado pues continua con su actividad, ha impartido 11 cursos por parte del DIF a mujeres emprendedoras que al igual que ella desean iniciar un actividad.

La cortina de la estética se abre a las 9 de la mañana a las 2 de la tarde cierra 1 hora para poder ir a casa a comer con sus nietos regresa acompañada de su nieta a las 3 y  cierra a las 8 de la noche pues por las mañanas debe ir a dejar a sus nietos a la escuela.

En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  tintes, peróxido, cremas, pasadores, talco, brochas, navajitas de rasurar, tijeras, mandiles y capas.

“Gracias a Vision Fund México otorgarnos préstamos para hacer realidad nuestros sueños”
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de doña Julia pues es el punto de reunión, Doña Mari es quien trae puesto un mandil floreado.
texts.en:
Nowadays, a portion of what used to be the ancient San Miguel still survives. On the island of San Miguel Soyaltepec, there is a small Mazateca community who conserves its traditions and customs, keeping the site in accordance to their traditional lifestyle. It makes the place a tourist destination on the lagoon called (Laguna de Las Mil Islas) The Thousand Islands, which is the Miguel Aleman dam.

The group is called "Selección (Selection)" because they form part of a group selected by the same members according to their references. The group is currently formed by: María (beauty shop), Efigenia (water purification), Natalia (fruits and fruit juices), Julia, Rosalía, Mónica (grocery store), Domitila (food), Obdulia (tailoring), María Isabel (taco shop), Ofelia (chicken), Adriana (clothing), and Dulce (taco shop).

María is 66 years old. In town, everyone knows her as Mari. She has dedicated 34 years of her life to being a stylist in a small building located in the market, where she gives her customers appointments as part of the friendly service, compliance with her requirements, and the prices that she offers. "I learned to cut hair from watching my mother who cut our hair."

Upon reaching her older age, she began to take beauty courses offered by DIF and this was how she learned the main skills. She says that as time has passed, the practice allows her to be constantly updated. When she first started, she cut hair in her house for 6 years while she saved up the money to set up shop in the building where she now is.

For Mari, her beauty shop is the best thing because with the earnings, she has been able to make sure her children keep studying, she is paying the household expenses, she has made adjustments to the building, and she teaches two grandchildren who live with her.

The first loan that she received was used for 2 razors, 1 hairdryer, dye, combs, cloaks and a wooden bench. She was looking to offer quality and comfort to her customers, which has worked well for her because she continues to work. She has partaken in 11 courses through DIF for entrepreneurial women, who, just like her, want to start a business. The doors of her beauty shop open at 9 AM to 2 PM, close for 1 hour so she can go home to eat with her grandchildren, and then she returns with her granddaughter at 3 PM and closes shop at 8 PM. In the mornings, she takes her grandchildren to school.

This time, the loan will be used to buy dyes, peroxide, creams, pins, powders, brushes, razor blades, scissors, aprons and coats.

"Thanks to Vision Fund México who make loans to make our dreams come true."

*The photograph was taken at Julia's store because it is where they meet up. Mari is wearing a floral apron.

loans.use: to buy dyes, peroxide, creams, pins, powders, brushes, razor blades, scissors, aprons and coats.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Saturnina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Saturnina has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from coffee and food vending.

Saturnina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 38 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anastacia has a general store business in the Philippines. Anastacia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Anastacia has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Cirila has been in this business for 4 years now.

Cirila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 53 years old.

Elsa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional buckets of fish to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 50 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Lucy is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucy has been in pig-fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 30 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in pig-fattening for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Orquídeas Group

texts.es:
La ganadería juega un papel importante en la economía de la ciudad pues facilita la producción de queso jarocho, fresco, de hebra, Cotija, crema y mantequilla, además de pertenecer a una región cañera lo que activa aún más la economía durante la zafra.
La belleza de las orquídeas cautivo a las 11 integrantes de un grupo que lleva por nombre “Orquídeas” las cuales tienen un misticismo en su significado, las integrantes del grupo son:
Esther, Alejandra – cosméticos 
María  M, Paula S, Esmeralda – Antojitos 
María, Miriam –Ropa Interior Por Catalogo
Paula H- Ropa 
Claudia –cosméticos, Estética 
Adriana –Plata 
Nayeli – Repostería 
A sus 32 años Claudia tiene 3 hijos con su esposo Javier, desde niña a Clau como le conocen sus vecinos sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar e invertir su tiempo en algo productivo, de niña ayudaba a su madre a entregar tamales y chiles rellenos cada fin de semana, al alcanzar la mayoría de edad comenzó a trabajar en una estética para poder apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa y desde hace 14 años  después de cumplir la cuarentena puso en casa una pequeña estética la cual consta de un espejo grande, una silla, peines, secadora, maquinita para rasurar, tijeras  pasadores, capas y un gran carisma son los aliados perfectos para ofrecer a sus clientes un servicio de calidad, las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron iniciar con la venta de cosméticos de una prestigiada marca obteniendo el 50% de las ganancias, por lo que aprendió a realizar faciales como demostración de los cosméticos.
El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cosméticos (cremas, rubor, delineadores, corrector, mascarillas y lociones) que sus clientas le han solicitad, en esta ocasión por motivo de las clausuras invertirá en la compra de decolorante, peróxido, tintes, ligas, pasadores, tubos, spray, gel, crema para peinar y tratamientos capilares.
“me gusta lo que hago y obtengo ganancias por hacerlo, la perseverancia me permite lograr mis objetivos, al igual que soñar con los ojos abiertos” son las palabras Clau.
Las integrantes del grupo agradecen a Visión F México  y KIVA por brindarles un nuevo préstamo.
*la fotografía fue tomada en casa de Clau  en el espacio donde corta el cabello, realiza peinados, aplica tintes y maquilla, ella es quien tiene dos tarjetas de pago en las manos.
texts.en:
Ranching plays an important role in the economy of the city since it facilitates the production of jarocho cheese, fresh cheese, string cheese, Cotija cheese, cream, and butter. Additionally the city belongs to a sugarcane region which triggers further economy during the harvest.

The beauty of the orchids, which have a mysticism in their significance, captivated the 11 members of a group named "Orchids." The members of the group are:

Esther, Alejandra – Cosmetics
María M, Paula S, Esmeralda – Traditional Mexican snacks
María, Miriam – Underwear from a catalog
Paula H- Clothes
Claudia – Cosmetics, Beauty Shop
Adriana – Silver
Nayeli – Pastry-making

At 32 years old, Claudia has 3 children with her husband Javier. Since childhood Clau (as her neighbors know her) was taught by her parents to work and invest her time in something productive. When she was young she helped her mother deliver tamales and stuffed peppers every weekend. Upon reaching adulthood she started to work in a beauty shop to be able to support her parents with the expenses of the home. After turning 40, she put a small beauty shop in her house which is made up of a large mirror, a chair, brushes, a dryer, a small shaving machine, scissors, barrettes, capes and a lot of charisma. They are the perfect allies to offer her clients a quality service. The earnings allowed her to start selling a well-known brand of cosmetics, obtaining 50% of the earnings. She learned to do facials as a demonstration of the cosmetics.

She invested the previous loan in the purchase of cosmetics (creams, blush, eyeliners, concealer, face masks, and lotions) that her clients had asked her for. On this occasion, motivated by closures, she will invest in the purchase of bleach, peroxide, dye, hair ties, barrettes, tubes, spray, gel, styling cream, and hair treatments.

"I like what I do and I earn money by doing it; perseverance allows me to reach my objectives, like dreaming with my eyes open" are Clau's words.

The members of the group express thanks to VisiónFund México and KIVA for providing them a new loan.

*The photograph was taken in Clau's house in the space where she cuts, styles, and dyes hair, and applies makeup. She is the one who has two payment cards in her hands.

loans.use: to buy bleach, peroxide, dyes, hair ties, barrettes, tubes, spray, gel, styling cream, and hair treatments.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 42 years old and married with four children.

Janeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

Janeth has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Janeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and married with six children. Two children are currently in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

Lorna has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. Meriam is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Meriam requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Meriam has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Meriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Dina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dina, es propietaria de un tienda de productos varios, negocio que emprendió por iniciativa propia, lo tiene desde hace más de 15 años, con el paso del tiempo ha ido incrementando su inventario; ella vive únicamente con su esposo, pues sus hijos se han independizado y han formado su propia familia, ella atiende su negocio y realiza las actividades domésticas de su hogar.
Para atender las peticiones de sus clientes necesita tener un inventario más surtido, eso hace que opte por solicitar un crédito para comprar bebidas, golosinas, pan, papel higiénico, detergente, jabón, etc., incorporara nuevos productos en la tienda y cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes, espera ampliar su negocio y tener mejores ingresos.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para lograr abrir un nuevo negocio y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is the owner of a small general store, a business she started through her own initiative  and which she has had for more than 15 years. With the passage of time, she has been adding to her inventory.  She just lives with her husband, as their children have became independent and formed their own families. 

She runs her store and does the housework. To meet her customers' requests she needs to have a better-stocked inventory. This is why she is choosing to apply for a loan to buy drinks, candy, bread, toilet paper, detergent, soap, etc. She will add add new products to her store and meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to be able to expand her business and have better income.

Her dream is to keep working, in order to succeed in opening a new store and move forward in life with her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candy, bread, toilet paper, detergent, soap, etc. She will add add new products to her store and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Remberto Aquiles

texts.es:
Remberto, vive con su esposa 49 años de edad y su hija de 17 años de edad, ambas dependen totalmente de él, además manifiesta no tener parientes en el extranjero, es propietario de un atienda de productos de primera necesidad y practica el destazo de cerdos para luego vender la carne, de esta forma tiene los ingresos para subsistir junto a su familia, no tiene un horario establecido para atender la tienda mientras que el destazo lo hace cada ocho días, desarrolla estas actividades desde aproximadamente 15 años y su padre le enseñó el oficio.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un cerdo para destazarlo, le permitirá tener un negocio continuo y generar los ingresos que tanto necesita para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar, espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Los objetivos de Remberto son administrar bien el crédito y cancelarlo en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Remberto lives with his 49-year-old wife and his 17-year-old daughter. Both of them depend on his completely. In addition, he doesn't have relatives abroad. He is the owner of a store that sells basic needs goods and is a pork butcher selling meat. In this way he makes an income to subsist along with his family. He doesn't have a set schedule for the store but he does his butchering everyday. He has been doing this work for about 15 years and his father taught him the trade.

He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of pigs to butcher. This will allow him to continue with his business and make the income he needs to change his family's quality of life. He hopes the business continues growing. His objective is to administer the loan well and pay it back in a short amount of time.

loans.use: to buy a pig to butcher as it will allow his to continue with his business.

loans.name: Lalin

texts.en:
Lalin is 40 years old and married with seven children. Four children are presently in school. Lalin works very hard to provide for them.

Lalin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

Lalin has been in this business for 7 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care items.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonida is 45 years old and has seven children who are presently in school.

Leonida has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

Leonida has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Lelani

texts.en:
Lelani is 37 years old and married with eight children; three children are currently in school. Lelani works very hard to provide for them.

Lelani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, shampoo and other personal care items.

Lelani has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, shampoo and other personal care items.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell through her fish-vending business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a personal products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Salvacion dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo, de 48 años de edad, está casado, su esposa trabaja en casa y con ellos vive una hija y un nieto. 

Teofilo, se dedica a cultivar maíz, tiene mucho tiempo de desempeñar estas labores, pero a pesar de ser personas de escasos recursos económicos, les gusta el trabajo que realizan.

El préstamo lo necesita para cultiva más maíz y eso implica comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar.

Él sueña con poder producir más granos y mejorar sus ganancias y tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 48 years old and married. His wife works in the home and they live with one daughter and a grandson.

Teofilo makes a living growing corn. He has been working at this occupation for a long time. Despite being people of scarce financial resources, they like the work they do.

He needs the loan to grow more corn which requires the purchase of manure, pesticides, and herbicides to plant.


Él sueña con poder producir más granos y mejorar sus ganancias y tener una vida mejor.

loans.use: to grow more corn which requires the purchase of manure, pesticides, and herbicides to plant.
