loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en: Lenelyn is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, beef, chicken, spices, sugar, flour and other supplies. She has been in this business for 10 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 36 years old and married with four children. All four children are still in school. Marialyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marialyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, shampoo and other personal care items.

Marialyn has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, shampoo and other personal care items.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia es una microempresaria que le apostó a sus habilidades y desistió de su empleo para convertirse en una empresaria independiente; nacida en cuna de comerciantes, emprendió sus polifacéticos negocios, una mezcla de lo que más le gusta y lo que mejor hace, cocinar platos típicos y comercializar minutos y golosinas.  Todos los días su vivienda es muy concurrida por los clientes que realizan llamadas y de paso comen una golosina,  y también por aquellos que disfrutan de las Hayacas y Pasteles trifásicos de su autoría. En la actualidad cuenta con cinco años en esta labor y con los resultados esperados, por lo tanto su familia goza de beneficios económicos y bienestar, producto de su esfuerzo en conjunto con su cónyuge. Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres para la preparación de sus recetas y nuevo surtido de golosinas.  Con esta inversión comprará a un mejor costo y obtendrá mayores ganancias.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y continuar apoyando a sus seis hijos hasta verlos graduados como profesionales.
texts.en:
Nubia is a micro-entrepreneur who bet on her own abilities and left her job to become an independent business owner. Born into the home of shopkeepers, she launched her multi-faceted businesses, a mix of what she likes most and what she does best -- cooking traditional dishes and selling phone minutes and candy.

Every day, her house is busy with customers who make calls and on their way, eat a piece of candy. Others enjoy the tamales and "three-phase" pastries (filled with 3 types of meat) that she prepares.

She currently has more than 5 years of experience in the business and has gotten the results she hoped for. Her family enjoys economic benefits and well-being, which is the product of her effort, along with her husband.

She is requesting her first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy supplies to prepare her recipes and a new stock of sweets. With this investment, she will buy at a better price and will make better earnings. Her future goal is to expand her business and to continue supporting her 6 children, until she sees them graduated and working as professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her recipes and a new stock of sweets

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost seven years. She and her husband have been tilling their own land for farming that primarily provides for the needs of her family. 

But Wilma found out that their income in farming will be insufficient for the family needs when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she also worked to repay her loans from the cooperative. She decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. 

Wilma is grateful for the trust of the coop that enabled her to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid the loan and this farming season, she has asked for another loan to augment her production. 

The amount of PHP 3,000 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide. Wilma is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay the loan ahead of schedule.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Orlandina

texts.es:
Orlandina tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Orlandina se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Orlandina espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Orlandina is 52 years old. She lives with her son in her own house made of basic materials. She lives in the district of Pucará which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. Life in the district is quiet and the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Orlandina works in agriculture growing rice. She has a number of years of experience in this field and has very good work and personal references in the district. The loan that has been awarded her will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to carry out adequate maintenance on her rice crop as well as contracting labor for harvest time. Doing this Orlandina hopes to offer better quality rice to her clients. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to carry out adequate maintenance on her rice crops.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Annabelle is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her candy making business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy making business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 49 years old now.

Alicia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Alicia has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and has two children. Maricel is married and has two children who are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Grace is 30 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Mary Grace has a toy and hair accessory-selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy other accessories to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, se dedica a vender pan, productos de revista y joyería, es una mujer separada (en su documentación aparece como casada debido a que ha realizado los cambios respectivos)  que tiene la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 16 y 20 años de edad,  esporádicamente recibe ayuda de sus familiares, sus productos los vende a sus vecinos, tiene un negocio muy variado para tener la facilidad de generar ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Con el capital tiene pensado comprar variedad de pan para revender, abastecerá su negocio cada vez que sea necesario y así sus clientes estarán mejor atendidos, espera que sus ventas y ganancias incrementen para tener los recursos necesarios para fundar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica.
Sus aspiraciones son tener mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia, así como también cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Rubida earns her living selling bread, magazine products, and jewelry. She is separated from her husband (although her documentation shows that she is married--since then she has made changes). She is responsible for the support of her two children aged 16 and 20. From time to time she receives financial assistance from family members. Rubida's customers are her neighbours. The products she sells are very varied allowing her to generate sufficient income to cover family necessities.

With the loan money she is planning to buy bread to resell and stock for her business whenever it is necessary. Then her customers will be better served. She hopes that sales and income will increase so that she has enough money to run a store containing basic necessities.

Rubida hopes to secure a better quality of life for herself and her family, and pay off her debt.

loans.use: Buy bread to resell and add stock to her business whenever it is necessary.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra is 31 years old, married and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other farm supplies. Myra has been in this business for the last year, has taken out three prior loans from NWTF, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en:
Aged 49, Khea is widow, and she resides in Kampong Thom province with her five dependent children. The main income of this family is from cassava growing. Sometimes, she works as a paid worker to supplement her income. These two businesses, which she has been involved in for 25 years, earn her about 37,000 KHR a day. 

The decrease in cassava's prices causes her to earn less income than before.  This is the challenge she faces. Now, leading a group which is comprised of two members, Khea is applying for a loan, which will be her fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans were paid back successfully, and it has enabled her to buy household appliances for her family. The new loan will be used to build a decent latrine. 

She hopes that the new latrine will ease their lives, make her life more comfortable and protect her family from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve the health of her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en: Jeannie is 32 years old and the mother of five children. She has a small farm where she grows cabbage, bees, and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and has requested a loan to buy rakes, bush knives, a wheel barrow, plastic bags, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, and more. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013 and plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta, 55, is a widow entrepreneur in Kinangay Norte. She has seven children and earns her income from her transport service business. It has been operating for almost 10 years now, and she earns about 5,000 PHP a month.To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which Benedicta joined in 2008, to obtain accessories and tires. Benedicta is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and tires   for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Luzelyn

texts.en: Luzelyn is 36 years old and married with one child. She resides with her family in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP per month. She successfully repaid her previous loan used to repaint and buy a new brake pad and accessories for her motorcycle. She is now taking a new loan to buy accesories  and tires for her motorcycle for safe travel with customers. Luzelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has been operating her beauty shop business to make a living. She was thankful to GDMPC for the capital entrusted to her in order to improve her business for she solely provides for the needs of her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. To improve her services, she took a new loan recently to buy more manicure materials for manicure use. She wants to improve their general living conditions by improving her business first and be able to buy more supplies to use for manicures as expansion.

loans.use: to buy more manicure supplies to use for manicures.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 58 years old and a widow. She lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. For the past twenty years, Lorna has been a farmer. She earns 20,000 PHP per cropping period and is a Microfinance member of PMPC. Lorna is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is in the retailing business. She sells various consumable products, which gives her an approximate income of PHP 12,000 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family while she still has a child in college.

Daylinda is 55 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, her partner in meeting all her financial needs for her business ventures. Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of patrons. The amount will be used to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 62 years old now. She works very hard to sustain her daily needs.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Marcela has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Marcela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 41 years old, married and the mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. Anita works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, and more. Anita has been in this business for the last four years and would to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Adelberta

texts.en:
Adelberta is 45 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. For the past four years, Adelberta has run a general store in the Philippines. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Adelberta is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a fertilized duck egg vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Rosalinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more trays of fertilized duck eggs to sell.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more trays of fertilized duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old and is married with five children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. Alicia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alicia is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with four children. She is 36 years old and three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, coconut, rice, flour, etc. for her food production business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, coconut, rice, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Nicole is 18 years old and is the first of five children in the family. His mother Salvacion is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nicole is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently on his first year of this four year course.

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 4,785 to pay for her son, Nicole's tuition fees for his first semester.

When he graduates, Nicole plans to help his parents to generate income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 49 years old, widowed and the mother of  four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan from NWTF to buy coffee, soft drinks, noodles, spices, milk, snack foods, and other items to sell. Sally has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running her general store for the last seven years and earns additional money by buying and selling gasoline and other items. Sally hopes to save enough money to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 33 years old and has three children. One of her children is in school. For the past five years, Flordeliza has run a general store in the Philippines. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Flordeliza is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as condiments, rice, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy condiments, rice, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Welsa

texts.en:
Welsa is 52 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school. For the past two years, Welsa has run a Xerox copier business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Welsa is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials such as bond paper, ink, and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bond paper, ink, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She is raising hogs for income. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells vegetables as an additional source of income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy feed for hogs and vegetables to sell. She hopes to become successful in her businesses to save funds for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 46 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Emelita has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Emelita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nancy has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Yan Carlos

texts.es:
Yan Carlos, es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, paralelamente trabaja como operario en producción de muebles, como ebanista, ésta actividad le permite ayudarse un poco para poder costear los gastos de sus estudios.
Lleva estudiando la carrera aproximadamente tres años y le faltan dos años para terminarlas, es un buen estudiante. Una de sus metas es poder iniciar trabajando en un estudio contable ya que eso le permitiría ganar experiencia en diferentes ramas de las actividades financieras.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales requeridos por la universidad y para el pago de la mensualidad del ciclo.
texts.en:
Yan Carlos is an accounting student who is also working in furniture production as a cabinetmaker. This activity helps to defray the costs of his studies.

He has been studying for approximately three years and needs two more to finish. He is a good student. One of his goals is to start working in an accounting firm, which would allow him to gain experience in different branches of financial activities.

He will invest loan proceeds in materials required by the university and for the monthly payment cycle.

loans.use: invest in materials required for his professional career.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is 39 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Jenneth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jenneth has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Joena

texts.en:
Joena is 47 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Joena works very hard to provide for her family.

Joena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Joena has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Joena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dilnazahon

texts.ru: Дилназахон, 29 лет, в разводе, ее ребенку 18 месяцев, живет с родителями. У Дилназахон среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, Дилназахон на сегодняшний день имеет 6 коров. На участке мерою 0,65 Га собственной земли она выращивает хлопок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dilnazahon is 29, divorced, and she has an 18-month-old child. She lives with her parents. She has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture. Thanks to her very hard work, she now has six cows. She also grows cotton on 0.65 hectares of her own land.

Eager to further grow her business, Dilnazahon has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cattle and increase the size of her herd. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 48 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marilyn has a welding shop in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her wielding shop.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell for her rice-retailing business.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Leandro

texts.es:
Jairo es un campesino agricultor de 28 años de edad, una persona responsable y madura que se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, que es la fruta que se ve en la foto.

Inicio su actividad en el año 2005, guiado por la necesidad y la pasión por el campo, aprendió de su padre todo acerca del campo y gracias a estas enseñanzas ahora tiene un hogar, unos 100 palos de aguacate y siempre tiene una mentalidad positiva de querer más, de no conformarse de buscar la manera de ampliarse, todo esto pro darle un excelente futuro a su familia conformada por una pequeña de un año de edad y su pareja.

Jairo en el momento se encuentra en etapa de recolección de cultivos y muy pronto tendrá que volver a abonar sus campos para esperar otra abundante cosecha, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas y semillas de aguacate con las que piensa aumentar su número de palos de este producto para tener mayor cantidad de frutas para vender.
texts.en:
Jairo is a 28 year old farmer, a responsible and mature person dedicated to the cultivation of avocados, which is the fruit you see in the picture.

He began this activity in the year 2005, guided by need and his passion for the field. Everything he knows about the field he learned from his father and thanks to his teachings, he now has a home and around 100 avocado trees. He always has a positive attitude that makes him want more and not settle, always looking for a way to expand. All this, so he can secure an excellent future for his family, formed by a one year old little girl and his partner.

Jairo is currently in the harvesting phase and very soon he will go back to fertilizing his fields and waiting for another plentiful harvest. This is why he wants to request a loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides and avocado seeds, with which he plans to increase the amount of avocado trees in order to have more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy manure, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides and avocado seeds.

loans.name: Luz Amalia

texts.es:
LUZ TIENE 37 AÑOS CONVIVIENTE, CON CARGA FAMILIAR, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA, FAMILIA UNIDA. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD UBICADA A 42 KMS DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU; HABITADA POR GENTE AMABLE DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA, GANADERIA Y COMERCIO.CLIENTE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS.

LUZ TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, LA CUAL SE ENCUENTRA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, Y CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES,NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, PARA DARLE MAS VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS A SU NEGOCIO, EL CUAL REPERCUTIRA EN UN MAYOR INGRESO A SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR Y MEJORAR SU CALIAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old and married with a family. She lives with her whole family in her own home, in a community located 42 kilometers from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is inhabited by friendly people engaged in agriculture, livestock, and business. The client has worked in grocery sales for several years.

Luz has a grocery store, which is located in her home. She has good personal and business references. She needs a loan to buy merchandise so that she has a greater variety of products in her store. This will result in increased income for her household and will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old, married and has four children, one of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosemarie has been fattening pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sheena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Sheena has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use like thread, needles, cloth etc.

Elvira has been in this business for 13 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use like thread, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Eda Geraldina

texts.es:
Eda, de 40 años de edad, está casada y estudio hasta noveno grado, se dedica al comercio de bebidas gaseosas en su automóvil, tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Eda, tiene un pequeño cafetín en la escuela de la comunidad, en donde vende pupusas, golosinas, refrescos y sodas desde hace 3 años; su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa, porque en el cafetín solo trabaja hasta las 11:00 a.m. y el resto del día pasa desocupada, es por eso que quiere aprovechar su tiempo y tener otro negocio en su casa. 

Ella sueña con tener su tienda en la casa, para mejorar sus ingresos y aprovechar el tiempo; además desea pagar los estudios de sus hijos y facilitarles para que puedan tener una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Eda, who is 40 years old, is married and studied till 9th grade. She earns a living selling carbonated drinks from her car. Eda has four children, all of whom are in school in her community.

Eda has a small snack shop in her community's school, where she has been selling pupusas, sweets and sodas for the past three years. Her work schedule is from Monday to Friday, 6 AM until 11 AM.

Eda needs the loan in order to start a small store in her house, because the snack shop is only open until 11 AM, and she is not working during the rest of the day. That is why she wants to make good use of her time and have another business at home.

Eda dreams of having a store at home to increase her income and use her time well. She also wants to pay for her children's education and help them so they can one day get a college education.

loans.use: to start a small store in her house.

loans.name: Lorena Marisol

texts.es:
Lorena, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, los dos están estudiando y vive con su madre y sus dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 

Lorena, tiene un pequeño comedor desde hace 7 años, antes era empleada, pero la experiencia le sirvió para poner su propio comedor y lo atiende con su madre. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas, porque con la que tiene no es suficiente, para sacar todos los pedidos. 

Ella sueña con tener el mejor comedor de la zona, para vender comida y tortillas, de esa manera pretender tener mayores ganancias, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lorena, 31, studied up to the ninth grade. She is a single mother and has two children, 5 and 7. The two are studying and they live with her mother and her two children who depend on her economically.
Lorena has had a small diner for seven years. Before that she was an employee, but the experience served her so that she could start her own diner which she works with her mother.
She needs the loan to buy a griddle in order to make tortillas, because with the one she has now, she can't keep up with all the orders.
She dreams of having the best diner in the area for selling meals and tortillas. In this way, she intends to have better earnings in order to improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy a griddle in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: Surmakul

texts.ru: Сурмакул, 49 лет, замужем, есть сын. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2006 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сурмакул, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 30 овец. Продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 12,800 сом (KGS). Сурмакул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на строительство сарая, в котором в зимний период она будет содержать скот. Доходы от бизнеса Сурмакул планирует вкладывать в расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Surmakul is 49, married, and she has a son. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2006, having started with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Animal husbandry now constitutes her family's main source of income. Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows and 30 sheep on her farm and she sells organic milk. She makes a monthly income of 12,800 som (KGS).

Surmakul has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to build a barn where she will be keeping her livestock during the winter. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carmelita is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Carmelita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aniceta is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Aniceta has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Wendy Marisol

texts.es:
Wendy, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, pero no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida es empleado en un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Wendy, actualmente trabaja en un cafetín de la escuela de un cantón cercano a su comunidad, antes trabajaba en el negocio de su mamá, en donde vendia refrescos y comida típica. 

El préstamo será utilizado para colocar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y comida típica, decidió 
colocar este negocio porque ya tiene experiencia, pero además desea poner una tienda, para ayudarle a su conyugue con los gastos del hogar. 

Ella en un futuro desea tener mejores ingresos y ser muy feliz con su familia, además desea que su negocio sea productivo.
texts.en:
Wendy, 23 years old, studied through the ninth grade. She has a significant other but she does not have any children. Her partner is employed in an automotive mechanic's shop.

Wendy currently works in a school cafeteria in a district close to her community. She used to work in her mother's business selling food and soft drinks.

The loan proceeds will be used to start her own business selling food and refreshments. She decided to start in this business because she already has experience. She also wants to open her own store in order to help her partner with household expenses.

In the future she hopes to have increased income and to be very happy with her family. She also wants her business to be successful.

loans.use: start a business selling food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old and married with three children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like liquor, canned goods, home care product, and other groceries.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like liquor, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, on of whom is in school, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, like soap, coffee, milk, etc., for her general store business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like soap, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Azhargul

texts.ru: Ажаргул, 26 лет, замужем, многодетная счастливая мама 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 2000 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Ажаргул на сегодняшний день имеет лошадь, 5 коров, 20 овец. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ажаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Ажаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность провести капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Azhargul is 26, married, and the happy mother of a large family, as she has three children. She has a secondary education and she has been raising livestock since 2000. Animal husbandry constitutes an additional source of income for her family. Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one horse, five cows, and 20 sheep on her farm. Her activity brings a total monthly income of about 22,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow her business, Azhargul has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and increase the size of her herd. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business, which will allow her to perform major repairs in her house.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha, reside en el municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos y por años estuvo alejada de su familia a causa de su trabajo;  laboró como empleada doméstica y debía quedarse en la vivienda que requería de sus servicios.  Al no estar conforme con este estilo de vida, su cónyuge le propuso que trabajara desde su casa, comercializando queso a sus vecinos, amigos y conocidos.  Su éxito no se hizo esperar, cuenta con 20 años de funcionamiento y una clientela muy fidelizada a quienes semanalmente les ofrece diferentes tipos de quesos.  Martha está muy feliz con su actividad comercial y siente que ha podido compartir más tiempo con sus hijos, que ya van siendo mayores de edad. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con queso de diferentes clases.  Esta inversión permitirá activar sus ventas y con ello ofrecerá bienestar a su familia.  Su meta a largo plazo es tener un local para expender queso y otros productos gancho.
texts.en:
Martha resides in the municipality of Barranquilla in the company of her husband and children. For years she lived apart from her family because of her work. She worked as a domestic employee and had to stay in the house where her services were required.

Not being content with this style of living her spouse proposed that she work from her house selling cheese to her neighbors, friends and acquaintances. She didn't have to wait long for success and she now has been operating for 20 years with a very loyal clientele to whom each week she offers them different types of cheese. Martha is very pleased with her business and feels that she has been able to spend more time with her children as they are becoming adults.

Currently she is applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to stock up on cheese of different kinds. This investment will allow her to stimulate her sales and with that offer her family well-being. Her long term goal is to have a shop to distribute cheese and other products.

loans.use: to stock up with different types of cheese.

loans.name: Persia

texts.en:
Persia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Persia is 33 years old and all of her children are in school.

Persia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Persia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Persia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Persia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and married.

Christine earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

Christine has been raising pigs for 5 years now. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 62 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional bundles of nipa roofing to resell.

Marina has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa roofing to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo 3 viven con ella, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura. 

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 6 años y dedica la mayor parte del día para atender a sus clientes. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más productos para su tienda, ya que desea tener suficiente mercadería y que sus clientes estén satisfechos. 

Ella desea seguir trabajando en su negocio, para obtener los ingresos que le permitirán darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37 years old, studied through the fifth grade. She is in a relationship and has four children, of whom only three live with her. Her partner works in agriculture.

Rosa sells staple products. She has been engaged in this business for 6 years and spends most of the day serving her customers. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more products for her store, so that she will have enough merchandise to keep her customers satisfied. She wants to continue working in this business to have sufficient income to put her kids through school.

loans.use: buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 45-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines.

Agnes is married and has 5 children. Her oldest child is 21 years old and her youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a carpenter while she is engaged in a tailoring business. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Agnes is requesting a loan to buy assorted cloth, needles, and colored thread.

In the future, Agnes wants to improve her business so she will be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy assorted cloth, needles, and colored thread.

loans.name: Fercita

texts.en:
Fercita works hard to support her family. Fercita is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Fercita has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Fercita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aisulu

texts.ru: Айсулу успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Айсулу на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 6 овец, 5 лошадей. На 4,28 Га земли выращивает картофель и пшеницу. На ежедневной основе продает экологически-чистое вкусное молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 15,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Айсулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и покупку квартиры для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Aisulu successfully repaid her previous loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing. Today, she has three cows, six sheep, and five horses on her farm. She also grows potatoes and wheat on 4.28 hectares of land, and she sells delicious organic milk on a daily basis. She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow her business, Aisulu has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to buy a few dairy cows and sell larger volumes of milk. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity and to buy an apartment for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a few dairy cows in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is aged 26 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She is involved in mixed farming: mostly crop and poultry farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy manure and thus increase farming production. She hopes this will add stock and enable her to satisfy customers' demands and meet the cost of school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure hence increase farming production to satisfy customers demands and thus enable her to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand the photo is Fredrick, a member of Rafiki Self help group. He is forty years old, married, and a father of five. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

He does maize farming and keeps poultry as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise and record keeping that has enabled him to manage his business well.

He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and chicken feeds and consequently increase his production and income. This will assist him to cater for the family needs such as food and medicine and to pay school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chicken feeds that will boost production.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and married with two children, who are both in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

Jenelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears livestock but also practices farming to sustain himself and get income to pay achool fees for his children. He aims at being a prominent farmer, determined to go for commercial farming which is more profitable. Despite his desires, Herbert is faced with the difficulty of prolonged droughts and lack of enough land to fulfill his expectations.
He is requesting for a loan to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support she received. The previous loan enabled her add stock to her shop by buying more sugar, salt, tea among others. She was able to satisfy her customers demands hence doubling her income that enabled her to support her children's medical care and education.

She is borrowing additional Kiva loan to buy poultry feed and fertilizer hence to boost her farming. This will enable her supplement her income so she can continue supporting her childrens' education.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and fertilizer so as to boost farming to enable her to continue supporting her children's education.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maiyashi Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Irvin Francisco

texts.en:
Irvin is a 24-year-old man who recently finished his career at the local state university.

Irvin just obtained his degree in social services, but he wants to get a masters degree at a private college. In order to raise the money to pay for the schooling, he is asking for a 7,000 MXN loan.

Irvin has had previous loans which he repaid on time and without troubles. He makes a living from his administration job working for a medical clinic.

loans.use: to continue studying.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 51 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling business, selling personal-collection products in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional personal-collection products to sell.

Judy has been in this business for 10 years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal-collection products to sell.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu works hard to support her family. Lulu is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Lulu has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lulu would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Margaret. She is forty three years old, is married and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 to learn and gain more experience in enterprise start up and development, she also learnt skills in financial management which has helped her manage her profits prudently.

She does maize and potato farming which has enabled her earn sufficient income. She is borrowing a loan to boost potato farming by buying fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her increase the crop yield hence more harvest, so meeting the demand of potatoes and will assist her improve her income hence be in a position to educate her children.

Margaret is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She therefore promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds. This will increase the crop yield so more income to cater for the family need with ease.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for 11 years.

Maribel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family. Mary Joy is married and has a blacksmith making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional iron bar, charcoal, etc.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional iron bar, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Miliza

texts.en:
Miliza is 41 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Miliza has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae works hard to support her family. Ana Mae is married and has a making ice cream business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, ice cubes, fruits, etc.

Ana Mae has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Ana Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, ice cubes, fruits, etc

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 25 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 3 years. Shelives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household is poor in this region. The income from her business is unstable because if the weather condition is not good, catching and selling fish will become more difficult.

One of the most critical difficulties is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improve her life standard.

With her business profit, Dung hopes her family to be healthy and happy and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Luận

texts.en:
Mrs Luận is 24 years old and she is married. She has had a service business shipping goods for more than 4 years. Luận lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties is that her family has no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Luận's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improve her life standard.

With her business profit, Luận hopes her family be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Healthy Farm, Active People - N07T9Qhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bảo is 51 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years.

Bảo lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family belongs to a low-income household in a village. Moreover, her job is unstable, because when some diseases claim her pigs, and she has nothing to sell. And this causes financial trouble.

The main hardship that Bảo faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. In 2013, Bảo joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Bào is the leader of N07 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Bảo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years.

In the future Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Gegie

texts.en:
Gegie is 50 years old and married.fShe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell wire wood business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fire wood to sell.

Gegie has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell fire wood business for 8 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 42 years old with three children. With three children in school, Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Angelina has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as dried fish, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, sugar, junk foods, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José de 49 años es un experto en reparación de electrodomésticos y desde su taller electrónico ubicado en el municipio de Cartagena de Indias, ofrece de sus servicios a vecinos, amigos y referidos. Esta actividad la inició luego de capacitarse en esta labor y decidió emprender su propio negocio al poco tiempo de haber culminado sus estudios, él ofrece servicio de diagnóstico, mantenimiento y reparación de aparatos eléctricos que son de uso frecuente por las familias del sector.  Hoy en día cuenta con trece años de experiencia y una buena reputación que le ha permitido tener más recomendados, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar repuestos para lavadoras, abanicos, neveras y licuadoras.  Con esta inversión realizará su labor con mucha más agilidad y así su servicio será más completo y oportuno.  José es padre de dos hijos a quienes desea continuar ofreciendo bienestar y su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and is an expert in repairing home electronics from his electronic workshop located in the city of Cartagena de Indias. He offers his services to neighbors, friends, and referred customers. He started this work after being trained in the field, and he decided to start his own business a short time after finishing his studies. He offers diagnostic services, maintenance, and the repair of electric devices that are frequently used by the families in the area.

Today he has 13 years of experience and a good reputation that has allowed him to obtain more recommendations. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy spare parts for washing machines, fans, refrigerators, and blenders. With this investment he will perform his work with much more efficiency and his service will be more complete and timely.

Jose is the father of two children to whom he wants to continue to provide well-being. His goal is to grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for washing machines, fans, refrigerators, and blenders

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, de 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian, su pareja es agricultor y trabaja en una cooperativa de cultivo de marañón. 

María, siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, pero luego surgió la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio y decidió iniciar a vender tortillas desde hace 3 meses y el negocio está creciendo cada día.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña, porque el maíz que había cosechado su esposo se agotó y necesita este insumo para continuar con el negocio.

Ella sueña con tener un gran negocio, para sacar su familia adelante y darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old. She had no opportunity to study. She is married and has 3 children. 2 of them are students. Her partner is a farmer and works in a cooperative cashew crop.

Maria has always been a house wife. However, she came across the opportunity to start her own business and decided to start selling tortillas. It’s been 3 months and it is growing every day.

Maria needs a loan to buy corn and firewood because the corn her husband harvested ran out and she needs it to continue her business.

She dreams of having a big business so that she can get her family ahead and give her children education.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela es una mujer con 41 años de edad, madre de tres princesas con 3, 9 y 18 años de edad. Dedicada a vender mercancía desde su casa, de allí logra ganar el dinero necesario para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Actualmente tiene un gran pedido de productos, pero debido a que no cuenta con un buen capital de trabajo no ha podido cumplir con estos.
Es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos de la marca Amway(productos de uso personal, aseo domestico y aseo personal), con esto espera poder cumplirle a todos sus clientes y que ellos la sigan buscando por calidad, economía y buen servicio.

El sueño de esta madre es continuar con su negocio, ahorrar parte de sus ingresos y luego tener la dicha de comprarse una vivienda propia, la cual pertenezca a sus hijas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 41-year-old woman and she is the mother of three daughters aged 3, 9 and 18. She engages in selling different products and she works in her house. Through her activity she succeeds in earning the money she needs to pay for her household expenses.

She is currently receiving a lot of requests for different products, but she has not been able to satisfy these requests for lack of working capital.

For this reason she is requesting a loan, and she will invest it in the purchase of the Amway brand personal and home cleanliness products she sells. In so doing, she hopes to succeed in satisfying her customers' requests so that they will keep on choosing her for her prices, the quality of her products and her good service.

This mother's dream is to continue carrying her activity out, in order to save part of her income to be able to buy a house of her own that her daughters will inherit in the future.

loans.use: to buy Amway brand products.

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
Ayda es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 19 años, y su negocio es la sastrería y venta de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad, dentro del área peri urbana, en los últimos años ha tenido un importante crecimiento poblacional principalmente por la llegada de migrantes del interior del país. De clima cálido sub tropical, con una temperatura que ronda entre los 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ayda es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, viste blusa blanca a rayas horizontales). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte libre como taxi y con su hijo que está terminando la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar en esta oportunidad la banca de personas con negocios como; venta de pollo frito, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, comercio de verduras, venta de queso, artesanía en cerámica y venta de sábanas, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la confección y venta de ropa; ella se dedica a comprar diferentes cortes de tela para confeccionar ropa de ambos sexos para venderla, actividad que realiza en su domicilio durante toda la semana, “compro variedades de telas de todos los colores, y confecciono prendas sencillas, como blusas y tops, la venta la realizo exponiendo mis prendas en mi lugar de trabajo y también ambulantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende su propia producción, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cortes de tela en diferentes colores. Su sueño es ampliar su taller de costura en su mismo domicilio, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela y una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que lleva con esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ayda solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela en diferentes colores para recuperar a sus clientes perdidos.
texts.en:
Ayda is a 40-year-old woman, who lives with her partner and has a 19-year-old son. She runs a tailoring and clothing-selling business.

She is optimistic, cheerful, and a good mother—a hard worker who has a good attitude and is responsible and committed to her work.

Her business is located in the Plan 3000 suburb, in the southern part of the city, within the peri-urban area. This region has a subtropical climate, with temperatures around 21-35 degrees Celsius (69.8-95 degrees Fahrenheit). The area has seen a significant population growth in the last few years mainly because of the arrival of migrants from the interior. 

Ayda is short, with a slim build. She has a tanned complexion, brownish-grey eyes, and long black hair—which she ties up. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and business purposes. (In the photo, she is the one sitting on the right, wearing a white blouse with horizontal stripes.) 

She shares her life with her partner, who works as a cab driver, and her son, who is finishing school. They live in their own wooden house, which has a corrugated iron roof and brick flooring. The house is equipped with basic utilities (water, electricity, and a sewer system).

The need to improve her business drove her to lead a communal bank in order to ask for a loan to improve the members' businesses. These businesses include selling fried chicken, beverages, second-hand clothing, vegetables, cheese, ceramic crafts, and sheets.   

Ayda's business is making and selling clothing. She buys different lengths of fabric to make women's and men's clothing to sell. She works from her home the whole week. "I buy an assortment of fabrics in all colours and make simple garments such as blouses and tops. I sell the garments at my business and also on the streets," she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she sells her creations. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy lengths of fabric in different colours. 

Her dream is to expand her sewing workshop in her home. She wants to buy lengths of fabric and an industrial sewing machine. 

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the six years that she has been running this business.

For these reasons, Ayda is requesting a loan to buy lengths of fabric in different colours so that she can recover her lost customers.

loans.use: to buy lengths of fabric in different colours so that she can recover her lost customers.

loans.name: Ilene

texts.en:
Ilene is married with three children and operates a motorcycle transportation business. Her husband works as OFW to make a living. She has run the transportation business for five years. Ilene is happy to say that this income helps her family a lot while awaiting the harvest of their crops.

She borrowed from GDMPC microfinance to purchase motor parts for motor repair. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Not Afraid Of Difficulties - N8Tna,vhòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 42 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years. Thúy lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase food for poultry and to develop an agricultural business.

In 2009, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase food for poultry and develop an agricultural business.

loans.name: Keep Trying For A Better Life - N6T9Qhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 40 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general thing for more than 10 years. Dung lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village.

The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more grocery items to resell and increase her profit.
In 2013, Dung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the leader of N6 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 64 years old and married with nine children she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Amparo has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Amparo would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Joyce works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Joyce is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anita Linda

texts.en:
Anita Linda is a married woman with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anita Linda is 55 years old and has one child in school.

Anita Linda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Anita Linda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Erhan

texts.en: Erhan wanted to build a toilet inside his home and also a disposable sewage system.  This will improve the health and welfare of his family

loans.use: to construct a toilet to improve sanitation and hygiene for his family.

loans.name: Las Vendedoras Group

texts.en:
The nine women in this group live in the town of Guineales in the Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where most of the men work in the cultivation of bananas and coffee. In fact, Guineales is a local word for bananas. Many of the women work in traditional weaving.

The women in the group range in age from 23 to 41. Four of them are illiterate and the most education any one of them has is sixth grade.
