In the group there are seven who sell traditional clothing, one who has a small store and also makes and sells ice cream, and one who sells coconuts and fried potatoes. These are hardworking women and they became interested in working with Namaste because they felt they needed to know a lot more about managing a business. Namaste will provide them with basic financial training, a business adviser to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan. They are very hopeful that these tools will make a difference in their business and their profits.

Doña Francisca is 35 years old, married with three children. The oldest boy is 18 and left school after third grade. The next boy is 17 and left school after second grade. They both work in the fields. The third boy is 9 and is in fourth grade. She herself has only a fourth grade education. Her husband works as a day laborer. Francisca has worked selling traditional clothing since she was very young. With the income from her business she helps support her family. She will invest her loan money in increasing her stock of clothing. She specifically wants to buy belts, shawls and a larger variety of blouses. Her dream is to make enough money to buy a gas stove, to avoid having smoke in the house from the wood stove she uses now. She knows the smoke affects the health of her family.

She currently has a monthly net profit of 3765 Guatemalan Quetzales, working 200 hours a month. She is projecting that by the end of the nine-month loan cycle with Namaste that her monthly net profit will have increased to 5559 Guatemalan Quetzales.

loans.use: to buy belts, shawls and a larger variety of blouses.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
Dilnoza was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in Spitamen region. She is married and has five children. He husband is an emigrant in Russia. She is a business lady who does business in agriculture. She has seven years of practice keeping and growing livestock. She likes her activity and tries to take care of her livestock.

Her son is sick. He has had health problems from birth, so he needs surgery. Dilnoza as a careful mother applied to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to do the operation. She hopes her son will be healthy. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay for surgery on her son.

loans.name: Mi Desarrollo (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mi Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo de Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y tres de 17,  14 y 11 años que estudia en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es aserrador de madera. 
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y generar sus propios ingresos que les ayudan a salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, la cual  la empezó hace 6 meses con los créditos que recibió, aun no vende muchos productos pero con la ayuda de los créditos espera ir aumentado su tienda y sus ganancias, ella también desde hace muchos años atrás se dedica a otras actividades como la cría de pollos y la preparación de corviches y empanadas actividad que realiza todas las tardes y que ahora también vende en su tienda. Así ella se gana algo por su cuenta que les ayuda a salir adelante ya que el marido no gana mucho y los gastos son muchos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Credit Union group “Crédito Mi Desarrollo' (Credit my development)” meets every fifteen days in Canton Junín. It is known for its friendly and hardworking people, and for distilling the best aguardient in Ecuador.

This is a group that decided to form some time ago. It has served them well to improve their small businesses. They engage in various endeavours such as: commerce, general services, food sales and other activities.

María is one of the group members. She is 51 years old and has a life partner with whom she has seven children: four of them are adults and three are still in school, aged 17, 14 and 11. Her partner is a carpenter.

María is a women who likes to prove her worth and to generate her own income, which helps keep her family going. She has a small food shop in her house, which she set up 6 months ago, using a loan. She still doesn't sell many products but with the help of a new loan she hopes to improve her shop and its income. She has also worked for many years doing things like raising chickens and preparing local pastries (corviches and empanadas), which she does in the afternoons, and which now she also sells in her shop. In this way she supplements her husband's earnings, which are not enough to cover the high costs of living.

This loan will be used to buy supplies for her shop. She has been in the group since its foundation and she likes it because each loan has helped her improve her business. Her dreams are to carry on improving her shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Maria Teodolinda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Maria espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in a rural area in the Oyotún district, located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The people from this district work mainly in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

Maria raises and sells barnyard animals such as guinea pigs, chicks, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others.  Her business is located in her home.  She has ten years of experience in this business and has very good personal and work references from the area.  She will use the loan she is requesting for the purchase of a larger quantity of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and chicks, among others, as well as the purchase of balanced feed for them.  In this way, Maria hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate a higher income and, in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals

loans.name: Freedom 1 Group

texts.en:
The freedom 1 Group lending group is entering it's eight loan cycle with ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. The members know each other well and are responsible. They are into the sale of grocery, diapers and smoked fish

This will be Grace's eight loan with ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. She is 43 years old, single and has a children who goes to school. Twelve years ago, she began selling grocery and diapers. With her sales, she is able to cover her household expenses and her children's school fees. Grace wants to better her business which will compete with the big grocery store in Teshie township.
This loan will be used to purchase grocery and diapers by Grace so that she can serve her customers better.

In the photograph, Grace is the first person standing on the right. She is grateful for the Kiva lenders for supporting her and her friends.

loans.use: to purchase grocery and diapers for Grace, so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Mwihoko Tosheka 11 Widows Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Faith, thirty five years old and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to gain skills on how to run and expand her business through enterprise and financial management training. She does dairy farming and is borrowing Kiva loan to add to her savings to buy a dairy cow. This will lead to increase in milk levels hence increase in income.

She hopes Kiva loan will improve her living standards through easy provision of food and clothes to her family. She will also pay school fees for her child in school.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk sales and thus improve her ability to provide food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Tseren-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Tseren-Ochir, 42 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a maintenance engineer at the power plant for 16 years. His wife is physician who has worked at the high school for 15 years.

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house and his family now lives in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating.

Now he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to install pipeline in order to connect his house to central water system. By doing so his family will no longer need to bring water from the public well and can afford to use warm water. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to install a pipeline in order to connect to the central water system.

loans.name: Big Women, Big Action - N05Tsơn2Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 47 years old and she is married. Nga lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

She has operated a small restaurant selling snacks for more than 10 years.
Before borrowing money from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Limited Institution, she just had enough money to cook and sell rice gruel with eel.

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. After joining Thanh Hoa MFI, she had capital to purchase more food for her restaurant like stuffed pancake, kebab rice noodles.

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to widen the restaurant and purchase more items for selling
With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to widen the restaurant and purchase more items for selling.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 48 years old and he lives in the village of Kavart of Syunik region. He is married and he has a son. All of the family members are employed and all of them also manage farming. On the farm Davit has cows, heifers, pigs and piglets and also several bee colonies.

Davit is especially proud of his swine breeding as his farm’s pork is greatly popular and he has a lot of customers for its purchase. Davit sells his farm’s meat, milk, cheese and honey from his farm by the help of his wife.

Davit thinks already to do some repairing of his cattle barn since autumn is close and it will be harder to do that work in rainy weather. So this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Davit asks as he wants to repair his cattle barn making it safer for the coming season.

loans.use: to repair his cattle barn, making it safer for the coming season.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with three children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is 38 years old who raise hogs for a living. This has been her business for ten years now. She usually earn PHP5000 for her family. She has four children ages six, nine, thirteen and sixteen.

Dalia is asking a loan to buy more piglets and sacks of hog feed, so she will not buy on a daily basis. She hope to increase her profits so she can continue sending her children to school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and sacks of hog feed.

loans.name: Julio Adriano

texts.es:
Julio tiene 25 años de edad, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural.que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Julio se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, contando con herramientas propias como su moto carguera en la cual transporta sus adobes que fabrica a sus clientes, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo compra de insumos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener más stock de ladrillos, con gran influencia en el negocio; piensa incrementar su producción y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old and has no children. He lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural zone in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Perú.

Julio makes his living manufacturing bricks. He has his own tools, such as his freight motorcycle with which he transports the adobe bricks he makes to his customers. He has over 5 years experience in this business, which is located in his home.

He seeks a loan for working capital to buy supplies. The investment will allow him to increase his stock of bricks, which will greatly influence the business. He plans to increase his production, in order to meet the diverse needs of the customers in his area, to increase his income, and thereby better his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina wants to cover the animal stable and build a fence around the property. She previously built the walls of the stable and now wants to cover it. 'Last year my animals lived in the cold, because we try to through things to build some sort of roofing. however, this year I must secure them a proper place for them to sleep and stay," said Gjeline to the loan officer.

Gjelina's husband and her two children, boy and girl were born with some sort of illnesses and she's got to take care of almost everyone in the family

loans.use: to continue finishing up the stable of her animals that she started with the previous loan.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
Adrián, de 67 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos, de ellos 2 asisten a la escuela.

Adrián, se ha dedicado a trabajos agrícolas, donde siembra maíz, frijol y le da mantenimiento al cultivo de café, normalmente se dedica también a prestar servicio de trabajo a sus vecinos, donde gana dinero para el sustento de la familia; tiene que levantase a las 3:00 de la madrugada para prepararse y salir a realizar las labores agrícolas a las 4:00 de la mañana y trabaja hasta las 3:00 de la tarde haciendo huecos para sembrar café, este trabajo es muy pesado, pero lo realiza porque en el lugar donde vive, no hay otra forma de hacer dinero.

Adrián, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar abono y fertilizantes para cultivar nuevamente maíz y frijol, porque había sembrado pero debido a la sequía que sufre nuestro país, perdió los cultivos.

El sueño más importante para él, es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y sean profesionales y también desea mejorar su vivienda porque la que tiene es pequeña y de bahareque.
texts.en:
Adrian, who is 67 years old, has a wife and three children, two of whom are in school.

Adrian is dedicated to agricultural work, sowing corn and beans, and he also works to maintain his coffee plantings. Normally, he also offers works for his neighbors, to earn money to sustain his family. He has to rise at 3:00 am to prepare to depart for his agricultural work at 4:00 am, and he works until  3:00 in the afternoon digging holes to plant coffee trees. The work is very hard but he does it because where he lives, there is no other way to make money.

Adrian needs the money from this loan to buy manure and fertilizers for cultivating corn and beans once again, because he had planted his crop but the drought that our country has just suffered resulted in the loss of his crops.

Adrian's most important dream is that his children can study and become professionals and, also, he wants to improve their home because the one they have is small and made of mud.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers to cultivate corn and beans once again.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajara, estudio hasta segundo grado, no continuo estudiando porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos, está soltera, pero tiene 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 11 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno estudia y 2 trabajan, para ayudarle en los gastos de la casa.

Rosa, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos, este tipo de trabajo lo realiza desde hace 20 años y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio; para llegar a su trabajo camina 200 metros y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 3 bovinos y comprar insumos agricolas como semilla, pesticidas, para sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz; con esto logrará obtener una buena cosecha y tendrá más ingresos para ayudar con todos los gastos de su casa. 

El sueño de Rosa, es ampliar su negocio de crianza de cerdos, aumentar su hato ganadero y ayudarle económicamente a su hijo, para que pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria, para que tenga mejores posibilidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard working 39 year old woman. She studied until the second grade but couldn't carry on because her parents didn't have the resources. She is a single mother and has three children aged 20, 17 and 11 years old, of which only one is at school. The other two work to help out with the household expenses. 

Rosa works in agriculture, raising pigs, which she has been doing for 20 years. She learnt how to run the business from her parents, who had always done it themselves. To get to her work she walks for 200 metres and works from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m, seven days a week.

She is asking for a loan to buy 3 cows and to buy farming supplies like seeds and pesticides to plant 3,500 square metres of corn. With this, she'll manage to obtain a good harvest and will have more income to help with household costs. 

Rosa's dream is to improve her pig business and to grow her heard, which should help her child graduate from university, so that they can have the best possible start in their career.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows and farming supplies like seeds and pesticides to plant 3,500 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a 52 year old hard working woman. She lives in Kamwenge where she rears livestock specifically goats and supplements this business with the sale of second hand clothes. This helps her get school fees for her children. She plans to expand her business but her main setback is inadequate capital to purchase enough stock.

Sauda is requesting for a loan to buy goats to keep and resale.

loans.use: to buy goats to keep and resale.

loans.name: Jlg-002(A)-Aathanur Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. 39-year-old Pavunu from Kulithalai in Tamil Nadu, southern India has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But she does not have the means to build one. A daily wage earner, working hard to support the family, she stretches every rupee to ensure that a household of six members is able to subsist on a monthly income of Rs 8700. Building a toilet by paying for it upfront is not an option for her.

With no access to a toilet, their families have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. Their women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. They are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and insect or animal bites.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Pavunu and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, she has joined hands with three other women and together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
The gentleman in the photo is Hezron. He is thirty four years old, married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2014.

Hezron is a dairy farmer. He is also a skilled plumber and runs a plumbing shop in the local shopping center. He is grateful to HiH EA for the enterprise training and for his first loan that enabled him scale up his plumbing enterprise. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase a cow. He hopes to obtain higher milk production and hence better income from his farm. Through the income, he will be able to provide family needs such as food, shelter and education for his children.
Hezron is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase a cow that will improve milk production thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Pratima is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from a small village of Falakata. She is married to Ganesh. They are blessed with two sons. One of her sons is studying in grade 4 and another one is too small to attend school.

Pratima's husband is a carpenter whose income is hardly sufficient for the family expenses. So to help her husband financially, Pratima runs her own cattle rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling more milk and milk products.

Pratima seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Pratima will be able to provide a decent life to her family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 49 years old and married with three children. For the past six years she has earned an income farming sugarcane and operating a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.


Lanie is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is a very young, rural woman from Falakata. She is only 25 years old, married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She is married to Sankar, a 26-year-old farmer. They live in a small village called Baganbari in Falakata, West Bengal. Their children are too young to go to school.

Pinki is a homemaker who looks after her children, does all the household work, and in her spare time, helps her husband in his farm work. Her husband is a farmer. He is engaged in farming, growing paddy (rice) and other vegetables. He struggles hard to grow good quality products. He is a person who is always looking out for his family's well-being. But the income generated from the farming is hardly sufficient to cover all the expenses, so they want to grow paddies in order to earn more profits.

Thus, Pinki requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for paddy cultivation. They believe that the loan will provide her with all adequate farming needs and in that way obtain for them better revenues. They will be able to improve the well-being of their family. Pinki wants to purchase some more agricultural lands with the earned profit.

She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy (rice).

loans.name: Annjay

texts.en:
Annjay, 34, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past four years she has had a bicycle rickshaw business in the Philippines.

Annjay has applied for a 7000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy spare parts and other things needed for her rickshaw. She is working hard to save money and so provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other things needed for her rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and the necessary feed to fattening them.

loans.name: William Ivan

texts.es:
William tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

William se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto William espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
William is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in a rural are of the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district mainly work in agriculture, livestock and trade.

William raises and sells small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and more. His business is located in his house. He has 3 years' experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens and more, as well as balanced feed for them. With this, William hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate better income and therefore increase his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
As the parent of two children, Cecille works hard to support her family. She sells spices and vegetables to earn a living in the Philippines.

Cecille has been supporting her businesses through her past four loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 6000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Hernan se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Hernan espera ofrecer una arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and their children in his own house, which is made of rustic material, in the Pomahuaca district, located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is tranquil. The people work principally in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.

Hernan works in agriculture, specifically in raising rice. He has 30 years of experience in this area and very good personal and work references in the zone. He will use the loan that will be granted to him for the purchase of compost and fertilizers in order to properly care for his rice crop, as well as to contract for labor for the harvest season. With this, Hernan hopes to offer rice of better quality to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of income and in the end will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers in order to properly care for his rice planting

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Su inclinación por la estética y el cuidado del cabello, cautivaron a Roxana desde que era una estudiante de colegio, ella comenzó a indagar sobre este ámbito, hasta llegar al punto de capacitarse y empezar a trabajar en una sala de belleza.  Tiempo después con el apoyo de su mamá, adquirió sus herramientas de trabajo y adecuó su salón de belleza, con una gran acogida por los vecinos, conocidos y amigos.  Actualmente está funcionando en un nuevo local que se encuentra en una zona más comercial y su expectativa es incrementar el número de servicios ofrecidos.  Roxana está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina para surtir de productos capilares y divisiones en vidrio templado.  Con esta inversión promoverá el uso de tratamientos entre sus clientes y su local lucirá más vanguardista.  Su meta de negocio es adquirir su propio local y continuar ofreciendo excelentes servicios para captar nuevos clientes y mantener a los actuales.
texts.en: Her inclination for aesthetics and hair care captured Roxana when she was a high school student. She started to investigate this field until she got trained and started to work in a beauty salon. Some time later, with her mother's help, she acquired her tools and set up her own beauty salon which was very popular with the neighbors, acquaintances and friends. Right now, it is operating in a new locale that is in a more commercial area and her hope is to increase the number of services offered. Roxana is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in buying a display case to stock hair care products and tempered glass dividers. With this investment,  she will promote the use of treatments for her customers and her locale will look more on the vanguard. Her goal is to acquire her own locale and continue offering excellent services to capture new customers and keep the ones she has now.

loans.use: to invest in a display case to stock up on hair products and tempered glass dividers.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year old Minati is a married woman and a mother of three children (two daughters and one son). Two of them read in college and one reads in school. She lives with her family in a remote village, Dalimpur in Falakata.

Minati's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He plants and grows good quality crops. He has many years of experience in this line of work. He has very good clients for his moral character and behavior as he sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers. Minati, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they want to cultivate paddy (rice) because the climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation.

Minati applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow good quality paddy so that their products will be the best quality, and therefore they can sell the products to their valued customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits so that they can improve the quality of life of their family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Marto

texts.es:
Marto es un hombre de 37 años de edad, es solero vive junto a su linfa familia en una comunidad denominada San Antonio Palopo,
Marto con el afán de darle a su familia lo mejor se dedica desde hace cinco años a la compra y venta de ropa típica, y esta labor lo realiza desde la actividad de su domicilio y esto le permite realizar otras actividades por lo que su segunda actividad es la venta de verduras y gracias a estas dos actividades le ha ido muy bien. Marto con el anhelo de seguir prosperando con su negocio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar más productos de ropa como, hilos, güipiles, fajas y cortes para ofrecerle a los clientes una variedad de producto.
Marto su mayor sueño es construir una casa propia donde pueda vivir mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Marto is a 37 year-old single man who lives with his lovely family in a community called San Antonio Palopo.

In an effort to give his family the best, five years ago Marto started buying and selling traditional clothing. He does this work from his home and this allows him to run another business activity, which is selling vegetables. Thanks to these two businesses, he has been doing well. 

Due to his desire to continue prospering with his business, he made the decision to apply for a loan in order to purchase more clothing products such as yarn, blouses, woven belts, and skirts in order to offer his clients a greater selection of products.  His greatest dream is to build his own home where he can better his life.

loans.use: to purchase and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Jessica Guillermina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 8 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela, el marido es comerciante.
Doña Jessica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así  lograr sus ingresos para salir adelante, ella junto a su marido tienen una tienda de víveres en un local que arriendan en el merca do local, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad,  gran parte del crédito ella lo invierte en arroz que es el producto que más venden, ella compra por quintales y luego venden por libras o en saquillos desde 10 libras en adelante, trabajan todos los días y ya son más de 17 años que llevan con  este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más víveres para surtir su tienda y arroz. Lleva más de 13 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños es tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The loan group "24 de Mayo" (24th of May) meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, since it is a zone with abundant vegetation.

Señora Jessica lives in this place. She is 33 years old. She is in a free-union relationship, and from this relationship she has three children, ages 16, 8, and 2. The two older ones are in secondary and primary school. Her husband works in commerce.

Doña Jessica is a woman who likes to work and thus earn her income in order to get ahead. She, together with her husband, has a grocery store in a location that they rent in the local market. There they sell every type of product of primary need. She will invest a large part of the loan in rice, which is the product that they sell most. She buys by the quintal [approximately one hundred pounds] and then sells by the pound or in sacks of 10 pounds or more. They work every day, and they have already had this business for more that 17 years. It allows them to get ahead.

She is going to invest this loan in buying more groceries and rice to stock her store. She has been in the loan group for more than 13 years, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot to improve her business. Her dream is to have her own business location.

loans.use: to buy groceries and rice

loans.name: Kalitara

texts.en:
Kalitara is a 29-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). One of them reads in grade 4 and the other one is a toddler. She lives with her husband and two children in a small village, Raychenga of Falakata. Her husband, 39-year-old Paritosh, is engaged with cultivation, which is the only source of income for their family.

They have an agricultural land where he cultivates different kinds of crops and vegetables. He works in their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow varieties of crops according to the seasonal demand, which he sells in the local market and earns for their livelihood. Kalitara also helps her husband in his work after managing her domestic jobs.

Now they decided to grow paddy (rice) in their land, as it is a very beneficial crop and also has a great demand in India because of its various nourishment value.

Thus, Kalitara requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., so that they can grow good quality paddy in their land. Kalitara's hopes and dreams are to be able to expand their business to give good financial support to her family and give a better life and education to their children from the profit generated from the business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing paddies (rice).

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il est est composé de femmes issues de la même localité et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Nancy est une femme mariée âgée de 61 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons et deux filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de jus de fruits qu'elle fabrique elle même.
Son nouveau crédit de quatre cent cinquante mille francs CFA lui permettra de se payer des sacs de bissap,de pain de singes et su sucres pour lui permettre de fabriquer des jus qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
Elle capitalise beaucoup d’expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices tirés d son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the ’banc villageois’. It is composed of women from the same town, and they are united by social and professional relationships. The official of the group, Ms. Nancy is a married woman, 61 years old, and the mother of six children (four boys and two girls). She has been active in commerce selling fruit juice drinks, which she produces herself. 

Her new loan of 450,000 francs CFA will enable her to pay for sacks of bissap [dried hibiscus flowers], monkey bread [the fruit of the baobab tree], and some sugar, enabling her to produce juice drinks, which she is going to sell retail in her neighborhood. 

She capitalizes on much experience in this domain for having done it for a long time. The profits earned from her business allows her to meet the food needs of her family and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to purchase bissap, sugar, and  'monkey bread', to make juice drinks

loans.name: Luisa Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella, el marido no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Luisa es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante, ella al ver que su marido no trabaja por su enfermedad se vio en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos carteras y  productos de Belcorp y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días ya sea a vender o a cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra  cada semana, esta forma ella logra ganar el sustento de su familia, lleva muchos años dedicada al comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida.
texts.en:
The members of the  "24 de mayo" communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, where most people who live there engage in agriculture and livestock raising, and for being a very green area. 

This is where Luisa, age 55, lives. She is in a common-law relationship and has four adult children; one of them still lives with her. Her husband does not work, for health reasons.

Luisa is a woman who has always liked to make her own way in life. As her husband does not work due to his illness, she saw the need to generate her own income. She sells clothing, shoes, wallets, as well as Belcorp and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door. She goes out every day, whether to sell or collect, as she extends credit and collects weekly. In this way she manages to support her family. She has worked in this business for many years.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products she sells. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and likes it because of the loan assistance she is offered. Her dream is to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Esthefany Maria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Esthefany, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 2  años de edad. El marido trabaja realizando fletes en una mototaxi. Ella estudia Marketing en una universidad,
Doña Esthefany es una joven muy trabajadora que con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta para los gastos de sus estudios se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa, zapatos y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella vende por su localidad, en su casa y en el lugar donde estudia ya que sus compañeros son sus mejores clientes, ella deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene casi 2 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite generar sus ingresos que los invierte en sus estudios esperando ser una profesional y mejorar su vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio que le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija y ser una profesional.
texts.en:
The 24th of May Credit Group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being a very dynamic place where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry since it is a region with great vegetation. 

Nineteen year-old Esthefany lives here and is in a common-law marriage from which she has a two year-old daughter. Her husband works doing  motorbike deliveries and she studies marketing at a university. 

Esthefany is a very hardworking young woman. With the goal of earning her own money to pay for her studies, she runs a business selling clothing, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door, around her town, in her home and where she studies, since her classmates are her best customers. She offers credit and charges every eight days. She has been doing this for almost two years and it has allowed her to earn income that she invests in her studies in the hopes of becoming a professional and improving her life. 

This loan is to purchase clothing, shoes and other things she sells. She has been in the credit group for two years and likes it because with the loans she has financed her business, which allows her to get ahead. Her dreams are to give the best to her daughter and to be a professional.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Lucia Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es mecánico y comerciante.
Doña Lucia realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido  en su labor, el tiene un taller en el cual realiza arreglos a todo tipo de bicicletas, allí también y con la ayuda de Doña Lucia tienen un local en el cual se dedican a la venta de bicicletas y todo tipo de repuestos como llantas, cadenas y otros repuestos y  accesorios que el utiliza para realizar los arreglos,  lleva más de 12 años realizando  esta labor la cual se les ha facilitado con los créditos razón por lo cual están muy agradecidos con la institución.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar bicicletas, llantas, cadenas, cuadrantes, repuestos  y accesorios para bicicletas. Lleva más de 8 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Credit Group "24 de Mayo" [24 of May] meets biweekly. This place is known for being very dynamic, where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry and being an area with great vegetation.
This is where Lucia lives. She is 36 years old, is married and has two children 14 to 10 years of age. They are studying in school. Her husband is a mechanic and merchant.
 Lucia is taking this loan to help her husband in his work. He has a workshop in which he makes repairs for all kinds of bikes. At this same local, and with the help of Lucia, they have a store in which they sell bicycles and all kinds of spare parts such as tires, chains and other parts and accessories  used for repairs.  She has over 12 years doing this work which has been possible due to the loans for which they are very grateful to the institution .
This loan is going to be used to buy bicycles, tires, chains, dials, bike parts and accessories.She has been in the Credit Group more than 8 years in and likes it because the loans are badly needed. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy bicycles, tires, chains, dials, bike parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabrics, cotton and paint.

loans.name: Yohanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yohanna, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 7 años que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una farmacia. 
Doña Yohanna es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi  todos los días en las mañana cuando está en la escuela su hijo ya que ahí se le hace más fácil salir, ella  también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The 24th of May Credit Group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, which is known for being a very dynamic place. The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry since it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Twenty-seven year-old Yohana lives in this place. She is in a common-law marriage from which she has a seven year-old son who is in school. Her husband works in a pharmacy. 

Yohana is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing of all types, shoes, and other Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She goes out almost every day selling door to door in the morning when her son is at school since it's easier for her to go out then. She also sells from her house where her customers come when they need an item. She offers credit and charges every week. She has been doing this business for more than four years and it's going very well. 

This loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, and creams, among other products. She has been in the credit group for more than three years and likes it because the loans help a lot. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfume and creams, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de edad, con ella vive una nieta que es como su hija ya que la y tiene desde pequeña y ahora tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio, además de su nieta un hijo también vive con ellos. El marido es carpintero.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, granos, legumbres, plátano, ciertas bebidas y carbón, en esto último es que va a invertir más ya que se avecina el fenómeno del niño y este material escasea por las lluvias y ella espera comprar para tener una buena reserva ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran el carbón, el cual lo utilizan para preparar alimentos en ciertos asaderos y restaurantes del lugar, lleva más de 16  años con su tienda la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y carbón. Lleva 16 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the “May 24th” credit group meets every 15 days. The city is known for being very dynamic and for being an area with much vegetation where the majority of its residents make a living farming and raising animals. 

Mrs. Rosa, 69 years old, lives here. She is married, and from that relationship they have four grown children. With her lives a granddaughter who is like her daughter, as she has had her since she was very young and is now 14 years old and studies in school. In addition to her granddaughter, one of her sons lives with them. Her husband is a carpenter.   

Mrs. Rosa is a woman that likes to move forward and through her efforts to help with the household expenses. She has a small grocery store in her house. There she sells all types of food staples such as grains, vegetables, plantains, drinks and coal. 

She is going to invest more in coal as El Niño season is coming and the material is scarce as a result of the rains. She hopes to buy enough to have a good reserve, as she has several customers that are always purchasing coal from her – as it is used to prepare food in certain grills and at restaurants in the area. She has more than 16 years of experience with her store, which she started with the first loan the group received for which she is very grateful.

This loan is to purchase food supplies to supply her store and coal. She has been with the credit group for 16 years and likes it because through it she started her business. Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and coal.

loans.name: Liliana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3  años de edad. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Liliana es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado con su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, para esto ella realiza el crédito pues su esposo lo utiliza  en  un  negocio  que tiene  de cabinas telefónicas, venta de equipos, chip, accesorios y recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras, de esta forma el logra ganar el pan diario para su hogar, pero fuera mucho mejor si contara con un local propio pues parte de sus ganancias se le van en el pago de arriendo y servicios del local, sus deseos en un futuro es tener su propio local y aumentar el negocio el cual es muy bueno ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que ha conseguido en estos  4 años con su negocio.  
Este crédito es para comprar accesorios, equipos telefónicos, recargas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 6 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son tener su propio  local.
texts.en:
The 24th of May Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is know for being very dynamic; because of the great soil most of the inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. This is where Liliana lives. She is 26 years old and in a civil union from which she has a three year old son. Her partner is a businessman. 

Liliana and her partner have always enjoyed keeping a nice home. This is what she would use the loan for, while he would use it for his telecommunications business which has phone booths, sim cards, appliances, and calling card refills from various operators. This is how he is able to bring home the daily bread. However it would be much better if he had his own location as part of his revenue goes towards rent and services. Their desire in the future is to have their own location to grow the business which is already quite good and relies on a good customer base which they've accomplished in four years of running the business. 

This loan is to purchase accessories, telephone equipment, and calling card refills, among other things. She has been with the credit group for six years and enjoys the benefits she receives from the group. Their dream is to own their own location.

loans.use: purchase accessories, telephone equipment, calling card refills, etc...

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and groceries.

Edita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, sandwich spreads, eggs, toiletries, and beauty products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Edita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, home care products, and groceries.

Fe has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, biscuits, candy, coffee, soap, wax, and groceries.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josephine has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Michel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Michel has been in this business for 2 years, and has borrowed from NWTF once in the past. Michel requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Michel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Dhiva

texts.en: Dhiva is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer who hadn’t been able to fully provide for the family’s daily needs. They decided to open a small sari-sari (general store). For the past three years, they have earned more income than what they expected and Dhiva was able to send their children to school and provide for the family’s needs. Dhiva wants to expand her business. She wants to borrow money to buy more goods to sell and earn more profit so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Norma has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 49 years old and married with six children. With three of her children currently in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. Fe has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, sugar, soft-drinks, etc.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like nets, gasoline, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, gasoline, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Maria Delia is 57 years old with two children. With two children in school, Maria Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, noodles, home care products and other groceries.

Maria Delia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, pancit (noodles), shampoo, soap, conditioner, rice, school supplies, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future Maria Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, noodles, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has also been operating her own newspaper stand for years and she earns well from this. Aside from newspapers, she also offers grocery products like candies, cigarettes and different types of beverages. Her income from her business helped provide for her family's daily needs and make improvements to her stall.

Soledad aims to grow what she has now. She would like to apply again for a new loan to purchase additional newspaper and grocery items she needs to add in her inventory. At an amount of PHP 15,000, she can already increase her items and sales at the same time. She would like you to know that she will appreciate whatever amount you are willing to lend her.

In the future, Soledad hopes to give her family a better life someday and she desires to be able to save for their future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell in her business, including newspapers, cigarettes and beverages.

loans.name: Mariflor

texts.en:
Mariflor is 40 years old and married.

Mariflor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

Mariflor has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Mariflor aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The goal for every pig loan group is to become successful pig breeders, have enough savings and continue their program with their own money. As a group who received a loan from MUK, the Daya Pertiwi Group succeeded in reaching the goal. Four members were successful with their pig businesses and continued the program with their own savings. They are very happy and said they are grateful to Lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support they have received so far. The group has also changed the composition of its board. Now they have chosen Ni Kadek as the head. The rest of the group decided to continue with their loan until they also reached their goals.

Ni Kadek, 39, is a housewife. She started the pig business when she was married 8 years ago. Now with 11 members left, the Daya Pertiwi Group is receiving 22,000,000 IDR in total and each member is receiving 2,000,000 IDR. Ni Kadek will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. She will keep them for 6 months. Ni Kadek hopes she can sell the pigs at a high price and that she can have enough savings to continue the business without taking a loan.

Two members couldn't attend the meeting because of illness and a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and has 5 child to provide for. Her husband is a construction worker and can't fully cover their needs because of the little income that he can get out of his work.

Maria decided to help her husband in earning money and also to support the needs of her child. Now, she is engaged in a piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them to the market. She requested a loan to buy feeds for the pigs so that she can produce good quality pigs and can deliver pigs to supply her customer's demands. This will result in a greater income.

Maria's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, debido a los problemas del conflicto armado ya no siguió sus estudios, está casado, su esposa es empleada doméstica y él es padre de 5 hijos, su hija mayor trabaja en san salvador y está casada, el segundo y el tercero trabajaba y están solteros, la cuarta ayuda en los oficios del hogar y el quinto estudia quinto grado.

José, trabaja como jornalero, en la siembra de granos básicos desde hace 40 años, aprendió este trabajo gracias a sus padres, porque ellos se dedicaban a trabajar en la agricultura; esa es la única actividad productiva que tiene José.- El lugar donde trabaja está a 15 minutos de su casa y camina a pie para llegar, en los trabajos agrícolas le ayudan sus hijos.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para cultivar maíz y pagar mano de obra, para que realicen labores de limpieza, siembra y desombra de árboles.- El crédito le ayudará a generar más ganancias y a tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
El sueño del José, es que su familia se supere económicamente, para que puedan vivir en condiciones más estables, también quiere seguir trabajando y en los días venideros tener un financiamiento más grande para comprar vacas productoras.
texts.en:
José, aged 60, stopped school in first grade owing to armed conflict and did not continue his studies. He is married, his wife is a housekeeper, and he has 5 children. The eldest works in San Salvador and is married; the second and third child are working and are single; the fourth helps out at home, and the fifth is in fifth grade at school.

José has worked as a day laborer growing basic grains for 40 years. He learned his trade from his parents, who worked in agriculture. This is José's only paying job. He works a 15-minute walk from his home, and his agricultural work helps his children.

José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating corn and to pay labor costs for cleaning, planting and trimming plants. The loan will allow him to increase his earnings and improve the quality of life for his family.

José's dream is to increase his family's income so that they can enjoy more economic stability. He wants to continue working and would like to have sufficient earnings to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cultivating corn and paying labor costs.

loans.name: Mame Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il regroupe des femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Mame Aissatou est la responsable elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont trois filles et quatre garçons tous scolarisés.Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de savons et de poulets et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour  l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 250000 francs CFA elle va se payer des cartons de savons et des poussins qu'elle va élever pour les revendre plu tard.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created since the first cycle of the banc villageois. It brings together women who are united by good social and professional links. Mrs Mame Aissatou is the leader, she is married and the mother of seven children (three girls and four boys) who all go to school.
Her trade is the sale of soap and chickens and she has a good experience in this field as she has practiced it for a long time. With her new 250,000FCFA loan, she will purchase boxes of soap and chicks that she will rear to resell them later. The earnings from her activity will allow her to take care of the family's food needs and to grow her savings at the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap that she will retail.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio Rodolfo  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is still in the transportation business.
His aim is to improve his lot in life.
His dream is to expand his business.
He is applying for the loan to buy tires for his car.
He is happy with the loan and promises to be punctual in his repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Domingo Israel

texts.es:
Domingo es un gran hombre que día con día se esfuerza mucho para darles lo mejor a sus familia, él tiene 41 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 11 y 21 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad denominada San Pablo Jocopilas.
Domingo para darle a su familia lo necesario desde hace 10 años es trabajador de un ingenio que es de donde provienen sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia, afortunadamente Domingo cuneta con el apoyo de su amada esposa quien cuenta con una tienda para generar sus ingresos.
Domingo es un padre sobreprotector de su familia y ahora se ha dado cuenta que la necesidad primordial de la familia es la construcción de una cocina para contar con un lugar más adecuado donde preparar los  alimentos, aunque una de sus dificultades es no contar con el dinero suficiente para empezar la construcción y raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como; cemento, cal, arena y block. Su más grande sueño es que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Domingo is a great man who toils away every day to ensure his family's happiness.
He is 41, married, and has two children (aged 11 and 21). This beautiful family, whom he loves very much, lives in a village by the name of San Pablo Jocopilas.
Domingo has been working at a sugar cane plant for ten years in order to provide for his family.
Fortunately, his beloved wife also contributes to the household thanks to her shop.
Domingo is very protective of his family and he noticed that the absolute priority for their well-being right now is to build a kitchen.
That way, they will have a more appropriate place where to prepare food.
He faces the challenge of not having enough money to start construction, which is why he asks for a loan to buy the necessary materials, such as cement, lime, sand, and breezeblocks.
His greatest dream is to see his children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Grupo Ian Casitas Group

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre de 46 años de edad, es feliz mente casado con una linda familia de cinco hijos de los cuales tiene las edades entre 15 y 25 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada aldea chocola.
Sebastián (el primero del lado izquierdo de la foto) es líder del grupo denominada IAN CASITAS, por ser un persona que cuenta con mucho entusiasmo para la superación de su familia, él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa para bebes, con esta actividad ya tiene 2 años de ejércelo, gracias a su calidad de servicio ha logrado que mucha gente busque sus productos y con este logro él se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para comprar más telas y seguir elaborando ropa para bebes. Su mayo sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 46, happily married, and has five children (between 15 and 25 years of age). This humble family lives in a village by the name of Aldea Chocola.
Sebastián (first person from the left in the picture) is head of the group Ian Casitas.
He is very determined to give his family a better life.
He has been making and selling baby clothes for two years, and attributes the success of his business to the quality of his customer service.
Due to the high number of customers, he needs a loan to buy enough cloth to make even more baby clothes.
His greatest dream is to see his business grow and his income increase.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make baby clothes.

loans.name: Grupo Chocola Las Cuñadas Group

texts.es:
Edith (la tercera de izquierda a derecha de blusa anaranjado) es una gran madre de familia y excelente esposa, tiene 32 años de edad, con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 1 y 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Edith es líder del grupo Chocola La Cuñadas, por ser una de la pocas mujeres que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, ella desde hace dos años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, y lo vende en el mercado de su comunidad, con esta labor ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Edith su amabilidad y respeto con los clientes la ha convertido en una de las mejores vendedoras, por lo que se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para surtir mejor su negocio y ofrecerles a los clientes un mejor servicio.
El gran sueño de Edith es que su negocio crezca para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edith (third person from the left, wearing an orange top) is a great mother and an excellent spouse.
She is 32 and has three children (between 1 and 16 years of age). This beautiful and humble family lives in a village in Suchitepéquez.
Edith heads the group Chocola las Cuñadas.
She is very determined to give her family a better life and is one of the few who toils away every day to accomplish this goal.
She has been buying and selling traditional clothing for two years.
She sells her wares at the town market and the income she derives from this goes towards providing for her family.
She attributes her success over the competition to the amiability and respect she displays towards customers.
Due to the high number of customers, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise to sell and provide an even better service.
Edith's great dream is to see her business grow for the sake of her children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña rodeada de árboles grandes y frondosos que transmiten tranquilidad, se conformó un grupo de préstamo llamado "Artesanas del Fresno" que se dedican a continuar el legado de hombres y mujeres artesanos de la comunidad. 

 Doña Alejandra es una mujer seria pero sumamente responsable, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el señor Marcos y juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos que ahora ya son independientes. Doña Alejandra se dedica a la elaboración de bordados desde hace cuarenta años y aprendió la actividad gracias a su mamá. Doña Alejandra argumentó “Saber bordar es toda una tradición, aquí, quien no elabora este tipo de bordados es como si no viviera en la comunidad porque es parte de nuestras costumbres”. La señora Alejandra tiene un local en su casa donde pone a la venta sus artesanías.
