Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar materia prima como agujas, estambres, tela de lana, estambrón, agujas, etc. “Para mí, el crédito será de gran ayuda porque así podre adquirir más fácilmente mis materiales”. El reto de Doña Alejandra es la falta de mercado para poder ofrecer sus artesanías, en su comunidad y sus alrededores es muy difícil obtener buenas ganancias, aún más en las temporadas de calor como los meses en curso en los cuales las ventas son muy bajas. Sin embargo, llegando octubre, se tiene que preparar para elaborar la mayor cantidad de artesanías que serán muy solicitadas en invierno. 

Alejandra es una gran cliente en VFMéxico, el apoyo financiero ha ayudad a impulsar su negocio porque con facilidad puede adquirir su materia prima. Su es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y se esfuerzan mucho para obtener las mejores ganancias y solventar los gastos de su hogar como la educación de sus hijos, para comprarles ropa, zapatos y más alimentos.

 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Angelina, Zenaida, Ma Luisa, Porfiria y María de la Luz quienes invertirán en sus bordados, mientras que Doña María de los Ángeles y Jhynalin, lo harán en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
In a very small village surrounded by tall and leafy trees that radiate tranquillity, a communal bank was formed, called 'Artesanas del Fresno' (Craftswomen of the Ash Tree), dedicated to perpetuating the legacy of the village's craftsmen and craftswomen.
Alejandra is very serious and at the same time very responsible. She is 52 and is married to Marcos. Together, they founded a family, and their four children have families of their own now.
Alejandra has been making embroideries for forty years, a craft she learned from her mother.
She says that embroidery is a deeply-ingrained tradition in the village, and that if you do not practice the craft, you might as well not be a part of the community.
Alejandra has a shop at her house where she sells her products.
She asks for the loan to buy the supplies she needs: needles, worsted, wool cloth, yarn, etc.
She says that the loan will be of great help to her, since it will make it easier for her to buy supplies.
The main challenge Alejandra faces is the lack of a proper market for her embroideries.
In the village and the surrounding areas, it is difficult to make a decent profit, a situation which worsens in the hot season (now ongoing), which typically sees very low sales.
When October rolls around, however, Alejandra needs to be ready to increase her production, since her products are very much in demand during the winter.
Alejandra is a loyal member of VFMéxico, and the financial support the latter extends helps her improve her business by easily purchasing raw materials and supplies.
Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living, and she spares no effort to increase her income and cover household expenses: education, clothing, shoes, and food.
The other members of the group are Angelina, Zenaida, Ma Luisa, Porfiria and María de la Luz, who are also embroiderers, and María de los Ángeles and Jhynalin, who sell beauty products.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is engaged in the buying and selling of vegetables and fruits in Estancia, Iloilo.  He is 39 years old, and married with three children aged 4-13. 

His business has been in existence for ten years now. He is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell, such as bananas and mangoes.

Gregorio plans to expand his business so that he can improve the living condition of his family and send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Nancy has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nancy aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Rochile

texts.en:
Rochile, 31, is a married woman with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rochile has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more eggs to sell.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rochile has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is married with two children and operates a motorcycle transportation business. Her husband works as a driver in their motorcycle business to make a living. She has run the transportation business for ten years. Lanie is happy to say that this income helps her family a lot while awaiting the harvest of their crops. She borrowed from GDMPC microfinance to buy spare parts for motor repair. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn has found better ways of making a living by putting up a small sari-sari store in front of her house. She wants to help her family with their living expenses, and also increase their family income to cover her parents' daily needs.  She decided to take out another loan to purchase additional groceries to sell in the community.  Manilyn wants to save more money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies needed in her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
The entire membership of the Asri Lestari group made their recent loan payment on time. They came to the meeting and repaid the loan one by one to the staff of MUK. During the meeting they shared their experiences of keeping pigs. Although some of them had lost piglets because of sickness, they mostly sold them for a high price. To manage their losses, they will sanitize the cages and give more vitamins. One member decided to resign from the group and stop borrowing after she had a satisfactory result, and will continue to keep pigs with her own money.

The Asri Lestari group will continue the loan to increase their pig population and also buy more feed and vitamins. All the members can attend the meeting. Ni Luh is very happy for that. She will use her loan to purchase more piglets, feed and vitamins to make sure the pigs can grow fat, fast and healthy. Finally she can sell them to the buyer for a high price. Ni Luh plans to save all the profit and will use it for capital. Representing the group, Ni Luh said many words of thankfulness to their lenders, Kiva and MUK, for supporting them and encouraging them to become successful women.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a los problemas del conflicto armado no siguió estudiando, es casado, su esposa es empleada doméstica, es padre de 6 hijos, pero 5 hijos viven en Estados Unidos y el otro hijo vive en El Salvador es Lic. en computación y está casado.

Martin, se dedica a trabajar como caficultor desde hace 30 años, aprendió este oficio gracias a sus padres, porque siempre fueron productores de café, antes solo trabajaba sembrando maíz y frijol y por el momento es única actividad que realiza, el lugar donde trabaja está a 3 kilómetros y para llegar lo hace a veces en carro y a veces caminando y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m.

Martin, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de café y para pagar mano de obra, el crédito le ayudara a realizar sus sueños, ya que solo con fondos propios es bien difícil, también generara más ganancias lo que le ayudara a aumentar sus áreas de siembras.

El sueño de Martin, es convertirse en un caficultor potencial en la zona.
texts.en:
Martin, 68 years old, went to school up to the second grade; due to problems from the armed conflict he didn't continue with his education. He is married, his wife is a domestic employee, he is the father of 6 children, but 5 children live in the United States and the other son lives in El Salvador and has a degree in information technology and is married.

Martin has worked as a coffee grower for 30 years, he learned this trade thanks to his parents because they were always coffee producers. Before, he only worked growing corn and beans, and for the moment it is the only work he does. The place where he works is 3 kilometers away and to get there, sometimes he goes by car and sometimes walking, and his schedule is 6:00 am to 1:00 pm.

Martin needs the loan to purchase fertilizers for the coffee crop and to pay labor costs. The loan will help him realize his dreams, since with just his own funds it is quite difficult; he also will generate more earnings, which will help him to increase his planted areas.

Martin's dream is to become a strong coffee grower in the zone.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his coffee crop and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Yesly Graciela

texts.es:
Yesly, de 22 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también trabaja como promotora de salud en una unidad de salud, pero también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como negocio propio y está soltera.

Yesly, tiene 2 años de trabajar como promotora de salud y en ventas de productos de belleza tiene 3 años de experiencia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas, porque su padre se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva maíz y frijoles, de esta manera invertirá el dinero para obtener una mejor cosecha, de al cual venden el 50% y la otra parte es para el consumo de su familia.

El sueño de Yesly para el futuro es, mejorar las condiciones de su casa, porque necesita cambiar totalmente el techo porque está bien dañado.
texts.en:
Yesly, 22 years old, takes care of the household tasks, she also works as a health outreach worker in a health center, but she also works selling beauty products as her own business, and she is single.

Yesley has been working as a health outreach worker for 2 years and, in sales of beauty products, she has 3 years of experience.

The money will be used to purchase agricultural supplies because her father works in agriculture and grows corn and beans, and in this way she will invest the money to get a better harvest, of which he sells 50% and the other part is for the family's consumption.

Yesly's dream for the future is to improve the conditions of the house, because she needs to completely replace the roof because it is really damaged.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Alirio

texts.es: José es muy conocido por los habitantes de un barrio popular del municipio de Barranquilla en donde funciona su distribuidora de Peto,  una bebida derivada del maíz blanco muy fácil de elaborar y que es consumida por tradición en la Región Caribe Colombiana. Tiene ingredientes muy nutritivos como maíz, leche, azúcar y canela, sin embargo hay quienes le dan su toque personal y le adicionan leche de coco y queso en trocitos.  Su motivación para emprender esta microempresa se debió al aprendizaje recibido por un amigo que tenía este mismo negocio y le enseño sobre su manejo, de este modo José no dudo que tendría éxito y comenzó con la producción. Todos los días suministra el producto terminado a sus clientes, quienes lo ofrecen en los diferentes barrios del municipio en triciclos, carretillas y motocarros.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de maíz, leche, azúcar y canela, así mismo invertirá en un nuevo proyecto de negocio una minitienda que surtirá de víveres y abarrotes necesarios para empezar a funcionar. Su meta a futuro es prosperar en su nueva idea de negocio y seguir ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: José is well-known by the inhabitants of a working-class neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla where his peto distribution business is located. It is a drink made of white corn, very easy to make and is traditionally consumed in the Colombian Caribbean region. It has very nutritious ingredients such as corn, milk, sugar and cinnamon, however there are those who give it their personal touch and add coconut milk and pieces of cheese. His motivation to undertake this micro-business was due to the instruction he got from a friend who had the same business and showed him how to run it, in this way José didn't doubt that he would have success and began with the production. Every day, he supplies his end product to his customers, who sell it in the different neighborhoods of the municipality in tricycles, carts and three-wheeled vans. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan, through the intermediary Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in the purchase of corn, milk, sugar, and cinnamon, and also he will invest in a new business project, a mini-store that he will stock with the groceries necessary to begin to function. His goal for the future is to prosper in his new business idea and to continue offering his family well-being.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn, milk, sugar, and cinnamon, and also to invest in a new business project, a mini-store which he will stock with groceries.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer muy entusiasta, creativa y perseverante, tiene 40 años de edad es soltera con tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 12 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad  denominada Santa Catarina Palopó. Manuela para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa desde hace 10 años decidió buscar una actividad que le permitiera obtener ingresos y la actividad que eligió fue la compra y venta de ropa típica, esto  es porque en su comunidad toda la gente viste ropa típica, a Dios gracias este negocio es muy rentable, y con el afán de hacer que siga  creciendo el negocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como fajas, cortes, güipiles y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa,  para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Manuela es contar con un negocio que ofrezca el mejor servicio en la línea de ropa para mejorar sus ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Manuela is a very enthusiastic, creative and persevering woman. She's 40 years old, single, with three children between the ages of 2 and 12. This lovely family lives in a community called Santa Catarina Palopó.

Manuela, to support her husband with the household expenses, 10 years ago decided to look for a business which would allow her to get income and the activity she chose was buying and selling traditional clothing, this is because in her community, all the people wear traditional clothing. Thanks to God, this business is very profitable, and with the desire to make the business continue to grow, she asks for a loan to purchase products such as sashes, skirts, traditional blouses, and everything related to the clothing line, to better satisfy her customers' needs.

Manuela's great dream is to have a business that offers better service in the line of clothing to increase her income and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo era jornalero, pero hace varios años le dio una enfermedad que lo imposibilito para trabajar, es madre de 5 hijos, su primera hija es profesora y está casada, la segunda es licenciada en anestesiología, trabaja en un hospital nacional y está casada, el tercero estudió hasta bachillerato, trabaja en el transporte de carga pesada y está casado, el cuarto estudió hasta bachillerato, trabaja como jornalero y está casado, el quinto está soltero y está estudiando tercer año de agronomía en la Escuela Nacional de Agricultura.

Enma, trabaja en un molino de nixtamal, también tiene un negocio de productos básicos, el molino lo tiene desde hace 14 años y la tienda tiene 2 años de tenerla, decidió colocar estos negocios por iniciativa propia, porque su esposo solo era jornalero y ella quería ayudar también en los gastos del hogar.- Anteriormente, solo se dedicaba a los oficios de la casa.

Enma, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla de pipián, fertilizantes, herbicidas y también pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz y restaurar una parcela de cultivo de pipián, para ello le ayudara su hijo en las labores agrícolas; con la ayuda de este crédito ella podrá comprar insumos y evitar gastos, también podrá mejorar sus cosechas y tener más ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Enma, es que su hijo termine su carrera y que encuentre un trabajo digno, que le permita tener ingresos para tener más estabilidad económica en la familia, también pretende incrementar las producciones para obtener mejores ganancias y así poder comprar vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Enma, 55 years old, went to school up to the third grade. She is married, her husband was a day laborer but a few years he got an illness which made it impossible for him to work. She is the mother of 5 children, her oldest daughter is a teacher and is married, the second has a degree in anesthesiology and works in a national hospital and is married, the third went to school through secondary school, and works in hauling and is married, the fourth went to school through secondary school and works as a day laborer and is single, and the fifth is studying in his third year in the agronomy program at the National School of Agriculture.

Enma works in a corn mill, and also has a business selling basic products, she has worked in the mill for 14 years and has had the store for 2 years, she decided to establish these businesses by her own initiative, because her husband was only a day laborer and she wanted to help with the household expenses as well. Previously, she only took care of the household tasks.

Enma needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as pumpkin seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and also to pay labor costs to plant corn and restore a plot of land with pumpkin cultivation. For this, her son will help with the agricultural labor. With the help of this loan, she will be able to purchase the supplies and avoid expenses. Also, she will be able to improve her harvests and have more income for her family.

Enma's dream is that her son finishes his degree and finds dignified work, which will allow him to have income to have more economic stability in the family. She also plans to increase production to get more earnings and, so, to be able to purchase dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as pumpkin seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, and also to pay labor costs to plant corn and restore a plot of pumpkin cultivation.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza quieren ir mejorando poco a poco.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo es la Sra. Mirtha, es una vendedora muy buena, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene muy bien surtido su negocio. Con mucho sacrificio pudo montar para su mercería y ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pïde este préstamo para poder comprar artículos para su mercería, como ser artículos de bazar, calzados, prendas y otros, para que con ello pueda seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento y a la vez poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The Esperanza 2 group are in their first cycle of the comité de mujeres (Women's Committee) programme. It is a new group, where all the members joined forces to help one another and, through the poverty elimination programme, they want to make gradual progress. One of the group's members is Mirtha, who is a very good saleswoman. She says that things are going well for her as she always has a good stock in her shop. It took a great deal of sacrifice on her part to set up her haberdashery business and her and her family's living conditions have improved. She is seeking this loan to buy goods for her haberdashery business, such as inexpensive items, footwear, clothing, etc. so she can continue to develop her business and, at the same time, help her family.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery goods, such as: inexpensive goods, footwear, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Linderos Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se conformó un grupo de préstamo con el nombre de Linderos; la comunidad a la que pertenecen es muy tranquila y los habitantes se caracterizan por su amabilidad. Las actividades más destacadas de la región son el cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales. 

 Virginia es muy alegre siempre está esta dispuesta a apoyar quien se lo pide; ella tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con Nicolás quien trabaja en la construcción de casas, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando y la más pequeña está a punto de iniciar su educación preescolar en este mes.

 Viki, como le llaman sus conocidos, se dedica a la cría de borregos desde hace 10 años, actividad que inició con la intención de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus niños. Viki comenzó comprando sólo un borrego pequeño, posteriormente comenzó a ahorrar parte se sus ganancias para adquirir un borrego hembra y mejorar sus ganancias.

Ella esta muy agradecida con VFMéxico ya que los préstamos le han ayudado a mejorar la actividad y a hacer realidad sus sueño de tener una casa propia para su familia. Con el nuevo crédito comprará tres borregos más. 

 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Alicia y Leticia quienes inviertirán en una tienda de abarrotes; Paula, Teresa, María Guadalupe, Virginia, Tomasa, Martina y Marcela, en borregos y Francisca principalmente en su tienda de abarrotes.

*La fotografia fue tomada en la casa de Doña Alicia quien tiene el folder en mano y Viki es quien viste el pants verde*
texts.en:
In a community in the state of México, a loan group was formed with the name Linderos. The community they are from is very peaceful and the inhabitants are characterized by their friendliness. The activities that stand out the most in the region are the cultivation of corn and raising animals.

Virginia is cheerful, always ready to support anyone who asks it of her, she is 34 years old, and married to Nicolás, who works in building houses. Together, they have made a family with four children, of whom two are in school and the littlest one is about to begin her preschool education this month.

Viki, as she is called by those who know her, has worked raising sheep for 10 years, work that she began with the intention of supporting her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. Viki began buying only one small sheep, later she began to save part of her earnings to get an ewe and improve her earnings.

She is very grateful to VFMéxico, since with the loans they have helped her to improve her business and make her dream of having her own house for her family come true. With the new loan, she will purchase an additional three sheep.

The other members of the group are Alicia and Leticia, who will invest in a grocery store; Paula, Teresa, María Guadalupe, Virginia, Tomasa, Martina and Marcela in sheep; and Francisca, primarily in her grocery store.

*The photo was taken at Alicia's house, who is holding the folder in her hand, and Viki is the one wearing green pants.*

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es: Nancy a sus 68 años de edad, aún mantiene el legado de su familia al haber participado durante años en la producción de calzado. Cuando tuvo su independencia económica decidió que continuar con esta actividad que le generaría excelentes resultados económicos e inició su microempresa desde la comodidad de su hogar, atendiendo los requerimientos de almacenes ubicados en Ciénaga y Fundación.  Cuenta con 30 años en su negocio y semanalmente viaja a estas poblaciones en búsqueda de pedidos y cobros de facturas. En la actualidad Nancy está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias  primas para su producción.   Esta inversión le permitirá responder a la demanda de sus clientes y le abrirá posibilidades de nuevos mercados. Su meta a futuro es incrementar su capacidad de producción y con las utilidades realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Nancy, at 68 years old, still keeps up her family legacy having participated for years in making shoes. When she had her economic independence, she decided to continue with this work which generates excellent economic results for her and she began her micro-business from the comfort of her home, serving the requirements of the stores located in Ciénaga and Fundación. She has been in her business for 30 years and weekly travels to these places in search of orders and to collect on the invoices. Currently, Nancy is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the raw materials for her production. This investment will allow her to respond to her customers' demand and will open the possibilities of new markets. Her goal for the future is to increase her production capacity and, with the profits, make some repairs on her house.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for her production.

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.en:
Elisabet is a woman who is very interested in business. She is always busy with her business because she is not overly-dependent on her husband to be responsible for the household. 

She now is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin. This will allow her to add to her capital to buy more goods such as cooking oils, noodles, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candies, detergents, coffee, soft drinks, and other things to sell. 

She has plans to open a bigger business in the future. She started her business in 2008 with a capital base of $30.00.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, noodles, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candies, detergents, coffee, soft drink, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Junil

texts.en:
Junil has been selling crabs in the market for many years. He earns well from the business to provide for his family, and has successfully repaid his previous business loan. He was determined to sustain his business here.

Recently, Junil took a new loan to purchase more varieties of crabs to sell. In the future, he wants to improve the business, as well as general living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 36-year-old resident of Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She provides for her child's needs from the little amount of 7,500 PHP she gains monthly from her own hog-raising business. She has had this business for 12 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

Since 2007, however, she's been a member of GDMPC. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microfinance to buy feeding supplies. 

Liezel wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.

Gina has requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for her store, such as canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. Gina has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Gina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her store, such as canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno, de 64 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, es una actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos, creció con sus abuelos quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos valores y principios, que lo han llevado a ser una persona muy educada y reconocida en su comunidad, su familia está formada por su esposa y dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Filomeno, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde que tenía 20 años de edad, motivado por las ganancias que le genera este trabajo, decidió continuar ejerciendo estas actividades y que a lo largo de los años se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, por otra parte su esposa le ayuda económico, pues ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y venta de granos básicos.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar granos básicos para vender, porque poseen una tienda y actualmente la demanda ha crecido, debido a la sequía que sufre el país; de esta forma obtendrá un mejor ingreso y podrá ayudarle para dar una educación adecuada a sus hijos y realizarle mejoras a su casa.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son, tener una tienda amplia y surtida, también otra de las proyecciones que tiene a futuro es, comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladarse y trasladar mercadería hasta su casa, para ser distribuida en su tienda.
texts.en:
Filomeno, 64 years old, works in agriculture and in raising animals, it is work he learned from his grandparents. He was raised with his grandparents who taught him and instructed him in good values and principles, which have brought him to be very well-mannered and recognized in his community. His family is made up of his wife and two children, who are going to school in the community.

Filomeno has worked in agriculture and raising animals since he was 20 years old. Motivated by the earnings that this work generates, he decided to continue doing this work and, over the years, they have become his primary source of income. His wife also helps him economically since she works selling dairy products and selling basic grains.

The money from the loan will be used to purchase basic grains to sell, because they have a store and currently the demand has increased, due to the drought that the country is suffering from. In this way, he will get more income and it will be able to help him provide a good education for his children and make improvements on his house.

The goals that he has for the future are to have a large and well-stocked store, and another of his plans that he has for the future is to purchase a vehicle which will serve to carry him and carry merchandise to his house, to be sold in his store.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains to sell.

loans.name: Herminia De Jesus

texts.es: Hace 11 años que Herminia inicio su negocio de venta de ropa interior de mujer y niños así como también la venta de frijoles cocidos. Su esposo es su apoyo incondicional poco a poco ha ido aumentando su negocio, y por ende sus ganancias. Para atender la amplia demanda de sus clientes Herminia necesita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior de mujer y niños así como la compra de un quintal de frijoles crudos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y al préstamo obtenido podrá mejorar su negocio y su economía.
texts.en: Eleven years ago, Herminia began her business selling lingerie for women and children's underwear and also selling cooked beans. Her husband is her unconditional support and little by little she has been increasing her business and, in the end, her earnings. To meet her customers' broad demand, Herminia needs another loan to purchase women's and children's underwear and also to purchase a quintal of raw beans. Thanks to her efforts, and the loan received, she will be able to improve her business and her economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's underwear and also to purchase a quintal of raw beans.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 34, lives in a small village of Uttar Altagram in Dhupguri, West Bengal. She is a careful mother of three sons and has a great determination to provide them a good education. Being a housewife, she works hard to provide every support to her sons. She runs her grocery shop for financial sustenance of her family and her husband is a daily laborer.

Anita’s eldest son, 17-year-old Ranjan, is studying in grade 12 in Dhupguri High School. He is serious about his studies and tries hard to score good marks in his Higher Secondary Board examination. But Anita faces difficulties to bear the educational expenses of her children after meeting household cost with the inadequate income of the family, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her children. Now Ranjan needs private tuition to score better in the coming Board Exam.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Anita is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans to pay educational fees, buy study materials and engage a good private tutor for her son, so that he can easily continue his studies without any obstacles.

Anita and Ranjan (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay educational fees, buy study materials and engage a good private tutor for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Bhabani

texts.en:
Bhabani is a 26-year-old housewife who lives in a small village, Bagan Bari, in Falakata with her husband, Biswanath, and their two daughters. Bhabani received education up to grade 5 and so has a keen interest to provide better education to her daughters. Her daughters are in grades 7 and 4.

She is a housewife while her husband is a farmer by profession. As a dedicated and responsible mother of two daughters, Bhabani works hard with her husband in agribusiness to support her family. Her husband cultivates various vegetables and sells in the local market. Now to expand their business Bhabani has decided to cultivate cabbage on their farmland because there is a huge demand for cabbage in her local area. So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to start cultivation of cabbage. She will buy good quality cabbage seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm resources to start the new cultivation.

She hopes to upgrade their standard of living, with the profit earned from the business and also provide further education to her daughters to help them become established in their lives.

She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds  and fertilizers for cultivating cabbage.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna, 35, lives in a small village of Purba Magurmari in Dhupguri. She has three daughters; two of them are students and the youngest daughter is a toddler. Her husband does centering work in his local area. His income is very inconsistent and insufficient to bear the educational costs as well as household costs of his family.

Her 12-year-old daughter, Khusi, is studying in grade 6 at Gossairhat R.M, H.S (XII). Being an average student, she is trying her level best to score good marks in her examination. But now she needs guidance of good tutors and study materials. Both Swapna and her husband have great expectations for their daughters, but they can't afford huge educational expenses.

So, being a responsible mother, Swapna is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her daughter Khusi. She plans to use the loan money to pay her school and tuition fees and buy necessary study materials for her daughter. The loan will help this young girl to continue her education without any obstacles.

Swapna and Khusi (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school and tuition fees and buy necessary study materials for her daughter.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, Laxmikanta, and three children (two sons and a daughter) at their own small house in the small village Dalimpur of Falakata, Alipurduar district. She received a primary education up to grade 3. Her children read in class IX, VI and V.

Gita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different types of crops and sells the harvests in the local markets. After managing all domestic work, Gita assists her husband in his farming work. Now they think of cultivating a crop that is cost-effective and has more demand in all seasons. So they have decided to grow paddy rice on their farmland. Having insufficient capital, they need some financial help. So Gita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

They hope it will be a profitable business as the crop has a great demand in the market. It will help this family to a great extent to generate more income for the rest of the year. Her dreams to acquire more farm land in future to increase their agribusiness might be fulfilled with the generated profit.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Josefer

texts.en: Josefer is a young man of 21. He is married from Carles, Iloilo. He is already a father to a baby girl. Josefer drive his pedicab (cycle rickshaw--a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals) for an income. He also sells barbecue and rice in the evening. He is asking for a loan to buy a spare tire for his pedicab, rice, meat, soy sauce, cooking oil, spices and seasoning. Josefer hopes to engage in other business opportunities someday so that he can better be prepared for the needs of his child.

loans.use: to buy buy spare tire for his pedicab, rice, meat, soy sauce, cooking oil, spices and seasoning.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is a 33-year-old lady who lives in a small village of Barogharia in Dhupguri of West Bengal. She is a mother of two sons. Her sons are both students now. Krishna ended her education at grade 3, and so she is willing to provide her sons a good education so that they can lead their lives better.

Krishna is a homemaker and looks after her family all day long while her husband is a driver by profession. His earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their sons after meeting the household costs for their family.

Krishna’s younger son, 15-year-old Bikram, is now studying in grade 9 in Vidyashram D.V. High School (XII), and he is very much serious about his studies. He aims to become a teacher in future. Now he needs the help of private tuition to score good marks in his examination; otherwise he could not proceed further.

Krishna learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her son’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount, she will pay the private tuition fees, school fees and buy necessary educational articles for her son Bikram.

Krishna and her son Bikram are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay private tuition fees, schooling fees and to buy necessary articles for her son’s educational purpose.

loans.name: Merry Ann

texts.en: Merry Ann's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. She is from Guba, Clarin and been farming for 3 years, earning an amount of 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, She joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Keep Cooking, Keep Earning - N21P5Đsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mùi is 36 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling snacks for 6 years. Mùi lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.

The main hardship that Mùi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for cooking and selling breakfast.

This is Mùi first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She uses this loan to buy more items and raise the quantity of snacks, so that she can cover the life cost more easily and gain profit for her family.
Mùi is the leader of N21P5ĐSơn, which consists of 4 members.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for cooking and selling breakfast.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Lorena has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, is a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province, 47 years old and a married mother of six dependent kids, only one among them is in school. To support her living condition, she does rice faming and works for others for a fee to get supplement her income for twelve years. She can earn income about 39,000KHR per day to support the family. These days, it is difficult to earn good income from her crop production because of drought, which causes her crop not to grow well.

Now she is leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. In a group of three, Phan is the group leader. This will be the fifth loan cycle for her. Those previous loans, which were repaid completely, enabled her to support her family’s needs. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fees to increase the productivity of crop. She hopes this loan will help her to earn additional income to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fees to increase the productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Sok Heng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Sok Heng is 31-years-old and a mother of three dependent children. To support her living, she grows rice and works as a harvesting labor for others to get more income. Because of drought, her rice did not grow well. She can save her daily income about 36,400KHR per day which she has been for 13 years.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wisely repaid her past loans which she has used to upgrade her family’s living better than before. She leads a group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion of loan to buy seed and fertilizer to improve on her rice farm to increase her crop yields. She hopes that she can get more income and she wants to buy a decent motorbike to support her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to improve her rice farm to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Bijli

texts.en:
Bijli, 29, is a housewife from Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She has two daughters and one son. Her elder daughter is married after completing her grade 9 education and her other daughter reads in grade 9. Her son is in grade 6. Bijli is a homemaker who manages the household and looks after her children.

Bijli's husband is a van puller. His monthly income is insufficient to cover his family’s needs. Most of his income is spent on the family expenses. Bijli's daughter Bina is a 14-year-old girl who reads in grade 9 in Bairatiguri High School. Recently, she passed grade 8 with average marks. In future, she wants to become a nurse and serve the poor villagers. She is intelligent but now she needs guidance from tutors. Bijli is unable to help her daughter in her education. Bijli and her husband want to give better education to Bina so that she can lead a better life. But their household income is not adequate to meet her all educational expenses.

So Bijli has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. She will use the loan amount to pay tuition fees and pay for school uniforms, a bicycle and books for her daughter. She strongly believes that her daughter will be benefited by these materials and secure good marks in the upcoming exam. She expects this loan will help her daughter's dream come true.

Bijli and Bina (in the photo) both are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and pay for school uniforms, a bicycle and books for her daughter.

loans.name: Omkar

texts.en:
Omkar, 25, is a studious and hardworking man from Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Life was never easy for him. He hails from a poor family and has had access to very limited resources. His family consists of his father, who is a pensioner, an unmarried sister and an old mother.

Being very ambitious, he always wanted to pursue his higher studies but was unable to pursue them because of financial constraints. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amount of 27,600 INR to pursue his Master's in Business Administration from Utkal university, Bhubaneswar.

The loan will help him achieve his goal and find a good job after completion of the course.

Omkar is eagerly awaiting for your kind support.

loans.use: to pursue his Master's in Business Administration.

loans.name: Lipika

texts.en:
Lipika is a married woman of 25 years. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She lives in the small village of Raychenga in Falakata under the Alipurduar district with her husband and two toddler children in their own small mud house.

Lipika’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates many types of crops and sells the harvest in nearby markets. Now they think of cultivating a crop that is profitable and is a round-the-year crop. So they have decided to grow paddy rice on their farmland. But they do not have sufficient capital to invest in their business, so they have decided to take some financial help for farming.

Thus Lipika has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other required farm supplies for paddy cultivation. The loan will significantly help this family to organize their cultivation work for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business and allow them to gain good revenue as the crop has a great demand in the local area. She wants to develop their agribusiness with the profit and provide good education to her children.

She is grateful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sunati

texts.en:
Sunati, 40, lives in a small village of Dhupguri in West Bengal. She is a careful mother of a daughter and a son. She has a great determination to provide her children a decent lifestyle with good education. Thus she works hard to provide every support to her daughters. Her son reads in grade 12 and her daughter is pursuing her bachelor's degree. Sunati’s husband runs a small tea stall; his income is marginal and it is the only source of income of the family.

Sunati’s daughter, 23-year-old Niti, is continuing her bachelor's degree in arts from Jalpaiguri A.C. College. She is in her first year. She wants to become a social worker in future; thus, she has chosen the relevant subjects like sociology to reach to her goals. She is serious about her studies and tries to score good marks in her examination. But Sunati faces difficulties to bear the educational expenses of her daughter after meeting the household costs and educational expenses of her son with the sole income of her husband. Now Niti needs some books for her studies and a bicycle to go to college and tuition classes.

Hence Sunati is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She plans to pay all the educational fees, buy books and a bicycle for her daughter. This loan will help this bright young young woman continue her education without any obstacles.

Sunati and Niti (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay all the educational fees and buy books and a bicycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 59 years old, married and has 3 children to provide for.  She was able to send her children to school - his husband is also a farmer.  He is the one who helps her in running the business. She owns a farm where she plants a variety of vegetables and sells them to the market. She aims to increase her income because of the rising price of commodities nowadays.  So she decided to take a loan again to purchase fertilizer for the farm, so that she can be able to produce good quality vegetables and to satisfy the needs of her customers  and deliver more vegetables for more income. Norma's plan for the future to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Jhon Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Jhon Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jhon Carlos is still working in his transport business. He is a hardworking man, and through this work he wants to get his family ahead. His dream is to buy a new car.

He is applying for this loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy for the loan, and committed to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata, 24, hails from a small village of the Puri district in Odisha, India. She is a charming and industrious lady with a lot of aspirations. Her family consists of her mother, her father, a brother and two sisters. Her family condition is not financially sound enough, so she had to face a lot of hardships in her life. But her immense patience and perseverance never allowed her to break down.

She had always dreamt of pursuing higher studies. That is why she is requesting a loan amount of 27,600 INR to pursue her Master's in Business Administration in Utkal University. The loan amount will help her fulfill her dream of being a highly educated woman and will help her get a job.

Mamata is in dire need of your kind help. She has a future plan to get a good job and get settled with her family and lead a happy life with them.

loans.use: to pursue her Master's in Business Administration.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marisa is 49 years old now.

Marisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish and other supplies to use in her business.

Marisa has been in this business for one year. In the futures she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for making clothes.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Thida, a widowed woman of 41, is a mother of three kids who lives in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. Raising pigs has been her main business for 27 years. Thida is also working as a laborer to supplement the family’s income. Her pigs have not grown well and some got sick, so that she can only earn a little income.

This is Thida’s fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid all past loans completely. With the previous loans, she improved her lifestyle and now has enough house supplies to use.

As the group leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy more piglets and pig feed for her business.

She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed for her business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Hoklakkena

texts.en:
Hoklakkena is 20 years old, a single student who resides in Kratie province in Cambodia. Currently, she is studying management in her third year at a university in the province. Her parents are grocers.

Hoklakkena is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI because she needs the financing to pay for her university fees for the third and fourth years.

After graduation, she hopes to find a good job with a decent salary and to renovate her parents’ house.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees for the third and fourth year.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
Sitora was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is married and has one baby. Her husband works at the railway station as a porter. Sitora is one of active clients at IMON and makes repayments on time. She was interested in sewing since her childhood. She likes her activity much and has permanent orders every day. Her basic task is tailoring traditional Tajik women dresses. Recently, she is teaching girls how to sew.

She applied to IMON to get a loan to be treated at an endocrinology center. She hopes to be healthy again and continue her lovely activity. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to be treated at an endocrinology center.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is separated from her husband and has three children to provide for. She is the only one providing for the needs of her children. She owns and has been operating her farm just to earn a living. She has to support the needs of her family's daily expenditures, aside from farming. She also has to send her children to school.

Recently, she took a new loan to pay for the farm labor and to purchase fertilizer for her business.

Jeneth's plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ivanis María

texts.es: Ivanis, con una sonrisa en sus labios recuerda que su cónyuge fue el promotor de su proyecto de negocio y que gracia a ello, hoy en día genera recursos adicionales para el bienestar de su familia.  Día tras día, realiza visitas a sus clientes y les ofrece las nuevas colecciones de jeans, suéteres y calzado deportivo de marcas extranjeras, los cuales son muy apetecidos por sus clientes porque se adaptan muy bien a la anatomía de los pies permitiendo una sensación de confort y descanso.  Con la finalidad de responder oportunamente a las solicitudes de pedidos de sus clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir nuevos modelos de jeans, suéteres y calzado deportivo.  Lo que más le gusta a Ivanis de su trabajo es que puede estar al pendiente de sus tres hijos menores de edad y al mismo tiempo generar recursos.  Su meta de negocio es que en este semestre del año duplique sus ventas y su meta familiar es comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
Ivanis, smiling, says that it was her husband who first supported her business, which now allows her to provide her family with extra income. She offers her customers, who come daily, the latest collections of jeans, sweaters and sneakers from foreign brands. These are highly regarded by her customers as they adapt well to the foot and are comfortable to wear.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) in order to be able to respond quickly to the demands of her customers, and offer them the newest styles of jeans, sweaters and sneakers.

The thing she most enjoys about her job is that she is able to take care of her three young children while earning money at the same time. Her business goal is to double her sales in the second half of the year, and her goal for her family is to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to stock new models of jeans, sweaters and sneakers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods, etc.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods, etc

loans.name: Ruth Yory

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años, y su negocio es la panadería tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, constante, positiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que surgió a raíz de unas graves inundaciones en donde numerosas familias quedaron sin sus hogares y fueron asentadas en este barrio marginal. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ruth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro con canas, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional, las variedades de panes más comunes son; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), y otros, “trabajamos muy temprano desde la madrugada para tener el pan listo a primera hora de la mañana, para producir más rápidamente necesito una máquina amasadora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina amasadora para amasar la masa de pan antes de moldearlo y hornearla. Su sueño es ampliar su panadería, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina amasadora para amasar la masa de pan antes de moldearla y hornearla. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina amasadora para amasar la masa de pan antes de moldearlo y hornearla.
texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old, married, has two children ages 10 and 15, and she has a traditional bakery business.

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, consistent, positive, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the “plan 3000” area, which arose after severe floods left many families without their homes and they were relocated to this shantytown. The area has a warm subtropical climate with temperatures during the day that range from 21 to 35 Celsius.

Ruth has a dark complexion, brown eyes, black hair with traces of gray, and a short, medium physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which her family speaks; and she speaks Spanish since it is the common tongue there, which she uses in her business.

She shares her life with her husband who makes a living in trade, and with their children who are studying in school. They live in their own home built of brick and cement, with a tin roof and ceramic flooring. It has water, electricity and plumbing to the sewer.

Ruth’s business is that of a traditional bakery, her most popular varieties of breads include: Cuñapé (a small bun made of cassava flour and cheese), rice empanadas (baked rice and cheese), wheat cakes (hard wheat flour buns), and others. Ruth says, "We work very early, from pre-dawn, to get the bread ready first-thing. To produce faster I need a kneading machine …”

The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a kneading machine to knead the dough before shaping and baking it. Her dream is to expand her bakery. She wants to buy a kneading machine to knead the dough before shaping and baking it. This is her first loan sequence with Emprender, in her 10 years dedicated to this activity.

It is for these reasons that Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase a kneading machine to knead the dough before shaping and baking it.

loans.use: to purchase a kneading machine to knead her dough before shaping and baking it.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los animales . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Feliciana continues her business raising animals. She is an enterprising, hardworking woman, and through this business she would like to help her family get ahead. Feliciana's dream is to have a location where she can sell the animals. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Feliciana is happy to have this loan, and is committed to meeting the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Florah, who is a mother of two and has been practicing agriculture for the last 5 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is known for maize plantations for export and for local consumption. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meagre income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Florah. She also keeps a dairy cow.

Before joining Juhudi Kilimo, Florah could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Musemwa self-help group. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva.

Florah is seeking a loan for constructing a cow shed and to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Florah will introduce zero grazing (an environmentally sound method of cattle care) and purchase more effective modern tools that will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Florah waits for your kindness.
Support this great smallholder farmer who is not deterred by difficulty so that she can achieve a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace, a fifty-two-year-old hard working, married woman, living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy more farm inputs for her coffee plantation. Her main business is currently cattle fattening alongside farming, where she earns a income. She started this business to look after her family and educate her children. She has hardships of competition, pests and diseases and inadequate capital to buy farm inputs. However, her vision is to own a big animal farm and modernized coffee plantation in her area.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 64 years old and he lives in Senaki district with his wife, son and pensioner mother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows, 2 calves and 2 pigs. In addition they have a hectare of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. Arnold is a very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. The family sells produced cheese and harvested nuts and maize locally.

Arnold wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for trading business. With the received credit he will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and will resell at higher price. Arnold will have a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Freedom 2 Group

texts.en:
The freedom group was formed in Teshie in greater-Accra. There are six active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. They are into the sale of pastries, slippers, green peppers, cutlery, fried yams and chicken.

Regina has taken a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is standing at the extreme right in the photo. She is about 35 years old and lives with her small family consisting of her husband and two children.

Regina has been engaged in a green pepper business from door-to-door for the last 10 years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through this business, she earns good monthly income. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence plan to improve her business over the course of the loan, which will result in her taking the loan and purchasing a huge quantity of green peppers which she will sell to customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and to provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to  purchase a huge quantity of green peppers which she will sell to customers.
